kpHCYPuOPAwvpObb7JvAsQ.text: My boyfriend and I went to Paul Martin's for the first time this evening. We were excited to try something new, but received the worst service I have ever experienced. It took a long time for the waitress to take our drink order. My boyfriend waited 20 mins to get his beer. After sometime we noticed tables around us had received complimentary bread, but none was offered to us. We had to ask. From the time we ordered our entrees it took us an hour to receive our meal. In this time a family of 4 was seated next to us. They ordered, received their meals and paid for their meals and we were still waiting. The food was not worth the wait. Our side salads were lettuce with approximately 5 grape tomatoes. The fish was over cooked. Our bill was very overpriced for the quality of food and service we received. We will not be returning or recommending this restaurant.

bXuvZz47zXa8D7wC7UcNpQ.text: We will not go back. Let's start with the music; totally inappropriate. Music should be more piano bar type instead of rock music. Most of the servers uniforms were too small and their bellies were all hanging out. We received three thin slices for two people. Really chintzyh! The house dressing was so spicy our lips were on fire through the dinner. The chocolate ice cream was gritty! I didn't like it. The salt shaker was a paper salt shaker?? I'd spend the extra money and go to Chart House.

nYoIclLPoRv5V40bSBIZLA.text: Will not return to this restaurant.  Food is a big disappointment and management is overbearing and pushy. We waited over 30 minutes for food.  When we sat down 6 olives and some almonds were placed on table for 8 people.  After we ordered meals 6 slices of bread were delivered.   Mushroom  soup served cold, French Dip is ok (better in New River) and Prime Rib is fatty with a pile of mashed potatoes.  The best was the salad, but it only had several varies of lettuce in it, but dressing was good.   Can find good salads in many other places close by,  will not recommend to friends.  Prices are on the high side even for Scottsdale.  Waiter was best part.  He knew the dishes and was attentive to needs.   He deserves a 4 or 5 for his service and the handicap he works with the quality and management.

vGa2G0f5KjFdPIwX7sCvXg.text: First time yelp review, precipitated by a horrible dining experience. To be brief, here are the facts. Reservation made for 7:15, seated @ 7:45. Service so incompetent, we had to flag down another member of the wait staff to take our order; so all we have on the table is water @ 1 hour after our reservation. When dinner finally arrived, we hit the trifecta. Reservation not honored, lousy service, and the piece de resistance, crappy food. Would of given a zero star rating if I could, so buyer beware.

GAYyksr9ajA24wpY5qlaCg.text: The happy hour has a great menu at a fair price. The service was great as well. The only thing that I was a bit disappointed in was that the happy hour is only in the bar area and the bar is very small with a few 4 seat high tables and two community tables. I have never really been a fan of the community tables. But overall the experience was great and the food was yummy.

PSXC3EiqE0pS3zTaitcQYA.text: Ok before I get started, I should point out that my 2 star review is solely based on the length of time waiting for the main entree to arrive (to which Paul Martin DID make up for that!) Yes, this place is about 2 weeks old and some of the wait staff (at least where we were seated, on the patio) seemed to be very new.  No problem...I've been a newbie before too.  Our server was a little over the top with the constant mispronunciation of "beautiful", he kept saying "bootiful" and he kept reaching over us to remove empty dishes from the table; he just needs a little more training and seasoning and he'll be fine. The appetizer was a grill artichoke that we shared and it came with this great tasting garlic, pesto and basil aioli.  We devoured that in a short period of time. Next, we split the French Dip sandwich; the meat was a little too fatty and even though we split the dip, I mean c'mon Paul Martin, you can spare a decent amount of the au jus, can't 'cha??  The au jus was served in this way too small and too deep Japanese teacup-like container which it made it difficult to "dip" our French dip.  The horseradish/mayonnaise dip was creamy and good, pretty standard.  The shoestring fries was done well and crispy. We also had the mac and cheese that had pieces of prosciutto in it and it was a unique taste, the broiled top was nice and crunchy! With that being said, our wait time after we got the appetizer was way too long and appeared isolated however that is my biggest pet peeve is the food took too  long AND it seems that I am the one who has to recognize it and point it out to the staff.  Once I let the server know that it's taking a long time, it was then he let his manager know.  Manager addressed us and was nervous about approaching us (he seemed to be a young and new manager as well) and he did his best in explaining the situation but it was painful watching him stumble (ok, not so painful as amusing).   When the food did arrive, it did come out nice and hot so that was a plus!  They also comped our meal as a way of apologizing for the delay.   A golf clap for the food...and since they showed that in the end it is about customer satisfaction, we are going to try Paul Martin again.

C16lWhf9S7RWQ4XPxAfICA.text: We came here for the first time for lunch during Spring Training. The food was great!  It was also nice to know that they make everything from scratch and use local ingredients. We had the kale Caesar salad, wild mushroom soup and the grilled salmon sandwich with sweet potato fries. Everything was great and very tasty. Service was also great. They accidentally served regular fries with the sandwich and they immediately apologized and brought out a basket of sweet potato fries. Definitely recommended and we will be back.

iBe5F-Rb2UX3aYvNjkkXMg.text: We had a great experience going here for our anniversary. The food was amazing!  We ordered the shrimp, fish tacos, and spare ribs. All were fabulous. Plus the servers were very attentive and kind. We would definitely go back!

5rplC7GgFcnlrRbz9wOoiQ.text: My husband had a hamburger and I had the polenta and vegetable dish with chicken.  We also ordered grilled cauliflower.  It was all very good.  And the waiter was charming.  Will go back next time we are in town.

y2e2-c7AKyFj8f7DfY5iVw.text: Flew in from Houston today and decided to check out this restaurant for dinner.  The hostesses were very friendly and suggested the $49 Monday night special that includes 2 salads, 2 entrees, and a bottle of wine. Awesome deal! Our server Angelo was great and the food was incredible.  We highly recommend the cedar plank salmon and the shrimp pasta dish.

LPud999hI9hFrKpEnqI6WQ.text: Very disappointed. Just returned from dining here, while the interior is very well done, to say the food is unforgettable in an understatement and the service was worse. Ordered a well whiskey and a glass of house cab, was surprised when the bill came that well whiskey is $12, I would hate to see what call liquor was priced at. Our waiter, Joe S, did not bring any bread to the table yet every other table we could see was getting it. We ordered the salmon, wife said it was dry and I had the cheese burger medium, it was way overcooked, brown all the way through. The mac and cheese also had some odd flavor to it. Waiter didn't come back to ask if we wanted another drink until we had finished eating, when he did I ask for a glass of water. He proceeded to bring a pitcher of water to the table and pour it in my empty whiskey glass??? The bus boy was the highlight of the evening, efficient, friendly, polite, he made the only good impression of the meal. Unfortunately no manager was available or I would have voiced my complaint while I was in the restaurant. Won't waste my time going back.

b0L66zpP7rGYk5G-Zh8JMg.text: What a let down, Martin's quality falls well short of their pricing.  Ribeye might be one step above Applebee's.  Order a $40 ribeye and one would expect quality, instead you're  greeted with a grainy borderline New York cut.  They preach "free range", "locally grown", and "made from scratch" all catchy tag lines, but they don't match what is served on your plate.  Save your money, and try elsewhere.

5qcCPxKiIbW9WPNHGI8uEw.text: Great experience  every time we go to Paul Martin's! Food is excellent, staff is friendly and attentive and atmosphere is  appealing.

weLrfXLEOsfIyBhrS3-_vQ.text: What a breath of fresh air....not only is the food amazing but the staff....wow. Made me feel like family.

u5MiUJO5lz5TgxZku0mC0A.text: We had a good lunch. The difference between 4 and 5 stars was primarily the cost for a simple lunch with wine. I think it is a bit expensive for the selection and particularly the wines. The cheapest attractive entrees were $11 and the cheapest red wine was $9 (I bought a good wine for $10.)  I had tacos and they were good. Friend had burger and cheapest alternative was $13 but he says it was good. Both had salad which was good but on a hot plate. Excellent wine list by the glass though expensive. Beer list interesting but I didn't check prices. Good waiter and good assistants

V3VUC4wsfp1rxHU2Y9Qj4A.text: We went here with our kids and our particular mom. The staff was amazing and so accommodating. The food was delicious and fast. We will definitely go back!

TyDD7LxJnhsxw_YOLdC6RQ.text: We visited Paul Martin's for dinner on Friday night.  The ambiance of the restaurant was very nice; the food pretty good but on the expensive site.  The service, however, was terrible.  While our waiter was nice, we had to wait painfully for him to take our drink order followed by a painfully long wait to receive our drinks followed by a painfully long wait for our appetizers followed by a painfully long wait for salads followed by a painfully long wait for entrees and dessert.  A lot of staff attention was focused on those in the bar nursing a drink for two hours and splitting an appetizer among many.  In short, the food was good but not exceptional; fairly expensive and the service terrible.  With all the other great alternatives in Scottsdale, I don't know that we will be back.

csIgp8RqHmc7Jg9A_9YV_A.text: Need a NEW menu that describes what you are serving people!  Butter salad was all field greens with a couple pieces of butter lettuce.  Quinoa and bulgar wheat side dish was mostly arugula with a little quinoa.  Salmon was served dry and overcooked.  I had to cut it with a knife!  Noisy.  Came home hungry!

3OMgrjXheYmOQcXbeZBF9g.text: We decided to try this place Monday as we knew it changed. Got seated right away and our waiter came quickly. Nice gentleman named Michael. Very pleasant. He explained Monday night was $49 wine/dinner night for two. We could pick ANY entree and any bottle of wine that had a box next to it. Along with that was two salads included. We were "confused." HAHA We were excited that we stumbled onto such a great deal. We selected a bottle of AZ wine which cost more then the deal deal, but again, it was included! The salads were local, organic greens with champagne vinaigrette. Very fresh and nice size serving. We had the Chimichurri Hanger Steak that came with perfect shoestring fries and they were hot! Nice compliment to the perfectly cooked steak. We also tried the St Louis Style Ribs with corn on the cob. Ribs we tasty, not dry. The corn had a little too much cheese but it was good. The manager, Claude checked on us twice and we told him we would be back and how the service is impeccable and the food delish! There was also another manager who came by as well. They made sure our dining experience was a good one and it was. We will be back on a Monday. Best deal on town!

X03clAR7iQQ5C64272XBYg.text: Had a really nice anniversary dinner with my husband.  The service was great, atmosphere nice, a little loud, but it was a Saturday night.  The food was spot on...fresh, tasty and came quickly.  They even gave us a desert for our occasion.  We'll definitely go back with friends for a nice night out.

idU1k7LHRJLZwwUiCp-chA.text: I had the pleasure of previewing Paul Martin's for lunch last week, before their official opening to the public...  I met my friend Gelie and we had a pleasant, leisurely, and filling experience.  As to be expected with any new restaurant, it seems that the hostess / front area is still working on greeting, seating, confirming reservations, etc... but the great thing is that PMAG seems to have a ton of staff, so I'm hoping they will all "get it" in due time.  Between Gelie and I, we tried the Chicken Tortilla Soup, the Kale Caesar salad, the Fish Tacos, the Mushroom Burger, and the Banana Cream Pie.  Nothing we had was to die for, but it was all tasty.  The service was attentive, ambiance comfortable, and I was pleased to see that despite being a chain (there are currently six California locations), they keep it local by using seasonal products from Valley farmers and purveyors including Black Mesa Ranch, Crow's Dairy Farm, Schreiner's, Hayden Mills, Queen Creek Olive Mill, and more... Their menu isn't overwhelming, but there's a decent amount to choose from.    When I return, I hope to try the artichoke appetizer and perhaps the Greek Salad with prawns and/or the Bistro Burger.  (Gelie and I actually missed that the Three Mushroom Burger we ordered was a mushroom patty and not a beef patty!)  We ate it anyways; who doesn't need more veggies?!  Paul Martin's took over the location where J Alexander's used to be... I hope they stick around for awhile!

Very courteous and professional knows all answers about the drinks and food n is very attentive and knows his job and does an excellent job at it. Keep up the great work guys!

dUHeiRzUvEBaLnJxgKU--g.text: One of the Best burgers  in town, in addition to phenomenal customer service.  Love love love this place!

z2D7uj1miNkabYj1NLqSsw.text: I gave 3 stars not for service or food that was all great. We had a group of 5 girls an we choose a different restaurant every month to try something new an get together. We look for great happy hour which they had, except not when you are eating in the dining room. Our waitress was kind enough to ask the manager if we could take part, they kindly said yes. We also look for pricing, yelp states it $$, which is what we look for as well but clearly it should of been $$$-$$$$ range. The food an our server Hannah B were awesome!
