GZzU1e9ZZHgVQkl7XhKfBw.text: My Husband and I were looking at different restaurants to have a small rehearsal dinner for family coming out of town. We so happened to stop at Paul Martin's for lunch and Clyde took great care of us from beginning to end- We knew this was a great place to bring our out of state friends and family. The day of the rehearsal dinner Clyde continued to take care of us and he made sure everything was perfect. We were so satisfied with the food and service that we continue to go back and bring the family to eat at Paul Martin's.

NQa848fNlMyij5t8fCC-jQ.text: Came here with family for my Mom's 87th Birthday. The food was amazing and our server (wish I had gotten his name ) was so friendly and really made our celebration a special one!!'

hqXrsC5mjbQOitsdwciNJw.text: Ate here last night for the first time. Had a 7:30 reservation but the manager  let us know right away that he was just waiting for a table to clear out. Turned out to be longer than expected so he graciously set us up outside on a couch with drinks and appetizers. Not something you see much anymore. We sat down around 8::30. Our waiter was great and the manager made sure to check on us. My husband had the fish tacos and they were great! Drinks were always poured! We will be back in the future. Again, thanks to the restaurant for taking care of the longer wait.

WoUT5slSZ8BBUHcL_FIbvw.text: Came for lunch and sat on on the patio. Great salad options and a few $12. 00 lunch options. Great atmosphere and service. They have a very popular happy hour from 3:00-7:00pm and a couple nights of price fixed dinners like prime rib on Sunday and fried chicken dinner on Monday. They have Meyer lemons trees that line the patio and they are used in there cocktails.

uIGJ7rfd0bZhVnRHPi7gpg.text: Paul Martin's was a great experience for me. The place is very airy and semi-bright. I love the style/decor throughout.   Staff were all pleasant and adorned with smiles. The manager addressed the table a couple of times, when is always a nice gesture.   I had the pork chop, which was phenomenal! After a couple of bites, I was sold on the salmon too! The banana creme pie was not worth all the hype. The bananas were brown and very mushy...not what I'm accustomed to. But all and all, Paul Martin's is a great place for a first date, to catch up with friends, or to unwind with your significant other. It tends to get pretty busy, so make reservations!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana creme pie

ZI52b9cDq4N-n0g3QtCJ0Q.text: This was our first time at Paul Martins and it did not disappoint! The salad was fresh and delicious. My husband and I both ordered the Halibut as per recommendation from our waitress and she was spot on. I think this was the best halibut I have ever had. It was very lightly blackened in a light cream sauce surrounded by asparagus and grilled cherry tomatoes. The tomato's were sweet as sugar! The fish was cooked perfectly. I especially liked that there was no starch on the plate. I could have ordered it separately if I wanted. The service was great and we loved the atmosphere, definitely a place that you can bring the family. Not stuffy at all. I must say we will be returning soon!

FVEZlm9fIE-lcKAWjfAjIA.text: Quality food with excellent service consistently.  Try the burger or the salt and pepper shrimp both delicious.

-4NLaOD83qGADIiBkgnDpA.text: Wow. Just amazing. We drove by the restaurant and decided to have dinner here. The food is excellent. I ordered the skirt steak and my boyfriend got the house special of friend chicken, corn and red potato salad. We also ordered a bottle of Hangtime (Pinot Noir) which was well chilled.   The atmosphere and decor is top notch. Very relaxed and well decorated. The wait staff is attentive. Picking up plates when appropriate and refilling glasses when needed. They are also very knowledgeable.   The GM stopping by is also to enquirer about our dinner was a welcoming experience.   I would recommend this place 100%. We will be coming back and also look forward to it!

_EEUs0Dl4Qg5pEToKxi1XA.text: MEDIOCRATY PERFORMED WITH AVERAGE PRECISION  After reading multiple reviews and hearing the buzz about Monday happy hours, this was the destination for a night out with the wife and good friends.  My wife and I arrived a good 20minutes early but our reserved table was free so the hostess sat us at the table instead of the bar.  We sat at the table a solid ten minutes before our server showed to offer a drink and app.  We figured that this delay was attributable to four menus/place settings but only two people.  At this point we informed the waiter that we intended to run a decent bar bill and take Uber home.  It was disappointing that the waiter did not really demonstrate any mastery of the wine list or even beers available so rather than trying new things we settled for standards and ordered the artichoke appetizer.  Drinks were prompt and our guests arrived as the appetizer showed.  The artichoke was flavorful with good grill char and nicely subtle mayo-based sauce.  But, the waiter forgot to take our guests' drink order.  I wanted to wash the oil from the artichoke off my hands so I got up and then tracked the waiter to order the women a bottle of wine and the men another round of porters.  When I returned the waiter was at the table with the vintner but wrong grape.  I had ordered a Chardonnay but he presented us a Pinot Noir.  At least he didn't open the bottle ahead of presenting it.  I wrote everything above as a draft over a month ago.  After seeing that I never completed it, I was faced with a choice to try and recall or delete.  I thought I would be True to the intent so I looked up the menu to refresh my memory of the meal.  That didn't work...which speaks to the so-so nature of the whole experience.

GCbQ81Zrx1-aCBNUGy8I5Q.text: Ordered from this place for delivery. Ordered a Beef Dip sandwich and it was great! Best au jus I've had in a while, very flavorful. Sandwich was good texture and not soggy. Fries were shoestring with potato skin still on it and lightly seasoned - perfect me for that's how I like them! Not too greasy. Food arrived well packaged with the fries and sandwich separate. I'd order from here again and I'll definitely visit the restaurant for a proper meal in the future.

NfvpXoRf_PvtQhX1o3vXvg.text: Good steelhead and blackened redfish.  Good Regular ice cream.  Wish I didn't have to ask for a refill in iced tea all the time.  Don't order that marshmallow vanilla ice cream dessert. Nice room in back for 8 people.  Quieter.

3q7KpE_kYW2_wiMFrKtvAw.text: We had a phenomenal waitress, Kathie, she was very attentive and professional despite how busy the restaurant was.  Everything was exceptional! I had the Hanger Steak with Chimichurri and mashed potatoes, this is the first time I have ever had hanger steak cooked to perfection and juicy. Shocker! My husband had the Salmon fish tacos WOW! they were delicious, I'm not sure what kind of sauce they had but it was wonderful.  As if I hadn't already ate enough I got the Chocolate Cake with a double espresso, this was the BEST chocolate cake I've ever had. I would return just for the chocolate cake! The cake itself is moist and chocolatey without being too much and the FROSTING yummmm! So much for me not liking cake or chocolate much!?

kDPgCcVrq68TzkbKMw865Q.text: We love this restaurant! It's beautiful, has a great patio, has amazing food, and amazing service. Why can't every restaurant have it together like this? I've never had a bad meal at this establishment or questionable service. The menu is varied enough to be interesting and everything is delicious!!

OFNu72ODIZO40ObnsI9S6g.text: This place seems to have lost some spark since my last visit which was probably over a year ago. I had difficulty finding a menu item that looked appetizing and the value per item just wasn't there. I expected resort expensive but I left unsatisfied and felt like I paid too much. The service was adequate. The food tasted fine. The atmosphere lacked energy. I probably won't come back.

iQLgxfx172AwBLZsIx5tNg.text: Went in for Happy Hour tonight on a "blind date" Paul our server was awesome! Food and drinks were great too!

4aM4jnnwa7uJBfXBLN2R5A.text: Taco Tuesday here rocks! Yes, the tacos are small but they are DELISH! They offer, salmon, beef (my two favorites) and pork for $2 each. They come on fresh, wonderfully chewy corn tortillas and you can order as many or a few as you like. They also have specials on margaritas made with house-made sweet & sour. I almost always get heartburn from margaritas, but not these, they are quality. This deal is only offered in the bar, but it lasts all day and night.   Their happy hour is also a great deal and I love the steak salad for lunch.

5PeauLuFt6FlfZg6MqtysQ.text: I was between a four and five star review about #PaulMartins however the gracious service of the manager, Clyde swayed me towards a five star review.  Our meal was fabulous, the waiters were knowledgeable of their way variety menu and offered prompt service.  We began on dinner by ordering a bottle of their Cabinet listed on their Happy Hour menu. The wine was fabulous but I forget the name of the wine. I like wine but I nowhere near a wine expert.  After the wine was opened we order a dozen of the mixed oysters. The oysters were received with mixed review. Some types of oysters were definitely found more tasty than others.  I enjoyed a delicious bowl of mushroom soup. I love mushrooms and my bowl of soup did not disappoint- bravo to the chef for this delightful starter.  My husband and sister both were happy were their choice of salads.  My entree was a mouth watering generous portion of tasty ribeye surround by creamy mash potatoes. An entree of fresh salmon was inhaled by my husband and my sister took delight in each bite of her New York Steak. The New York Steak was served with favorable cauliflower. We finished our meal with three bailey's coffees and several desserts. I am usually not a big fan of ice cream for dessert but the sea salt caramel ice cream lingered with favor.  The meal came to a close and the bill arrived.  It was a pricey meal. However, every higher end restaurant is expensive. We all agreed the fabulous dinner was well worth the price. We will be back.  As a side note, the restaurant had a terrific vibe and good energy.

Q5dmHRSWYJ0PwHFawHkjAQ.text: Happy Hour here this evening.  Food and service were very good.  Nice place.  I'd return with no hesitation.

LzgE60DjMOSuOCH2OZZXbA.text: Had a great lunch today. Always a comfortable environment.  What was really outstanding was our server, Courtney.  He was terrific.  Make sure you order the Mushroom Soup...it's a winner, as well as many other things on the menu.

kKg27SAlPzs7Rma4W6X7MA.text: My husband and I stopped in to eat at Paul Martins tonight. He had the ribeye, which was the best steak ever. I had the fish tacos that were served with fresh cilantro, radish, and tomatoes; along with aoli sauce. They were delicious. Our service was excellent! The bread was whole grain and served warm. Irresistable....

Kv5O7cGz49yA2weTOlT9Iw.text: What can I say?   Desserts is amazing.  Not too sweet.  . Housemade Eggnog was delicous.   Dustin was a great server.  :)

YIk78G__Uu6E2-1X286gaQ.text: Came here with a friend for a business dinner. It was an excellent choice. We started out with the artichoke appetizer which I never had before and was absolutely fantastic.   Our server, Amy L was great. She recommended an excellent red wine, the Educated Cabernet was delicious. I had the braised pork rib for dinner and this was so tender and juicy and succulent, it was a game changer!  No need for a knife at all. Finish things off with the banana cream pie for dessert.

oN2QfdzUakuaqoNKA0u6DQ.text: Superb Service, Excellent food  Outstanding atmosphere. A Gem

LbX_e6pRfv142-S_bcEi-w.text: Decided to come here after walking out of another place. I'm so glad we stopped here! There are not enough words to describe how amazing this establishment is!  We sat outside,  beautiful lighting,  perfect setting, comfortable lounging chairs and sofas, as well as elegant tables for 4. They select organic produce, free ranged and hormone free proteins,  and they have gluten free options!  Our waitress was amazing! She actually reviewed the menu with us! She let me sample wine before I purchased and she catered to our every need! Even one of the managers came to check on us! This was in celebration of an important event for my mother, and Paul Martin exceeded my expectations! We will most definitely be referring everyone and coming back on a regular basis!!!

dZq9WlDKjBxZjUZEvkoWOg.text: Really good food. Went in for lunch on Monday for the wine dinner for two special. Good deal for the money. Regular prices are too high for how small the portions are in my opinion. I had to send my steak back due to being undercooked but everything else was fine. Server was very attentive and thorough. I'd recommend it but not unless you're going for a well priced deal.

ImXe5N98fUrBIT-ba6pw7A.text: I was quite impressed with the service, but the food put me over the top! Everything at this restaurant is all natural, made at the restaurant. Nothing is frozen and you can tell, the food was phenomenal, I will definitely be back!

EdftfkrIwWe5EQa2O21zqA.text: 1st time eating here and everything was delicious!  Started with the salt n pepper shrimp as an appetizer.  Enjoyed the warm hand towels they brought out after.  Skirt steak and cedar plank salmon were both AMAZING!  Mac n cheese was good, my least favorite of everything... Banana creme pie for desert had a small layer of chocolate on the crust.  Will be back for sure!

zb9c_FH61l8WvLWHMyDouw.text: We went on a Monday night and it was packed! The food was amazing! I had the Salmon with Brussels sprouts - yum. i loved it! and my friend had the braised ribs and those were delicious as well . loved it , cant wait to go back!!!

BA0OuwtbIUbvsJkPxKygEA.text: Great service and atmosphere, as well as a decent drink menu.  But, the food was awful!!!The table bread was obviously recently removed from the freezer, and the balsamic vinegar had turned sour. The French dip from any Arby's is a masterpiece compared to their $19 cold,tiny,boring sandwich.  The macaroni and cheese... Save your money.

52OTww9z7-7QY1he-3Mi1g.text: Great restaurant service excellent! Best mushroom soup ever!!!! Clean professional with class!!!!! Try it worth it!

ekxPueUoC_ucLdhxcxmYCw.text: Very impressive restaurant. The service staff are extremely attentive, the food is excellent. We love sitting at the bar for happy hour. Their burger, fries and a cold beer is only $13.00. The burger was done perfectly on a toasted sourdough bun. The sweet potato fries were hot and crisp. We continue to receive outstanding service and food at PM. Paul Martin's is always our go to Scottsdale restaurant.

rwWToojzp3Y_W6Mcnb5iQQ.text: Had a fantastic lunch experience here.  Dark warm woods in the interior.  Felt like a lodge with modern accents (reminded me of Disneyland's Grand Californian Hotel).    My friend & I tried the Bistro Burgers (adding avocado and Arizona cheddar - a must).  As a fan of both Fleming's and Ruth Chris' burgers, I have found a new favorite burger in the valley!   Comes with fries (get the sweet potato - perfectly cooked and very flavorful).  Or try the house-made coleslaw - amazing.  We added a side of grilled corn with chilli aoli & cotija cheese - the description alone should tempt you...and it delivers big on flavor.    Capped it off by sharing a piece of the Devil's Food Cake - added a scoop of vanilla ice cream per server's recommendation - thanks Michelle! perfect compliment to the rich dark chocolate ganache in the cake.  Will be back soon!

E8X76NJuqjh_d2SIT-no6g.text: Really great food, and really great service. (thanks Victoria)   We had a variety of main dishes and entree salads.  All were very good.  My husband loved the Beef and Bacon tacos... Another Chicken and Quinoa dish was amazing.  Dessert... oh lord.  While the waitress recommended the apple tart.. we opted for the Chocolate Cake.. which was incredible.  Definitely will be back!

lyAOmPQnjbYgqROuDLeFZg.text: The service is always top notch and the food is even better. I love going for happy hour with friends to get a burger, fries, and a beer for $13! They're full portions and a full sized beer too. The food is always outstanding and after talking to the waitress about their food I found out that everything is fresh and made in house. The only freezer they have is for the ice cream that they made!  Besides the burger I also highly recommend the street tacos and everything on their dessert menus is absolutely delicious.

fq6fNH17CVE0rvOMDzh_EQ.text: I have been to Paul Martins a number of times. Every meal I have had has been delicious. The pork chop is succulent, the cedar plank salmon is delicious all the starters are great. The bar is well stocked and both spirits and wine. The staff is very professional and they take pride in providing a good dining experience. I highly recommend this restaurant.

CYv5nSVa5rfX_F7cAJ5qqg.text: After visiting this stylish new restaurant three times I was disappointed in the food three times.   First time: After struggling to find anything on the menu that appealed to me, I ordered the fish tacos.  I was surprised to see the tacos made with Salmon.  If I wanted Salmon I would have ordered Salmon.  They were just ok but,  not what I had hoped for.  Second time:  I ordered a hamburger.  It was difficult to cut it in half as I hit on a very tough piece of meat.  Then, when I was eating it, I bit on a tough piece that I could not chew so I had to spit it out.  Lost my appetite for the rest of the meal.  Third time: Got to be better this time right??  I odered Tortilla Soup.  Huge  disappointment.  The bowl was small, there were VERY few pieces of chicken but, one the the pieces was a chunk of fat that had to  be spit out!!  Summary:  Disappointed in the food,  prices too high, happy hour below average. Many better restaurnants in town.  Paul Flemming.....how did you miss on this one?  My recommendation:  For great Tortilla Soup  go to  Roaring Fork.  For all other food, you can't go wrong at Houston's.  Nan

hnJlCk1TQcgk4f74PLy3Pw.text: Great food and service! Ate there with a friend quite awhile ago so because my review was so short, Yelp held it for further comments but I have forgotten since it was so long ago. LOL

6gsdBZ2Oh6JcIbB3fj1FOQ.text: This place is a bit pricey above average. I ordered the fish tacos which were great. But some of the dishes were not correct when brought to the table. Steaks were undercooked or not cooked to patrons specification.  It can be irritating for some but for this type of establishment that presents itself as above average. I cannot give it more than an average review. My dish was great but other people at my table were not that satisfied.

G_2aElJE2tNeC8Xt6rcR3g.text: Upscale American bar and grill scene right in Scottsdale. Came with a group of friends on a Friday night and for good reason place was packed. We decided to start off with the Calamari which was prepared  Rhode Island's style which was lightly breaded with a chili aioli and a house cocktail sauce and also the salt and pepper shrimp cocktail. The shrimp cocktail was prepared perfectly which on the menu said lightly fried which you couldn't tell. Was not overly impressed with the sauce that came with the calamari. For my meal I decided on the on the brick chicken dish which came with mashed potatoes, Za'atar croutons, herb jus chicken dish which came with very juicy and sauce was even better. Other people in my group decided on the French dip with fries and the fries were regular string cut but a little bit well done and were great. Other people in the group decided on the filet which was the most tender well prepared meal of the group. This would be my suggestion if you decided to venture here in the future definitely try the filet..

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brick Chicken
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Calamari

ETo70YcGR7EybX0WWQF0Kg.text: Went there for Easter Sunday Brunch special. 1/2 wait for wrong food order than another 1/2 wait for correct order, with under cooked eggs and potatoes as well as over cooked eggs.

3H9lEGNcAUsyMSy7SNe7lw.text: Older lady at the counter of a shop recommended this place, noting it's a local favorite. No wonder. Nice atmosphere, large and roomy dining area. Great service, superb cocktails. We had two small plates featured at happy hours. Excellent salad w/ butter lettuce, pears and bbq ribs. If I'm ever in area again, definitely return!!

6XPKAiEWMRu_4kLT1px61Q.text: Visiting Phoenix for work and decided to stay in nice Scottsdale instead of Downtown to avoid the commotion of Trump's rally in Phoenix.  The food was good.  The ribs were fall off the bone.  I didn't enjoy the slaw much.  I was able to sub the fries for cauliflower.   The service was very attentive.  Upscale restaurant gave me additional napkins for the ribs since it was a tablecloth and cloth napkins place.  An extra special touch was the warm napkin with a lemon instead of a wet nap.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FoWEVpzJ0xr-NWnmCx5Xqw.text: This was our first experience here, and we will not be going back. The hostess was very rude when we arrived a few minutes before our reservation, and wasted no time in telling us so--we had intentionally arrived early to have a cocktail at the bar as we often do. We ordered a Cosmo and a raspberry martini which were average. When our table was ready, we were sat, and greeted rather promptly, by a friendly waitress.  She was the highlight of our experience with perfectly timed table visits and just the right amount of humor and friendliness.  We ordered the marinated bone in pork chop cooked to medium and a 7 oz filet cooked medium rare, with Brussels sprouts, sauteed spinach and mashed potatoes on the side. When our food came out, the runner asked us to cut in to our entrees "to make sure they were cooked correctly" while he stood and watched. I have never experienced that st any other restaurant, and we were immediately concerned. My husbands pork was slightly over cooked, but he chose to keep it. My steak was cooked medium well, and so I sent it back asking for a new one. In the meantime, he ate his entree and we shared the potatoes, which were way, way over salted (even for me who would prefer something slightly over seasoned than under)  It took about 25 minutes for a new steak to arrive, by which time my husband had long since finished his entree. Again I was asked to cut in to it while the manager observed. It was cooked medium rare this time, but in the time it took for them to correct their mistake,  I was full from the mashed potatoes. They did end up comping the steak (rightly so), however the whole meal was an overall disappointment. With as many restaurants as there are in Phoenix and Scottsdale with a similar menu/price point, Paul Martin's needs to step up their game.

EOQCD5WU-d3UDXkb6-bItg.text: The food was very good.  The crabcakes, some of the best in the valley.  The ambiance was a combination bar (with TV's) and noisy eating area.  Not exactly what we were looking for in an upscale restaurant.  The waiter was excellent.  Unfortunately, he got my wife's order completely wrong, but she didn't raise that as a concern and enjoyed the meal she was served.  Summary:  very good food, very good service, but we will continue to search for a different ambiance.

n614YCk6y2QmqpBeJjVRdg.text: Went there for happy hour and had a poor experience. Paul Martin's has always been one of my favorite places with great food and service but definitely fell short this time. Our waiter didn't check back with us, waters weren't refilled and my entree never came. My companions were finished eating by the time our waiter came by. I had to tell him I never received my entree and it still took quite a while and came out burned! I had ordered the Nashville chicken sandwich, and the menu didn't say it was fried. Had I known that i wouldn't have ordered it. Waiter took it off the bill but really didn't seem concerned that it came out so late. We didn't leave a very generous tip which is unusual for us. We have all been servers in the past and one of us is a restaurant owner so we know how to tip!

vKBgsblDfLMHwBRQ0EGBqg.text: Super experience and skirt steak  Butter lettuce salad and butcher board awesome  Bartenders great and wine selection well done

DzL-qf5Vt2xHYuKE0MtIkw.text: Service was fast and my meal was delicious. I think i went on a slow day so we were able to sit outside by ourselves.

30gUi3a9Chs7Uo6Emj1Psg.text: Disappointed this time. Had been so pleased in the past, made sure to make reservations for this trip and holiday. Asked about seating indoors, but told due to our reservations we could only be outdoors due to them being so booked for NYE. Got seated in a very cold patio area in folding chairs while looking at very comfortable chairs at other tables on the same patio. We understood, but watched empty indoor restaurant the entire time we dined. Was a good half hour before anyone asked if they should turn up the heat for us.  Drinks were good, wedge salad delicious, french onion soup was quite sweet (should be described in menu - would not have ordered at that price), spinach artichoke dip tastey, then came entrees. Short ribs were cold, sent them back to be reheated, other person in party ordered ribs, they were cold as well. They chose not to send back but just packaged them up in to go box. Third person said breading on fried chicken took a lot to get through before getting to the meat, said it was just ok. Will not be returning next trip. Wish we would have read other recent reviews about cold food.

SaB6bu5Y0onBFBBZhVZYhQ.text: Great happy hour!  Burger, fries and a cocktail for $14. Community table was a delight - met some regulars who were just a hoot!  Service was excellent. Really nice atmosphere.

VBbH59YTbOWq8YJRDE0SFw.text: Just returned from a non lunch experience today. Waited an hour and a half and then walked out there were six of us and we never heard from the manager with an explination as to what ever happend to our order.

t-7LzP58Z1AkBRcOVjkFqQ.text: My visit to Paul Martin's was spectacular and exceeded expectations. Though it does kind of look like some other overpriced and stuffy steakhouse establishments, the atmosphere, experience, and quality were top notch.   I came with a large group, and they gave us the banquet room, which was the perfect balance between private and public. They made us feel special from start to finish.   The wine list seemed to please everyone who was into wine. And many of their bottles are actually on cask, so be prepared for your bottle to come without a label. I was more concerned with the beer list, which had anchor steam and hop nosh from uinta. Very impressive for a place like that.   My dinner was a stocked salad with julienned veggies and chicken. A huge serving that could be split between two less hungry people. Others in my group ordered the brick chicken, steak, and some other American standards.   Then came dessert: white chocolate pistachio and chocolate ice cream I believe was house made. Did not disappoint.   Overall a great place to spend an evening being taken care of and eating delicious food.

qWfth2vNEKhk8RBeWqfrKg.text: We had reservations at 9:00  and got here by 8:50.Being Valentine's day they were fully booked but we were promptly seated.Service was friendly and fast.  We ordered Raspberry Martini (house vodka,lemon juice and sweet vermouth). Glenkinchie 12.  Salt and pepper shrimp (coated with a buttermilk batter) served with pesto aioli. Sweet potato fries. Chimichurri chicken (chicken breasts with wild mushrooms farro,spinach,onions).  I actually wanted the brick chicken with mashed potatoes but they were out of it for the day.The Chimichurri was well done and had a nice crispy skin.They served me fries instead of sweet potato fries so the manager recommended we snack on them and quickly got that fixed.The Raspberry martini tasted as good as it looked.The house Ciabatta wheat bread was fresh out of the oven.  Our server took some wonderful pictures.They also have a patio.Overall the experience was Great and we came home a Happy couple.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chimichurri Chicken.
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ciabatta wheat bread (fresh out of the oven).
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet potato fries.

gpbgMiNEvdaYcbtQ0IuKvg.text: Let me start by saying, I have NEVER had a bad experience at Paul Martins.  I can only comment on the bar area because that is where I sit when I come here. The bar staff, Steve, Trent, and Dustin are OUTSTANDING!! From the very first time I came in they made me feel like I was a regular that has been coming in for years and the main reason I keep coming back.  The atmosphere and clientele is upscale and friendly, not Scottsdale snobbish like allot of places in the area. The food has always been top notch and cooked to perfection at a reasonable price.  I love the place, and the people and will continue to come back as long as I live Arizona.

8MNy7c-xaJ8ehs87S7yMeg.text: Firstly, I want to rave about how accommodating the manager Anthony and our waiter John was. Initially we had a party of 15 ppl. On the day of our reservation, it grew to a party of 18. I contacted the restaurant and Anthony was willing to accommodate our party of 18 but gave us a limited window which I knew would work. Well, to my surprise, a couple of more people decided to join us as we were celebrating one of our managers at work. As we were unable to seat everyone together, a few of us decided to dine inside. Again, Anthony being very accommodating, was able to place us at a table and that's where John came in. He was very sweet, engaging and an all around great guy. John continued to ensure we were happy, had everything we need and checked on us regularly for there to have been a packed house. The service alone will get me back in the door but it doesn't hurt that the food was quite tasty as well! And yes you want the $17 crab cake. Trust me. :)

OufWHM0KH1M4EYkgw_nwvQ.text: I have found this to be one of my regular weekly dining spots.  It meets most of my basic requirements after a hectic day.  Very attentive staff, better than average food, acceptable pricing, nice relaxed dining environment which is big on my list.  It can get a little busy given it's prime Scottsdale location.  I recommend you make a reservation on Open Table to ensure quick seating.  They have a killer wine special offering a glass of premium for $18.  I wish they would change the menu items or offer a few more specials to maintain variety hence 4 stars.

RyqKwEXvWKaF7SJZP0G3Lg.text: I'm so disappointed.  I was looking forward to our reservation here for a nice Christmas Eve meal with my family, six in our party.  They kept the doors open, so I was cold the entire time.  I couldn't take my coat off.  Two of us ordered the most expensive thing on the menu, their special Filet mignon with crab stuffed bacon wrapped shrimp.  We discussed with the waitress what medium was.  It was pink.  We were asked to cut into our steaks and they were very red.  The server returned them to be cooked longer.  When they came back, they were still red.  Well, I kept mine because I was frustrated with the fact that the rest of the party was eating their burgers and chicken without us.  So I ate as much as I could of my raw 45.00 steak and that was about half of an 8 oz. filet, but my daughter sent hers back again and it was still very under cooked, another words it was bloody after two attempts.  They said they would "take care of it".  My hubby ordered the fried chicken.  Several pieces of big chicken nuggets came to him and two were burnt.  Come on Paul, the chicken was not juicy and tender, it was really tough and unpleasant for comfort food.  Then we noticed that my grandson never got his Mac and Cheese.  Oh, sorry.  We'll have that right out.  Too bad they didn't tell us it would be tough and dry, (and where was the cheese?)  we would have saved them the trouble.  Any way, the check came and they did not take care of it, at least not until we explained we were told it would be taken care of.  Over all it was a terrible experience for $300.00 plus.  Later my daughter asked me what I thought of the crab stuffed shrimp and I said one of them tasted like it had a bite of crab and one didn't.  She said hers were cold because of all the rigamoral with the steak, they didn't even bother to make the meal hot, just brought out the shrimp that sat waiting for a the steak that they couldn't get right.  Medium, about 6 minutes on each side, I do it all the time on my grill at home, which is where I wish we had been.

ZnV_aI9470Hg14sDfE3l2w.text: their happy hour deal with burger and a beer is awesome! one of the best tasting and juicy buergers I've ever had and great price. All my firends in my group agreed! Also, nice atmosphere, classy. You just have to get there in time to find a place at the bar area to get happy hour price deals

yYaCYWbbUTF0o7_7rmc5fQ.text: This place is totally overrated. I feel like it is a Houston's wanna-be and it is unsuccessful in that effort. I've been here twice and the service has always been nice and helpful. But the food tho! The food is either under-cooked or over overcooked or oversalted or too sweet etc. Some of their items are actually even weird... We ordered spinach dip and were provided with a soupy cheese mixture with fresh spinach not even cut up floating in the soup. In other words, in order to eat the spinach dip you had to use a knife. Who needs a knife to eat spinach dip?  The taste was fine but it was weird. Other things I have had that I was not impressed with include the artichoke (if you want a real artichoke go to Houston's) and the cedar plank salmon (barely cooked). However, I ordered the short rib dinner the first time I was there and that was quite good. Besides that, everything has been somewhere between bad and meh.

aWPA93m3J3_8835SeNa6hQ.text: Can't tell you if the food is good or bad. I made reservations on Saturday night for my wife's birthday we arrived on time they seated us right away then made us get back up and gave our table away all with an ATTITUDE. We waited another hour with no information, compassion or table we just ended up leaving. They didn't care at all. I won't go back!!!!! I still can't believe this! I see you have to be a certain color it be respected there!!

28x1EI3h1X0IhswjeWElRg.text: Eric & Kathy best service & great time! I will be back for sure! Monday's the bomb!! Food was so amazing!!! Blazed chicken, short ribs YUM!!!

AIWIkeweK99J1eLGM6Nkng.text: Restaurant is located where J. Alexander's was and decided to eat there because of a $25 off coupon in the mail.   Made reservations for 3 on a Friday night without any trouble via Open Table. Inside and out, the only difference between the current decor and that from J. Alexander's is the name on the door! Seems like exact same store.  Food was good. No one had any complaints but wasn't blown away either. I had a rib eye and spinach for $36. Wasn't especially good, and was too salty but it wasn't tough and was prepped as I asked.   Overall I feel like this is another restaurant typically found in Scottsdale; a little over priced not great food served in a nice atmosphere. I suppose I'd eat here again but if I had to choose between this place and Roaring Fork, RF would win every time.

DUBP-WpH4X4-vGL7aSJM3w.text: Really disappointing. Dropped by here on a Friday night with my wife hoping for a good dinner but all we got was marginally decent food that was very pricey.  Cocktails were 10 dollars each, not bad, but didn't really taste too good. nothing special.  Servers were unpolished. Felt like they were all newly hired.  Food was not that good. New York Strip Steak was a small portion. Tasted all right, but not nearly enough for a young man. Asked for medium rare but got it medium. Wife ordered medium sandwich but got rare. Had to send it back (after waiting for 10 minutes).   Overall, came out to 40 a pop, but was a lackluster meal.

KQFqMclSIJLPuFr_1yY6fw.text: The most important place to start: There is a restaurant that has been across the street for a long time with a great record serving up a very similar menu and doing it better. If you have been to this place I speak of across the street, and you like it, don't go to Paul Martin's.   This is a new location for an already established restaurant group, for that reason I do not allow the excuse of being new in regards to our not so great service. While our waitress was nice, she just wasn't very good. If I ask you what items are good on the menu don't tell me what people have been ordering a lot of that night. It doesn't answer my question. A restaurant like this should have had all their employees do a complete tasting of their menu.   After lack of guidance my husband and I collectively wound up with the spinach dip, mushroom soup, steak cobb salad and the short ribs. The meal itself started with olives from the Queen Creek Olive Mill and some seasoned almonds. We enjoyed those and thought we were headed on the path of a good meal, but not so much. Next our waitress brought us "complimentary" bread. She kept saying "complimentary ". It was weird, pretty sure everyone eating at that restaurant understands when the bread hits the table you don't have to pay for it. Anyhow, it wasn't very good bread.   Next should have been our spinach dip but that took 25 minutes so my soup showed up first. It would have actually been very good but half the bowl was filled with a chunk of that not so great bread wedged into my soup. Finally the "spinach dip" came. Ok, if you have had that aforementioned restaurant's spinach dip, DO NOT ORDER THIS. It was whole leaves of spinach that were wilted in a runny bechamel sauce. Not only was the flavor lacking but it was hard to eat since it was whole leaves of spinach. Don't waste your time or money on that one.  The last round for us was my salad and my husband's short ribs. My salad was ok, not bad - but nothing to write home about. The price for what you were getting left something to be desired though. My husband's short ribs were a little bit of short ribs and 20 potatoes worth of mashed potatoes. Guess they make sure their margins are good on that dish. But the biggest issue there was the "sauce". The meat itself was very tender but the plate was like soup with a broth made of soy sauce with meat floating in it. This quantity of soy sauce made the short ribs SO over salted. Short ribs have become very popular on many restaurant menus lately and these were probably my least favorite out of many I've tried lately.   One of the most important things to note here, the bathrooms were FILTHY. I always find it concerning when cleanliness is not a priority in any part of a restaurant.   Final statement: go across the street.

uGxeiPp8SDbLcgL_kSm34A.text: In Scottsdale from New York City for business. Great restaurant!  5-7pm happy hour special ($13) gets you a bacon cheeseburger with fries and a tall handcrafted beer. Nice deal! Big portions, nice simple flavors. Perfectly cooked. Homemade mayo was a nice touch.  What brought me here is that everything is made from scratch and they work with local farms and businesses. Their meat is also humanely raised. You can taste and feel the difference. America needs more places like this and we need to support them.

DMFTggw7JRhd99ixx2S2ig.text: Great service and good food.  A bit expensive but a solid meal. Butternut soup, kale Cesar & Brick chicken were all tasty.  We ordered the steak on the Cobb to be cooked medium well and it came out rare!...

B3m6H4-FKf5XdYHOswoLjQ.text: I hope the food is delicious, but waiting now 1 hour for a French Dip, Pork Chop and Short Ribs is insanely too long! Seated at 7:30pm, ordered at 7:40pm it's now 8:46pm

HO8Zg4gcn_N1BTpvtNskmw.text: We love Paul Martin's American Grill. The salmon grilled on a cedar plank is fabulous, and the short ribs are killer.  They have a wonderful deal on Monday nights (called Monday night wine dinner) and you get two organic salads, two entrees (any entree on the menu) and a bottle of wine (good selection) for $49!!  In addition, their Happy Hour is wonderful!  The staff is cordial and friendly (we like that in Scottsdale) AND they use local ingredients where they can.  What's not to love?

v-21E4aCqT76rN3u9e2EsQ.text: I don't know what the bad reviews are! People in a cranky mood, who were at a different restaurant is the only explanation.   This place was so great for dinner. Definitely trying to give off a higher end vibe, which is fine, I appreciate great fine dining service! But they don't even have to go that fancy with the service, the food seriously speaks for itself and is wonderful. We had the spinach dip to start which was fantastic and the best I've had. It came with delicious slices of bread and sun dried tomato. Fiance had the short rib, a perfect portion size and delicious. I ordered the steak cobb with a side of mac n cheese. The mac n cheese was great, I wouldn't say I need it but it was definitely tasty. The salad on the other hand was so beautiful in presentation and I loved every bite. I didn't even use the blue cheese dressing they brought on the side. The vinaigrette it is tossed in is perfect.   Service could not have been better- our waters were never empty, servers were attentive while not being annoying or overbearing and the ambiance is quiet. You can get away with being both casual and dressy here.  I highly recommend Paul Martins for Lunch or Dinner. The servers are excellent and the food top notch.

SwdPREftFHFbD8pTFtt1FA.text: My hubby and I had an exceptional lunch here today. We enjoyed great food, excellent wine and superb service. Mike G. and his manager (sorry did not get his name) went above and beyond to explain menu choices, ensure that everyone was done to perfection. We started with the Mushroom Soup, which was sublime. It was, by far, the best mushroom soup I have ever tasted. The table next to us said the same thing. Then I had the brick chicken (swoon) and hubby had the smoked pastrami sandwich. He is STILL talking about it. Instead of fries, he opted for brussel sprouts and I thought he was going to lick the plate. The service and ambiance are a cut above. We will be back within a week or so.  AWESOME!

PchowIt88QAArPXozb2B3w.text: I just got back from Paul Martin's American Grill and I can honestly say I have never received worse service at a restaurant.  My wife, 8-year-old son and I were on an extended stay at a nearby hotel and decided to try one of the many well-reviewed restaurants in the area and decided on Paul Martin's.  I don't know who he is, but the place seemed clean, trendy and modern.  We had to wait about 20 minutes, which was okay. The dining area was pretty busy, and the Mexican place next door was also packed.  Our hostess was very nice.  Our waitress arrived promptly, took our drink order and then our food order.  She told us we'd be getting some bread and then she disappeared until we were almost done with our meal.  Well, "disappeared" is an exaggeration - she was still in the restaurant, she just studiously ignored us.  Our son's meal arrived fairly quickly, but after that, we waited (sans the promised bread), and waited... And waited.  Our meals came, and we had to ask the waiter  for the bread we had never received before.  For the life of me, I can't figure out why they brought our son's food out a good half hour before the rest of the table's dinner was ready.   A third staffer then inexplicably replaced my Diet Coke with iced tea.  Our original waitress eventually showed up again, we asked for the check and left.  The food itself was hit or miss.  My wife reports her steak was very good.  My own blackened redfish, however, was chewy and not very flavorful.  Although my son complained that his grilled cheese was not what he was expecting, I tried it and thought it was very good.  Portions were a bit on the small side, but that is almost expected at a trendy place like this.    And the bread, when it eventually came, was also very good.   We could see other tables getting good service (i.e., the wait staff actually paid attention to them and were laughing and smiling). Our waitress, on the other hand, was determined not to even look in our direction.    The only reason I can think of that we received so little attention is that our son was with us.  I didn't see any other children in the place, but it didn't seem that kids were unwelcome and he was well-behaved the entire time.  I must confess, I still don't know who Paul Martin is, but I know we will be staying within walking distance of his restaurant for another 2-4 weeks and we will not be back.  Had our experience been different, we may have eaten there several more times during our stay.  But our first impression was so bad, that we will not be giving him another chance.

ppw2Tync6A2pX1JqLdVV2A.text: Yummy again!  The grilled artichoke was a hit for me again.  My entree was a skirt steak with roasted sweet potatoes.  Others had the baked salmon, salmon tacos and the fried chicken.  All good. The only problem this time was service.  Our server did not cover the table well.  We waited a long time for dessert and wound up cancelling the order. Good food always, good service most of the time.

WC1NmGHQTw2rITtPXHKcYg.text: Family dinner. Shared Fried Calamari: very good. But salt & pepper shrimps were really good. I had Brick Chicken: very very good. My son had Braised rib and my  wife Chumicurri Chicken. Dinner was great.

jII4JDij6eFL97ca1y5MhQ.text: Came here for dinner with a friend Friday. We made reservations so we were taken back right away. Our server was in training but he did an excellent job, more of the reason why I give it 4 stars is because the service was prompt and server kept us very well informed and knowledgable about the menu. Love also that everything is made from scratch and in house.   We started our night of with a glass of wine each, I was very impressed with their wine list and also how their selection of by the glass was quite extensive than most steak houses. We had the seafood platter as our appetizer. Came with fresh oysters, shrimp, lobster, and a salmon spread lettuce wrap. Very tasty, however the portions were VERY small for the price you are paying. I had the cedar plank salmon as my meal, it was good but could have been better. The sauce was very runny which made the presentation look very sloppy and salmon could have been cooked better. My friend had the rib eye steak, it looked amazing and friend said it was tasty. Had a piece of the broccolini it had as a side and loved it.  For desert we tried the raspberry crem brulee and it may have been my favorite part of the meal. Cooked perfectly and moist.   With 2 glasses of wine later and a $200 tab we would say we enjoyed our dinner. Food would review as 3-3.5 but gave it 4 stars because of the ambiance of the place and great service.

vCeUCTHFDjfMsfKAnkm3xw.text: It's a beautiful restaurant lots of parking Front desk is outstanding Tables and decorations top notch Menu has a great selection Bar is full the selection is great Bartenders great and friendly Waiter very knowledgeable and friendly Great selection of wine decent prices Price were consistent with other. Nice restaurants Why not a 5 star  Dear Chef  Please were in 2015 Salt is not the only seasoning.

nBuktj9Pw_nvwRoG96K1-w.text: What a pretty place for a lunch with the girls! We had a beautiful and delicious crudites platter and it is perfectly fresh and tasty. Heirloom carrots and yellow and green beans and tiny sweet tomatoes and more. The green goddess dressing is flavorful. We had the poblano chile relleno and  I almost had to 'had to' lick the plate. Tasty! Our friend who is vegetarian found lots of choices to her liking. Lots of great eats....surely will be back for dinner and drinks!

MsLemFqOkjjS1zJuQZt3-A.text: Very nice place, friendly staff, and delicious food. The only criticism is we went in for happy hour but the seating is at the bar or communal style and we wanted a table in the bar area. "No happy hour if you want to sit there". So the difference is??? But this is a small knock on the place and we will definitely go back. BTW...I had the Bistro burger and it was outstanding!

HwTejXCCcRubglE8pBhjGQ.text: Trent A (amazing bartender)  The most attentive and fun bartender I've had in a long time really made our experience special.   A must is the happy hour with the smoked wings amazing!!

amsv9e68qyMk0fcUm7Cegw.text: We love the food and Courtney is he best waiter in town! He always makes us feel so special. It is one of our go-to restaurants in Scottsdale!

6Zd3Mnrl9E_MoJM9bRif0g.text: This place is Good for a light dinner and cocktails, They do NOT have a kids menu but a few good options for the little ones are the Mac N Cheese my 7yr old son rated it a 6-7 the cheese burger is a good option as well. I ordered a few oysters $3 each so why not right they were D lish ! my son had a Shirley temple which he did not care for I guess they make their own grenadine in house but he wasn't impressed and honestly neither was I, it was sour not sweet had an orange flavor rather than a cherry flavor. We ordered a Cheese burger with side salad, OMG the Ranch is the Bomb.com!! they make it fresh daily. I'm a huge ranch fan! I'll give it a 9 it was plenty of food for one adult and child we will totally be back he did feel like a big boy because they didn't have crayons so if you have small kids be prepared to keep them entertained

CDVIktZUFLLm37nbNZKYsw.text: Great service, great food, great atmosphere! Enjoyed the sweet potato fries and ribs, brick chicken was real good.

EKSaP_u0zxdZCauK5sUrTA.text: Really oily food lacking the great seasonings to make up for it.  The calamari didn't have the light breading as advertised and was over-fried.  That's all I remember.

1DBTIyG76CIJaL5fYRo2Jw.text: We went here the other night to celebrate a birthday. We had an amazing dinner. My only complaint would be that they had made a mistake and undercooked some chicken for one friend at our table. They did take it off the bill. Still an awesome place and we will be back again.

GhOLmtPvK2v3jDFBHv-P7w.text: So my mom told me about this place and insisted we get happy hour together there, and when my mom likes a restaurant, it's kind of a big deal because she's pretty picky. My boyfriend and I met my parents there for happy hour the other week. It's wonderful that the HH goes until 8PM because my boyfriend works late so he was finally able to make it to a HH!   We got to sit out on the patio in the comfy cushioned chairs. I really need to remember to start writing down our servers' names because he was fantastic.   We ordered from the "Taste of Paul Martin's Menu" which is their way of saying Happy Hour. My boyfriend ordered the St. Louis Style Pork Ribs and I ordered the $13 special which comes with a burger (there's 3 choices available), fries (sweet potato, regular, or mixed), and a beer...all for $13!! The burger was very very yummy and incredibly juicy.   Not one of us left a scrap of food on our plates. I had a chance to check out their full menu and it looks like a place I definitely want to come back to and try out.   Happy hour = fantastic. Full dining experience = forthcoming.

ViOVczqDZ7vAsTVYOMkMaw.text: The food was terrible. The atmosphere was that of a bad country club restaurant. The server wanted to make friends instead of doing his job.

JAoStzJ1oc-PPpoiKmKw4Q.text: Shout out to all my Az peeps ;grab your friends , your dates and your lovers and head on out to Paul Martin's.. This place is 5 stars from beginning to end. For starters you will want to try the Town Dock Calamari, very fresh and lightly battered with delicious chili aioli and house-made cocktail sauce . I had the Chimichurri Chicken . Omg the savory flavors that bust in your mouth is amazing . Hubby had the marinated skirt steak with bourbon glazed sweet potatoes, and dressed arugula . This dish did not disappoint . A must try side dish ...Mac&Cheese Tillamook white cheddar and prosciutto . For dessert we had the seasonal dessert... Lemon creme' Brulee with homemade cookies it was very light and refreshing . Everything is made from scratch and all their meats and poultry are antibiotic & hormone free . This menu is also Gluten and vegan friendly ! Our waiter Joel was impeccable ,as was all of their waiters and waitresses.  These servers are definitely on their game . The manager Clyde was  very polite and friendly. The atmosphere and the music was kick ass .  We both had cocktails .. Hubby had 2 grapefruit and vodka and I had the same but only one because I am "light weight Lucy"!  The portions are perfect leaving you extremely satisfied . Dress code . Casual nice . Expect to spend around $200.00 for all of that and there is valet parking . My friends do not miss out on this place !!!  As always if you go let me know what you think . Enjoy!

506XfMV4m2tTcWlxU-pKzA.text: Food not our style  It was several months ago we were here, just now getting around to posting this.  Food was not our style. A very good piece of salmon. And ruined it by smothering it in onions and spinach. I thought the spinach and onions were going to be a side dish. If salmon is farm raised or Atlantic then it does need extra work to get a good flavor, but WA or AK fish is outstanding with just a bit salt and pepper, cedar plank or fresh lemon. It does not need a lot to have excellent flavor.

7Fj7jsqXJYR3NZjHvuKiRg.text: Service - Exceptional   Food - Mediocre   Drinks - All were tasteful and well made  Atmosphere - Elegant and booths were comfy   Everything was great except the food was just ok.. Slightly disappointed. We came here for Valentines dinner but probably won't drive 40 mins to eat. Definitely will stop by for happy hour drinks though if in the area..

nZL75p0s-tigSJGlDmzsqw.text: So impressed! We live right down the street and first time we've been in. The food was impressive. So glad to find a restaurant that does not serve bland blah food. We will be back. Try the grilled salmon and cauliflower on the side:) Server Stephen was great.

AACYgtIzB_7OnDA9SywpdQ.text: I hate to say that I wasn't very impressed with this place.  We arrived for dinner on a week night and there were very few people dining. It took the waiter far longer than it should have to retrieve our drink order. The drinks remained empty without an offer for refills.  We shared the butcher's board - a selection of local cheeses and artisan salumes - it seemed subpar and overpriced.  Our dinner entrees were about the same. Nothing special.  For all the hype this place really didn't have the "it" factor for me.

DcO-rAF29Yr3bxzBtN3_fg.text: I really wanted to like this place.  We showed up around 6:00 pm for their advertised "Taste of Paul Martin's" happy hour menu.  I asked the hostess if it mattered where we sat for that menu.  Well, it did.  You have your choice of the high-top tables around the perimeter, the communal tables (like picnic tables with people packed in like sardines) or the bar.  As she pointed out, they were all full.   So I asked if we could be put on a waiting list.  No, they don't do that.  I asked if we could have made a reservation.  They don't do that either.  So, I said, "so what are we supposed to do, stand in front of a table & wait until the people leave?"  And the answer, shockingly, was unfortunately that's pretty much what you have to do.  She was sorry that was how it is, but that's how  it is.  So if a table opens & there are others waiting, whoever can run the fastest gets the table?  Is this any way to run a business of any kind, let alone a restaurant in Scottsdale?  We were also offered the outside patio, which NO one was sitting at.  Why, you might ask?  Because it's August and it's 106 degrees out and they don't even have any misters.  I am not that desperate to eat in their establishment.  We waited for a little while and realized it was a total waste of a trip & waste of time, so we left.  We will not be returning.  I have a feeling if I had not asked about the seating for the happy hour menu, we would have not been told and then been up-sold to their "dinner menu" and probably would have still ended up leaving anyway.  I would love to hear anyone else's experience with their happy hour seating.

7Skg8ZNZJeCNPZmvHbzTyw.text: I don't understand what all the hype is about with Paul Martin's...I'd like to give it 2.5 stars, but rather than round up, I'm rounding down. Looking beyond the really nice decor and well done interior remodel of the restaurant formerly known as J. Alexander's, everything else seemed very lack luster.  I made a call to get a group of three on the waiting list on a Friday night, and the hostess almost seemed confused at my request. When we arrived, we were told that the hostess only had marked us down for a group of two...alright, no big deal, an honest mistake I guess. There was about a 20 minute wait so we decided to get some drinks at the bar. It was pretty crowded, but the bartender was fairly dismissive and not overly friendly upon our arrival, just a quick delivery of the menu and "what will you be drinking?"..hmm okay.  When we got the text message that our table was ready, the same absent minded hostess sat us, and only brought two menus. I'm not sure what the deal was, but we clearly had a party of three, c'mon now! When our server arrived, he was kind enough to offer a smile and a proper greeting. We ordered the bruschetta appetizer right away and had our drink order placed. When he came back over, he spieled the specials for the night - and REALLY emphasized the new bruschetta, which we had already ordered. At this point, the series of service miscues were almost laughable to us and we figured we were already there so let's just roll with the punches.  Entrees came out, and my girlfriend had the steak cobb salad which was good, her mom had the polenta which was fine, and I had the New York French Dip which is their "twist" on a prime rib shaved sandwich. It instead has shaved New York strip on it and I must say, I was completely underwhelmed by the flavor of the sandwich - just bland, bland, bland.  Honestly, I know I'm ranting and raving in this review, but it was a totally mediocre experience. It is amazing what a remodel can do to a restaurant, as it was pretty full and seemed more lively than when J. Alexander's was the occupant, but I don't think the food is any better - in my opinion, its not even as good and the service is definitely not up to par.   Maybe I'll give Paul Martin's a second chance, but I'll keep my regularity and loyalty to Houston's and Hillstone for my All-American cuisine fix.

e4bQWLYQfjKwkMhgEHxRVg.text: Great tasty food and wonderful service. We really enjoyed the outdoor seating and the gluten free options. Happy hour is from 3-8 and the food and drink menu is great for sharing and having a laid back fun time.

-jPTQ15Mzw8H8qsiYS9AtA.text: I want so bad to give this place five stars. It has some really great things going for it. I've now eaten here twice: once for their happy hour and once for their $49 wine dinner. Now here's the good:  - service: both the bartender for the happy hour and our server at dinner were wonderful. No complaints.  - food: very good. Loved the salad the meal came with. Cedar plank salmon and poke were also good.  - price: amazing. You can't beat the $49 wine dinner.  Now the reason why I only give this place three stars:  - AC: my sister and I were both dripping sweat throughout our dinner. It was way too hot in the dining room. Even our server was like, "PLEASE complain to the manager." She was obviously hot too.Unfortunately, no matter how good the food is, it's hard to enjoy while dripping sweat. The manager did come over and apologize and give us free scoops of ice cream, but we had just had a slice of pie, which brings me to...  - Banana Cream pie: I did not like it. The custard was super thin and tasted of artificial banana flavor like a banana runt. Do they add some kind of banana extract?? Ick. Also didn't love the whipped cream. Had a little fridgy flavor to it, like it had been sitting for a while. I really wish the manager had just comped the pie instead of giving us ice cream we were too full to eat because I felt slightly resentful about spending $10 on that not so great piece of pie. The fact that we shared it and left some on the plate says a lot. Neither of us enjoyed it very much.  - I do wish they had a better selection of beer and a salad on the happy hour menu, but that's not a big deal.  -Parking: parking is difficult and they basically force you to valet. It's free, but I still prefer to just self park.  Will I go back? Yes, I believe I will. The food and service really are good. I hope for a five star experience next time. And also air conditioning.

_5aAuUJ41GK3-bEwCSRG9w.text: Great service (Thomas was excellent). Very friendly and informative.   Love the bar set up. Ladies you can hang your purse and charge your phone!  Great daily happy hour menu with awesome hours 3pm-8pm.   Now the food... Great happy hour bites at a great price with no sacrifice of quality or taste! I'm sure the rest of the menu will not disappoint. Seasonal menu. Fresh ingredients. Love love love!   Just hoping Paul Miller brings this restaurant to the East!!!

eaWy1uGMWPBYfRH7xSPG8Q.text: Bad. Just plain bad, especially for the price.  Food:  Appetizers Spinach dip- gross. Honestly disgusting. Most spinach dip is thick with melted cheese, cream, chopped spinach, etc. This was whole pieces of spinach in what seemed to be Campbells cream of (?) soup and some melted cheese on top. Comes with bread, not a dipping appetizer, I had to use a spoon to ladel some onto my bread.  Cheese board: pretty good. Nice variety of cheeses and meats, though it did not come with any additional bread or crackers. They price it at $12/person, which is weird and a little confusing (does each person have to pay $12 or can you just order one "person" for the whole table?). The latter is True and we ordered 2 "people" for 5 of us and it was enough.   Calamari: my favorite part of the meal. Fried really nicely and great flavor.  Entrees Prime new York steak: $42. Absolutely not worth $42. I ordered MR and it came medium. Did not taste like a high quality steak. Came with spinach with no flavor and fried potatoes which were the best part of the plate.  French dip: OK but not great. Fairly juicy but not what i would expect from a restaurant like this. The horseradish had the consistency of ranch and did not have much flavor. Fries were very good.  Short rib: very juicy. No real complaints but it didn't blow me away.   Two others ordered fish plates which I did not try. However both were swimming in some sort of juice/sauce and neither person finished their plate.  Dessert Chocolate cake: solid. Chocolate lovers dream  Drinks: Bloody Mary: spicy (good for me) but it was very thin looking and lacked flavor. Even my wife (who hates BM's) mentioned that it looked thin  Margarita: terrible. It was just sweet and sour and silver tequila. No gran marnier or orange juice or anything that resembled fresh juice. Supposedly the sweet and sour is made in house, but its a very poor recipe if that's True.   Service: Complete garbage for the prices they charge. We waited 5 minutes (at least) from the time we sat until anyone greeted us and took drink orders. Another 5 minutes or so to actually get drinks. Then probably 15 minutes before he came back to get our food orders, by then we just ordered our food an appetizers together.   The servers dont seem to help each other out much either. Each time food and drinks were brought to the table, our server had to make 2 trips.   Drink refills were relatively slow, but not terrible. Table management was awful. My margarita glass was empty after 15 minutes and then sat on the table for the rest of the meal until we stood up. One ordered wine but her wine glass was still removed from the table (prior to being served her first glass). When he brought the wine he had to go back to get another glass.   Overall we were there for 2 hours. Will never go back. If you want to pay the same amount for dinner but get a quality meal and excellent service, go across the street. If you want to get the same service and food but don't want to pay the $$$, go to....any chain restaurant of your choice.

y1Jdvzsnnn0CU3NMIXcDOQ.text: HOLY COW. This place is unbelievably good.  My fiance and I were very impressed.  The service was amazing from the hostess to the server to the manager who stopped by to check in on us.  The food was out of this world.  The spinach dip appetizer is probably the best I've ever had.  The Short Rib is unbeatable.  The Steak Cobb Salad is incredible.  My mouth is literally watering ... this restaurant is not only worth going to, but worth returning to over and over again.  ENJOY!!

QjEAsE584aIM4SB9onCLtA.text: Went there with out of town guests for St. Patrick's Day.  We love this restaurant, and go frequently.  Rarely are we disappointed.  Going there for St. Pat's Day was a BIG mistake.  The corned beef and cabbage dinner was AWFUL.  The corned beef was served as "chunk" style pieces, the cabbage was under-cooked and not even hot, the carrots was so under-cooked we had to ask for steak knives to cut them.  The potatoes were good.  Four dinners ruined!  We expressed our feelings to our server - he said, "That's why I don't recommend that dinner" and that was it.  Thanks for ruining our IRISH holiday Paul Martin!  As my husband said as we left, it will be a long time before we come back.

LTd3ZxDd3SQ8iHcEKoBYyA.text: I'm pleased to be able to update and upgrade my review.  After the disappointment of the management team  the chief,  servers, and the host staff have totally redeemed the experience.  Great food,  cocktails and service. Nice dinner specials with salad and dessert.   Perhaps a couple more successful visits for that 5th star. Special shout out and thank you to our server Michael S for great hospitality.

KQWJxOka8DlYlMHGd_ikOQ.text: Koyai was great!  Made some wonderful recommendations. I loved the grilled artichoke and ahi tuna for appetizer.  The salmon was average... BUT the braised short ribs and baby back ribs were amazing!  Definitely 10/10 recommend the brussels sprouts.  They were crisp and flavorful. LOVE THIS PLACE!  I'm excited to come back.

AjKldJ8BQXyjvK-Fre3k0Q.text: Wow! The tuna salad  was amazing!  Customer service was on point! I wish I could eat there every night! Love ! Love ! Love!

kGGU--ss_Ysgch6PGlp-Rw.text: Best service we've had lately! Amy you are a True gem! The food was perfect. Fantastic veggie burger, ribs and buttermilk fried chicken! Absolutely going back the next time we are in town.

_gkFKr2xUwKEkfcsZ3HuXw.text: A super fun atmosphere, and the service was wonderful. John was our server and was honest with the menu, quick and entertaining. The lemon drop is a great drink choice! And the burger is a favorite from the dinner menu. We will be back!

GcrNoE2lgAafVyT3IIdcAg.text: Service and food are an A+. Anthony went above and beyond to make sure my family had the best experience. This is now my favorite place thanks to Anthony.

YQELQiWutYBJDTG1Tzrn_w.text: Steakhouse cobb salad here was superb. Service at the bar was spot on. Scotch choices were limited and very expensive - having 2 drinks with my salad put me at an $80 tab. Less expensive than flemings across the street, with comparable food, but still.....

KzsYqVMzvCGvGQL8rg5mbg.text: Came here for birthday dinner. It's our first time.  Great atmosphere, super friendly and accommodating waitstaff.  This might have been one of the best vodka martinis I've had! Dominique was very knowledgeable of the menu and so helpful.  We even got a free birthday dessert. Great Choice for date night!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RlL9EOM6xOyvVYc_7BX9UQ.text: The place is beautiful inside. We both ordered the reddish tacos. They were wonderful! Great seasoning and the side cucumber salad was so fresh. A great balanced dish. The service was not awesome even though there were only 6 tables full. We had to consistently wait for service and grab a different waiter at times. However, I would still recommend for the food.

wVcXPlklGcDdwwRIvUppTA.text: Dissatisfied- I heard so much about this restaurant I decided  to bring my family to celebrate my wife's birthday. The food did  not disappoint, however the service was less than good. The moment we sat down our waiter rushed us. We eventually order cocktails and our Meals. Everyone in our group of 9 ordered a salad or soup. My wife and daughter had only finished 1/4 if their soup and the waiter brought out our meals.  Embarrassed my family asked if they could have to go containers for their soups.  Someone did mention they were sorry for bringing out everything so quick and then walked away. We ordered two bottles of wine and didn't even have a chance to finish them with our dinner.  Enjoy our food even though we were rushed till the very end. Service was about a bad as I have ever experienced.  No need to return

pZ9TPhOKtao32S_rv3LdfQ.text: I opted for a 5* review, my wife said 4*. We went on a Monday night in July when there is a great special for dinner with a bottle of wine on Mondays. It is hard to pass up.   Stephen was our waiter and the service was great. My wife had the grill salad and I enjoyed the French Onion soup. The soup was very good, no big chunk of floating bread and a little sweeter than most, but a very nice flavor. The salad was good and had avocado in it along with cherry tomatoes.   We both had halibut. We agreed it was very good, but not the best halibut that we have ever had. The sauce was nice and light, somewhat lighter than we expected but that was probably a good thing for our diets. My wife thought the halibut was a little overcooked, mine was fine in my opinion. The accompanying asparagus was good, not the giant thick asparagus you see at so many steakhouses.   Great atmosphere, nice wine, and very good food. We've already made reservations for next Monday.

GlGY9DPPNmJB9jxTybIbnw.text: It was really good, especially for the price. I'm used to paying 2-3x more for less quality. The food here is great and definitely a place I'd recommend. Great date spot, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hQKiV6cfioPFGiXBefTOOg.text: Unfortunately we had a less than average meal with very slow service. It's unfortunate that the restaurant was packed when far better establishments have less of a following.   If it survives Paul Martin's American Grill needs better management and a better chef. Food is expensive and the quality and presentation are just substandard.

QdnUsrp2v7CjnD-Z1Ay8vw.text: I do not do a lot of Yelp reviews. However this one is worthy of one. We were there 3/23/2019 on a busy Saturday night. Our reso. was on time. Our party of 4 was quickly attended to by James. I would say we were a little on the "needy" side. We kept James running with drink, bread & appetizer needs. Love their "Team" service....when James couldn't get to us ( he also was working a party of 12) others were there to clear plates, fill water etc... We had a fantastic meal-steak for me (perfectly done). After dinning we were enjoying our conversations as we are all great friends that had not seen each other in a while. Growing up & working in the Biz.....I should have noticed they needed the table ( i didn't). We were approached by the Manager -Anthony who very deftly & Professionally explained the the situation of needing the table for a large reso. He moved us to a bar table smoothly & efficiently & our conversations did not miss a beat. While I could not make this an affordable go out for a bite to eat restaurant, I would definitely make a special place to go. Well done Staff.....very impressed!

aMNP7jaq92-PIoxW2xp4ow.text: We've been wanting to try this place for a long time, but I knew it was kind of high priced, so it took us a while to get here.  The food was delish and we Loved the atmosphere! Definitely higher priced than I like,  but was worth it... for an every once in a while place.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The baked sweet potatoes were great,  but the cauliflower had a sour taste to me.. husband liked them tho!
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Split a Cobb salad with chicken instead of steak and it was delicious!
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;Honey&#34; biscuits... lacking the honey in the biscuit or the butter,  but still pretty good

3CjZEvYNKTws9YiPJRyasA.text: Great food and fabulous servers, John and Paul, two nights in a row. The happy hour menu is extremely reasonable with portions big enough to consider a light dinner. Bistro cosmo tasted great! We also had (over two night) the salmon crostini, American burger, deviled eggs and prosciutto and fog jam crostini. The atmosphere is comfortable and casual.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Iath0VszyKANNtWF8OW1BQ.text: The dining room is comfortable, decorative and modern. I had an enjoyable dinner. I ordered a field greens salad with tomato, red onion, avocado, cucumber, radish, sunflower seeds and house vinaigrette. I had Columbia River Steelhead Salmon with housemade lemon vinaigrette and chilled quinoa salad with arugula. Later, I ordered Toasted Almond Cake that had ladyfingers soaked in Amaretto, Italian Mascarpone, crushed amarettini cookie with chocolate chips. This was a light and refreshing meal with good service
