nHKFXPGzVH0M8KBFLnJqMg.text: Was looking for a nice place to take my mother out for a celebration & regretted not going to Houston's across the street. Wanted to try a new place, and had once heard good things. The service was ok, but nothing to brag about and the food was "eh". Everything looked good but didnt hold up. Dinner took a long time and my steak was borderline cold. After the wait I wasn't about to wait longer for it to be fixed. Nothing so bad that was worth complaining, but we all agreed there wasnt anything that would bring us back.

aMo-biCMbcs20Z5MhIhKqQ.text: We love to come to Paul Martin. The service is always exceptional, the food sumptuous and the ambiance romantique.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Thanks Paul Martin for another fantastic evening!

e-w7I12QlkyPL6MyWJ9L3g.text: The calamari and fried salt & pepper shrimp were freaking (not cussing) good. Had it last night and the leftover still good with my bbq ribs. Coleslaw ehhh. No likey coleslaw. Will come again.

wQZyokSXY1jxU2RXoOoGcQ.text: Been there couple times. Had the dinner salmon, it is one of the best ways I've ever had salmon. I can't wait to go back for more. But, just FYI it's only at dinner! They need to have as a Sunday special!

H2KLTRenRaxmvhAnvaDOnw.text: We were in the neighborhood doing some shopping and popped in on a whim. The decor was elegant and the dimmed lighting along with big windows allowed for business meetings or casually formal luncheon. I ordered the fish tacos which were delicious but wish they would have come with a side. My husband ordered the burger which was on the small side for his liking. The fries on the side were a divine throwback to my grandma's homemade fries. All in all a nice place. Not kid friendly. Prices are high for lunch but considering the area, I guess it's normal.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish tacos

NgKgMFeIL_AgZUAcsIhjhA.text: The atmosphere was really warm and inviting... The food was mediocre at best. I would have expected the food to be amazing, but it just wasn't. Very bland and tasteless. Doubt I'll be back.

8wbraw7PRz-gi2W3-o6xXw.text: I would go back if somebody invited me, but I don't think I would ever choose to go here on my own again. I've been here twice now, once for lunch and another time for dinner and I'm really not impressed. I feel like for $30 a plate the flavor a should really be there and each time this place has fallen short. I enjoyed my $7 burger the other day more than I enjoyed my $25 burger tonight. But on the plus side, they have good service and a nice ambiance.

UZqb10V5LHhxcWD4d_GKCA.text: Loved the food...service was excellent...a very cozy and comfortable restaurant. Also great patio seating.  One big problem was that they had nothing Vegan on the menu so it was very hard to put together a meal for myself. I'm hoping that you will follow suit and be adding some plant base items in the near future to go along with the rest of your wonderful menu choices.

ejocM3wNACsLM-qAZcSktQ.text: Good restaurant and atmosphere.  We ordered the braised short ribs which were extremely tender and the chimichurri chicken which was full of flavor.

2E792GeiUkDNYGZQ8kFUdA.text: If I could give this review 4 1/2 stars, I would!  Pulling up, the restaurant looks like it could be just another chain like PF Changs or Cheesecake Factory. However, there's a lovely ambiance once you walk in, and perhaps what helped it to stand out was the wide variety of fresh, locally sourced, organic dishes on the menu. We had reservations, which helped make the wait shorter... it was very crowded, always a good sign. Shannon was our server, and she was great; her friendly personality and eagerness to get us whatever we needed helped to enhance our experience. I got the Meyer Lemon Drop drink which was good. For meals, I started with the Butter Lettuce Salad with blue cheese, candied walnuts, apples, and maple vinaigrette. Very tasty and light enough to be an appetizer. For my main dish, I got the Vegetable Pasta. I was apprehensive about the vague "seasonal vegetables" that it came with, but was pleasantly surprised to find butternut squash, mushrooms, and lemony greens. Great flavor and very filling. Both dishes were delicious. Yum! We got dessert to-go as we were all full. The apple crisp and chocolate cake were both great. Give Paul Martin's a try! Not your average American grill.

xGklIuKuh7j7ZN-XdPpW7w.text: If every restaurant could take a lesson from Paul Martin's on how to perfect the quality of food and customer service, bad Yelp reviews wouldn't exist. I am writing this review on a full stomach of delicious cuisine, but it was more than just good food. It was the excellent experience in general.   First off, they accept reservations which is a huge plus during the busy season. We made a reservation and upon arrival, we were seated right away. From the moment we sat down until the moment we left, it was a pleasant experience. Our waiter Jeremy is 50% responsible for the great experience. He greeted us as if we were personal VIP guests of Paul Martin's American Grill (which we were not, just random customers). He was incredibly knowledgeable and educated us on the brand, food and history of Paul Martin's. I had no idea this restaurant is a concept of and owned by Mr. Fleming of Fleming's Steakhouse. All of their food is made in-house from scratch and much of it is sourced locally form Arizona. I gained so much knowledge in such a short period of time, without ever feeling like I was being talked at. It was just friendly conversation by Jeremy who is truly passionate about Paul Martin's and it shows.   Jeremy pointed us in the right direction with everything we ordered and I'm glad we took his advice! We started with the calamari which is not your average rubbery calamari. No, this is cod calamari and it seriously puts any other calamari to shame. The seasonings and freshness of the dish made it taste so good I didn't want the dish to end. We almost didn't get it at first because we figured it would just be like every other calamari we had, but we were definitely wrong.   For dinner, I had the short ribs and mashed potatoes, thanks to Jeremy's suggestion. The meat was tender, juicy and flavorful with each and every bite. The mashed potatoes were just as amazing as the short ribs themselves. For dessert, I gobbled up several bites of the pear and huckleberry cobbler which was delectable to the core and topped with their homemade ice cream.   Between the combination of excellent service from Jeremy and delicious food from Paul Martin's, I'd say this was one of the best dining experiences I've had in awhile. I just wish we had given this restaurant a try much earlier! Now we will definitely find our way back again soon.   PS   - They offer brunch on the weekend for just $14 for a pre-fixe menu. I can't wait to try it!

S4Zp_UO12Zu-zt57FiZVCA.text: Good ambience but other than that not good! The menu is rather basic and the food is certainly not worth the price! I had the bistro burger and it was completely devoid of any flavor at all. The menu makes it seem like it comes with cheese, no cheese is a $2 up charge. The other person I was with had the fish tacos-they were ok that was it. Once again not a lot of flavor. The same person had the mushroom soup and said it was actually pretty good. In summary, basic food with no flavor and a very high price tag.

fj2PRCRSt0M9RXs0eUF_8Q.text: A little slow getting service to the table but after that, smooth sailing. Delicious food, delightful server and great ambiance! We had the Marinated skirt steak (medium rare) and it was cooked perfectly! The grilled sweet potatoes were delicious!

HUgJonh3TlRVZdBD_p4B1A.text: Our food was excellent (Salt and Pepper Shrimp, Butter Lettuce salad, Fresh Fish Tacos and a good wine selection). The three star rating is due to the service.  The service was extremely rushed. Three times before we were done with our plates various staff members (not our waiter) tried to remove our plates. We were just truing to enjoy our meal while also enjoying each others conversation. It appeared as if you did not have a fork in your hand and were not actively eating the staff was instructed to try to clear your plate. Due to the quality of the food we will try this restaurant again.

dQVuBLs2loTIPEjtTuFE-Q.text: We 1st tried Paul Martin's during restaurant week and keep coming back to try more dishes.  The setting is quite nice and the service is excellent.  Of all the menu items we have tried, the mesquite grilled artichoke, mushroom soup, kale Caesar salad and Brick Chicken are our favorites. You should also save room for any of the deserts!  Tip: many of the menu items are available on the lunch menu for a few dollars less.  Go for a late lunch and call it an early dinner!

v1F9a3hvJuxrf8GWgfUkTA.text: Thought food was good. Had dinner with my brother who does not like cheese. He ordered a Cobb salad and emphasized no cheese. Unfortunately there was blue cheese in his salad. Which blue cheese for cheese  haters has to be the worst cheese you could possibly eat. When presented the blue cheese to the waiter the waiter said no its Egg so he tried tasting it and in fact it was blue cheese. He asked for another salad and unfortunately there was also blue cheese in that salad. When my brother told the waiter he said no its not blue cheese. So we asked to speak to the manager and the manager came over and said " no sir it's not blue cheese i asked the chef". Clearly that's the worst thing you could tell a customer that what they tasted was not correct. So the manager asked "so what do you want me to do" so we told him nothing and ask him to leave. Worst thing you can ever tell a customer.

zAwjHyLAxCxvmYTCU7qL9w.text: Katherine was our Server and she was wonderful.   And the Happy Hour Menu is sooooo worth it.  Mushroom veggie burger with fries, and a beer for $13.00. Delicious.

5KNDWuFusdtySJaQpEdYNQ.text: I am not sure how to rate food I did not eat! I came in on Sunday to celebrate my anniversary. We specifically chose this place for the prime rib, unfortunately they did not have it despite offering this dish as their feature choice. We were offered an alternative for a significantly higher price. But it was not the price hike that we felt offended by, it was the condescending nature of the manager, we felt very uncomfortable and embarrassed that we even asked for a price match. This reason alone is why we thanked the server and left. I can handle bad food, but bad service is unacceptable.  I want to add the we went across the street to Fleming's and they did not have prime rib either, but they immediately offered an alternative with sides for the same price! We never asked, they offered it to us. They gave us the desert when we mentioned it was our anniversary and the server and the manager gave us a $50.00 gift card and a gift wrapped box full of chocolates!  Simply Amazing!

n_hsNJnOXN79ocjE0rMrkA.text: Brunch here is great! The champagne lemonade is a must. For $16 you get fresh fruit (fresh berries and pineapple) blueberry bread with honey butter, a cocktail and a breakfast entree. The staff is friendly and the food is delicious. They have different chef specials during the beginning of the week. I will be back.

hiUVpB9lI5P0KhuZmChygQ.text: I love their chicken wings  and the wild mushroom soup. Trust me, you have order  those two items. We love the patio, so cozy.

xzn2zVm7RLYL0kzqcYFsDg.text: Excellent across the board. We had the prime rib special on our anniversary. Great service, great food, 5 stars all day long. Anyone rating this place differently is nuts. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

p9gYS4rv7vuvicL17E81-g.text: We come here at least once a month for their Sunday prime rib. It really is delicious! And we feel like we are stealing the price is so good! How can you beat $25 for a salad, a large piece of prime rib with mashed potatoes, and homemade ice cream? They also have a Monday night wine dinner (great deal!!) and a fried chicken Tuesday which I've heard is also very good!  The atmosphere is very nice-beautiful wood beamed high ceilings with fresh orchid arrangements and very comfy booths with dim lighting. The staff is top notch and the entrees are great.  we've had the chimichurri steak (yummy and garlicky!) the free range chicken-small portion but equally as tasty, the marinated skirt steak is cooked perfectly and very tender...the street tacos are pretty good as well if you want an appetizer. We are regulars here :)

Uw8N-GE0dVlkTot_b4LzUA.text: Great fish tacos and calamari with excellent service. But outrageous prices especially for beverages/wine.  If you go, stick with water.

693UEQIbz1EuTgtpWzqS3w.text: Delicious! We were seated immediately and Carl was our server. He was awesome! He checked with the chef on some preparation options for me made some stellar recommendation. He even talked us into dessert!  He was  friendly and personable without being intrusive. The food was great and everything came out perfectly. I would highly recommend this restaurant if you are seeking some healthier options or just want some good food with a spin on traditional dishes.

-3ooG3bPKhYy8LHNXvfAIQ.text: We had very overpriced salads for lunch, which were pretty flavorless and sparse with the ingredients they were supposed to have. Asian salad was bland & chicken was dry. Had to ask for more dressing. Not worth $19. Shrimp & Butter lettuce salad was bland, shrimp was good. Only a morsel of blue cheese and pecans in salad. Not worth $20 2 Redfish tacos were good, but again not worth the  price and came with no sides.  House ice tea was good. Wait staff was average. Atmosphere was wonderful on the patio. Will not return or recommend. Cheers

9yxl4FTjy96ETRC2feolNQ.text: Against her usual policy of ordering seafood while visiting a desert location, my wife ordered the shrimp salad.  It was outstanding!  My hamburger was cooked to perfection.  Service was outstanding.  Would definitely return.

Gs48KNs19YbGGyXwt8VqtA.text: I visited for happy hour and the waiter forgot two things on our order and was slow. The food was ok on happy hour drinks were good. Then I visited for dinner and the food was average and overpriced.

EZj-1Jrmnggf6KLBNfYF_Q.text: Amazing from start to finish! Our water, James, was very knowledgeable and funny. Food was delicious, and the southern fried chicken special was great. Desert menu was also impressive. After staying in Scottsdale for a week, the family decided this was the unanimous decision for favorite all around meal

-nHT9LFAyBym3o2R4JThvQ.text: Anna was our server and she was hands down amazing. We were visiting from Chicago and she made me feel at home here.... great customer service.

uqoZ4GRkYh_JRWrLNh0uPg.text: Overall I would rate this restaurant: 86%.   The layout, decor and ambiance of Paul Martin's are phenomenal. And the complimentary valet is a nice treat.   If you have a large group, I would recommend sitting outside on their patio. They have large couches that make for a comfy dinner space. The servers are very knowledgeable and attentive.   The food overall is a little pricey. The "Brick" chicken is wonderful, but I was not impressed with the Caribbean/jerk chicken.

N9z6-0V-9Nt-3RFXqAiiJA.text: Excellent service, food and ambience! My friend and I went for a late ladies lunch on a Tuesday ! Restaurant was not busy, which was nice and quiet!  Since it was so late in the day we opted to split a meal and a side. We ordered the fish tacos and cauliflower side. Dustin our server who has been with this restaurant since they opened three years ago -was excellent. Very friendly and terrific service! I've been here many times but my friend had not and she loved it too!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish tacos shared! Cauliflower side! Fantastic taste!

51QGbF7G02HjXmYINrnyEw.text: Just celebrated my husband's 50th birthday. What a fabulous meal, and the service was exceptional!  Cortney made our evening as special as I could have hoped for. Thank you!  We will be back!!!

V0b9nWTL17-aqP44tUE_OA.text: We stopped in for dinner, and had an amazing experience with Carl as our server. Not only was the service exceptional, the food was amazing. Try the prime rib!

XGuzUGEJAS0qfuzuT2ilNw.text: We made reservations for our group of 4 on opentable - especially nice since it was for Mothers Day.  They called Day before to confirm - also a nice touch.   We had an amazing brunch experience.  Excellent service!  Our table ordered off the brunch menu, prime rib Sunday special and dinner menu.  Impressive that they had offerings from all 3 menus.   Paul Martins is an excellent restaurant and always a treat to dine there.  Every time I go I remind myself that we need to go more often!

7Xw-EUzlwYAYqcvCHAArDQ.text: Decor was nice. Staff was professional. Food was delicious. Great for a date night. I would say it's a step up from casual dining and the pricing reflects that as well. Would definitely come back again.

qjI5Bh73d5nGXI26-si3Iw.text: Went here while in town on business. We originally had plans to go to a restaurant next door but there was an hour wait so we tried Paul Martin's and were seated immediately. Server was very friendly and attentive and answered our questions about certain menu items and told us what his favorites were. Bread and appetizers came out pretty quick by we did have to wait a little longer for our entree's. Both the sever and manager kept checking on us though and were very apologetic. When the food did come, it was very good. I got the brick chicken which I definitely recommend. Very good experience and would recommend to others.

vF7ot15pUIytzj0Ldd97Hw.text: We visited this location over two years ago and boy what a difference. Service was extremely prompt and the staff was very hospitable. We ordered the Monday wine special and had the New York Strip and Braised Short Rib. The salads were just a filler. The field greens in this salad are way to earthy for my taste. The Prime New York Strip was so tender I used my fork to cut it. The short Rib was good but it  tasted reminiscent of a pot roast. The most notable change this visit was the service. Our server was very attentive and the support staff was a little overly aggressive while bussing our table. I was chewing my last bite, fork in hand  and someone appeared to take my plate. While I get it efficient service it seemed rushed more than efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8zUmF356rzaQ3LLexcX5Nw.text: This place looks much better from the outside than inside.  I expected more both from the food and experience.  I ordered the Alaskan halibut and it just tasted very flaky and bland. Much better at other places. Glad I gave this place a try, but I won't be coming back.

sAvbvbxAjh9Ds20uaN-mGA.text: The staff here is amazing - so friendly. Thank you all so much! I was able to sample the butternut squash soup and I highly recommend it.

85Ly8VAfwcNORhs62GIE4Q.text: I went here for my first time on Saturday December 19th, 2015. It is located in the Old Town Scottsdale area so parking was a little bit poopy. The atmosphere is dark, elegant, yet cuddly, just like I like it! We had reservations so we got sat as soon as we arrived.  The service here was AWESOME. Best service I have had so far. Our server answered any questions we had, offered suggestions on the menu and was very knowledgeable, and checked on us regularly. Then, there were server assistants/runners/bussers/whatever you call them that would come by and take your dirty plate and made sure you had a new clean plate and clean silverware. At one point I remember just barely setting my plate down and someone magically appeared out of no where and removed my dirty dish. WOW! Okay enough about the stellar service. Let's talk food.  We did the whole shebang. I ordered a glass of Educated Guess (Cabernet Sauvignon) and my friend ordered a cocktail (forgot which one). As an appetizer, we tried the Butcher's Board. YAY! Cheese and meat! It was a very neat experience trying the different things on the board. We finished that and out came our entree's. I ordered the Prime New York Steak with a side of mac and cheese. (I'm drooling and I haven't even begun to explain the heavenly flavor). So, my meat came with pt. reyes blue cheese butter. It was delicioso! The mac and cheese was bomb. The meat was EXACTLY how I ordered it: medium. It was so tender and juicy! My friend ordered the blackened ribeye with mac and cheese. He said his was amazing as well. He ordered dessert to go but I didn't try any because I was full. I bet it was amazing, though.  This place is a little bit pricy but it was worth it. Everything was beyond anything I've ever had. When this college kid can save up some more money she will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A little dark but this is the butcher board!

KFz1GzE-Te93g4Rud-BqPA.text: Cedar planked salmon,  chimmichuri chicken and mac & cheese.  Awesome dinner for 2.  The best though was the mesquite grilled avocado appetizer - totally yummy!  Great service, great food - what more could you want?

WrGh31QahA4WS251pObCCw.text: I really love when Valley restaurants change up their menu based on what ingredients are in season, which is why I love Paul Martin's American Grill's new fall/winter menu, available through March, featuring really tasty items. I tried some really delicious dishes on a recent happy hour visit to the restaurant, which, like I discovered on my first lunchtime visit to the restaurant, I love for its relaxed yet classy atmosphere and exceptional service.  The restaurant uses local produce in its dishes, which made eating vegetarian items like the Castroville Artichoke with pesto aioli ($13) and Wild Museum Soup ($9) so enjoyable.  Eating a large artichoke is always a little hard to handle, but it's also a lot of fun, especially when it's tasty and mesquite-grilled like this one. It was a really great vegetarian option that was perfect for two people, and I loved the smoky qualities of the dish.  The mushroom soup was so delicious, with six types of wild mushrooms, including white shimeji, brown shimeji, maitake and king trumpets. Every bite was a mouth full of mushrooms, which I loved, and this was a thick, hearty soup I would definitely recommend.  The new cocktails (all $12) that accompanied the meals were also delicious. My friend and I loved the Makers Mark Manhattan, with Makers Mark whisky and sweet vermouth and garnished with a Luxardo cherry. It was strong and sweet and had a great holiday spice.  The Ketel One Moscow Mule is also always a great choice, as is the Meyer Lemon Drop, made with house-infused Meyer lemon vodka.  We had to try the delicious new Apple Cinnamon Crisp ($10), which came topped with vanilla ice cream that made every warm bite a perfect holiday dessert.  Other new menu items include Linguine and Shrimp ($23) and Blackened Pacific Redfish ($21 for dinner).  Paul Martin's will have a holiday menu through January 3, as well, including Chilled Alaskan King Crab Legs ($25), Grilled Lamb Sirloin and Herb Crusted Filet Mignon ($39).

Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Makers Mark Manhattan
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Apple crisp

vbuM2EpVvZAYzVxJ0dL-gQ.text: Restaurant kind of seemed like a spin off of Houstons: ie- one page menu ribs, French dip, fish. Ribs were all fat and barbecue sauce was disgusting. Tomato soup had a thick line of oil on top, steak salad was served medium rare when asked to be served medium well- lettuce was limp. French dip was cooked well done on one side and rare on the opposite side. Vegetable pasta was beyond filled with garlic. Menu never stated that vegetable pasta had mushrooms in it, would have liked to know that. Waiter was good pushed a little to hard to order salads and alcohol. Will not return could have gone to Houstons and spent the same amount of money for even better food.

Vd0uTYzkNc1CA2jrU_p46g.text: I recently placed two orders to go. Both times the person on the phone was unfamiliar with the menu, and I had to wait on hold for her to go back and forth to ask basic questions. Both times I picked up the orders, they were incorrect. The first one was missing food--half the order. The second one had the French Dip prepared without following my request for additions. The au jus was way too salty, almost inedible. The mac and cheese was also too salty, probably because the ratio of prosciutto to pasta wasn't well balanced, which is a shame since this is one of the few places that uses good cheddar. Better fries could be had at most fast food restaurants. And the banana cream pie is certainly not worth the calories or money. Do yourself a favor and patronize any number of decent Scottsdale restaurants over this one, which is overpriced and overrated. Might I suggest Roka Akor just up the street?

426eBiOs3YPJ-eKnvI2kDQ.text: ***Great Place!*** Three of us sat in the bar at the communal tables, fun upbeat atmosphere with hip music - We were immediately greeted and ordered beverages (homemade lemonade is amazing!).  Our waitperson, Julia, approached us within 2-3 minutes, she was friendly, well dressed and very professional. She offered appetizers, suggesting some of her favorites, we asked several questions and were surprised that Julia not only knew the ingredients in each dish but also where the product came from AND it's all made from scratch! Love it!!    We ordered Salt & Pepper Wild Prawns * Town Dock Calamari * Kale Caesar Salad * Castroville Artichoke * Spinach Dip and ... we CONSUMED IT ALL  ( : Kale Caesar Salad was my personal favorite, exceptional product, white anchovies and the dressing was absolutely perfect. Least favorite was the Grilled Artichoke, mostly because it was just grilled artichoke. Overall, fabulous experience!!  Noticeably good quality product and nothing tasted sugar enhanced... Nice job PMAG - My new favorite place

N9DQhcPEeMIq-Q8z6QGJtQ.text: Decided to stop in for dinner after my customer event and sat at the bar for dinner.  place was lively and inviting and service was good at the bar.  I started with a Manhattan that was made very well, and then had the steak cobb salad which was excellent and reasonably priced for the quality and quantity.   definitely would recommend this spot.

RVjggQDBkztHM9vIkYtNhw.text: Went here for a Birthday dinner - perfect spot for this!!! I had the homemade lemonade, it was full of flavor! Beware of the  salted butter with the starter bread, it almost kicked me on the ground. They also start you off with a small cup of almonds and olives. Not a fan of olives but the almonds are so nice. I chose the Marinated Skirt Steak for dinner and traded out the fries for mac and cheese. The steak was great, very little fat and flavorful. Mac and cheese was AMAZING!!! I would come here again!

AwY5BGCsMlWk9E6WxM0AOQ.text: Great food at a great price. Decent wine list. Staff was awesome and we never had to ask for refills.

6TJUKV-jX7ULJh6wiWseig.text: Came here for lunch on a weekday, the first week they opened. I can understand that there are always kinks to iron out at a new opening but my experience was just blah. Not good, not bad.. I was with an elderly companion.  After being greeted at the front door the first question from the host/manager was do you have a reservation?  Not, how are you or how is your day going. (No, we don't have a reservation, its 11 am on a wednesday and you've been open 3 days..) We were then asked if we prefer inside or outside. I told them that my friend doesn't like drafty patios much so inside would be best. We were then brought to a table right next to the open screen of that drafty patio. While I thought it looked like a lovely enclosed patio with citrus trees and cute lights, that table was obviously not going to work.  After getting settled into a setback booth the awkward service,  or over - servicing rather, started. I think it was his first serving job so I can cut him a little slack, he was very kind and definitely friendly, just so so awkward. I don't understand it when servers announce their actions. (I will go get your iced teas and be right back with them, I will put your spinach dip in and be back to answer any questions, I'm going to take your plate if you're finished, I see you didn't use your silverware for your appetizers so I dont need to give you new ones..) its idle chatter, sounds unprofessional,  and is so unnecessary.  I know you're coming back with stuff I order...that's why I am here. Service should be unobtrusive at a place like what they're going for, you shouldn't interrupt your diners conversation to complete a list of service points you have to hit. They have a lot of fine tuning to do.  Another awkward thing was the staff that werent waiting on tables all standing around against the walls and watching service. I'm not sure if they were managers, corporate guys, or servers as they were all dressed nice. But the staring was uncomfortable..at least smile while you're watching. And you just opened, I'm sure there's something to do somewhere.  Oh yeah...the food! Nothing to write home about. Nothing stood out on the menu as different than any of the other upscale american grills in the area. They do use all local purveyors and boast a scratch kitchen, which is always a nice touch. I guess I was expecting some new and exciting can't get everywhere menu items to go with that.

Fuujzi8sWXZdK-qC3wRMmA.text: A friend and I decided to try Paul Martin's during restaurant week. Great choice. Neither of us had been here before but I'll certainly be back.  We both ordered from the restaurant week menu. I had a wonderful wild mushroom soup and  grilled salmon. My friend had kale salad and short ribs. Both were prepared well and served hot. We had a great server who graciously packaged up our leftovers. We both commented on the nice ambience, and choice of music.

O4HENV3Omu__WfdbC8xEjg.text: A great american restuarant. The burger is the best in the valley. Also like the BLT with great fries. You won't be disappointed with other items on the menu. The service is just great.

ffzjycLPGjPCGW3z8goNmQ.text: Nice restaurant, little disappointed. Very bad lighting and loud atmosphere. Everything was very expensive (nothing under $15), luckily we ordered off of the little happy hour menu, meaning from $5-12. I ordered a salmon for $9. When it came I received a piece of salmon about 3 inches long and 1 inch wide. Extremely small. It came with four pieces of bread that were burnt. I do not want burnt bread.  The dessert was much better. We ordered the devils food cake and the peach cobbler. the piece of cake was very good, but each dessert was $10. Way too pricy.

dewGnYU6mn2sUvwmUWJnrw.text: Went here with some friends visiting from Chicago, good food and service was excellent.

t-9u6eC-4re_IEkT1Wa3fQ.text: Great food and great service! Myhanh took great care of us. I came with my family - who can be a bit difficult to serve - and we had a wonderful experience. I don't remember the last time I heard my grandfather say that he was truly pleased with a restaurant as he used to be an owner of restaurants! Thanks for the great food and phenomenal service!

esnmW1ON6zddGs_XDcp7LA.text: Our family of 6 went Sunday eve for the first time and it took them 15 mins to get our drink order to us. We ordered wine and beer!  We were not given water until after drinks arrived.  Our resv. was at 7 and at 830 we were still waiting for dinner to be served.  No explanation was given and it was not busy.  Service is SLOW.  Our waitress was very attentive and nice but that does not help with things being slow.  The St. Louis Ribs were partially very tender/part grisley.  The salmon was very good for 2 of us with the prawns being just ok, not much taste to the dish.  Banana cream pie was very good.  The decor is beautiful and upscale..............it's too bad the rest wasn't up to par.

Y6f-Lbk_-oMQgpuGBDxtqA.text: The waiter came to take some plates from our table and I literally told him, "If you touch mine you'll lose a finger!"  Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. We've been to great restaurants (Ramsey's, Nobu, etc.). This was a hidden gem. We'll be back.

p57j4JhrOCdB6VdbKq1Xtw.text: The management and seasoned service at this fine dining establishment are top-notch.  I would recommend checking it out!  75 wines by the glass!  Nice atmosphere on the outdoor patio.  Should get better and better!

iUwd9N9aPy9VA9CTRi-gAw.text: I am a big (and I mean really, really, big) fan of Paul Martin's. My partner and crime Brian V. and I have gone to the El Segundo location for years and go to the new Rancho Cucamonga location at least once a week. That being said, we were looking forward to visiting the Scottsdale location while here on vacation. We dined here three times in 4 days, the first two being for happy hour and the last one for dinner. We had a great experience for the happy hours, and thought we had a great experience for dinner...until the food poisoning hit. Yes, Brian V., my partner in crime, had the seafood platter as his starter, and within 1 hour of finishing our meal (as we were shopping in the Scottsdale Fashion Square) the chills, sweat, and uncontrollable vomiting began.  I got him back to the hotel and promptly called the restaurant to alert them to the problem. Michael, the manager I spoke with was not very helpful, and clearly did not know how to handle the situation. He told me to check in with the other manager tomorrow morning...yeah, not helpful. As I write this at 11:20 pm poor Brian V. is very ill, vomiting and experiencing diarrhea. Thanks for ruining our vacation Scottsdale Paul Martin's.

wSpVhqQMGwoYWTEt4KNFYw.text: We popped in on Saturday night around 8pm thinking we would have no trouble getting a seat in the heat of the summer but it was packed!  We sat at the bar, which was lovely and quite comfortable and enjoyed a great glass of wine and dinner.  We had not tried Paul Martins yet and we were not surprised at how good it was.   I had the salmon salad which I am afraid I will now be craving.  Clearly the fish was fresh.  My husband had the steak frites and it also was beautifully presented and delicious.  Service was friendly but professional.  Great atmosphere inside.  Not too noisy, but kind of a cool vibe.  Great food, of which the menu states is locally sourced as much as possible.  The happy hour menu looked fabulous with a smoked salmon that the couple sitting next to us raved about.  Lots of options price wise and a very nice menu for those watching their health as well as those wanting to splurge on delicious cuts of beef.  Wine list for the by the glass was excellent.

s0pzUYdqM_iFYPbEL_Ay-Q.text: Walking into Paul Matin's American Grill, you'll immediately notice the awesome decor. We were seated on the patio, which was nice but extremely loud. Besides the noise and a long wait for our drink order, everything was really good. I had the hamburger and I recommend it.

y2SDgKZBby-sd8emV6-w5Q.text: Walked out before even ordering.  They were not busy at all but waitress took FOREVER just to bring drinks.  By that time we had changed our mid.  Very pricey and limited menu.  The name 'American Grill' can be deceptive.  Try 'Newport Beach overpriced nuevo American but mostly just trendy'...

SYCAUDh96BokULz8k4VBfQ.text: Great food.  We had 4 kids and they gave us a private room service was good. Kids food was good too.

jhAXSLufIbsBr_IKmQy-tQ.text: Decided try this place out with  1st arrived wasn T sure cause place was pretty empty but the site is stay anyways cause it was kind of late on a  Tuesday our server Michael was great had some great suggestions on the meaning the fried chicken was the best crispy juicy and had a spicy crust the mashed potatoes  Are a must Super fluffy and lots of butter I also had a   Rib eye steak that was OK not the best I've ever had    I think it was just not enough   Marbling have lots of fat I'm outside Probly when not   go back for the stakes  Finish that off With a ice cream sundae There is mediocre nothing special what's get that next time over all but go back again just for that fried chicken

4zggLeBkDFGSASbNFtnW7g.text: Classy American Restaurant   Paul Martin serves solid food, but it's greatest strengths are its beautiful interior and excellent service. I'm from the South and a bit picky on fried chicken, but the fried chicken here was really good! The crust was crisp and substantial without being heavy, and the dish provides a nice combination of white and dark meat. The corn was also tasty, cooked Mexican style. The burger and salad were pretty standard but good. We were taken aback by the strawberry shortcake coming on a biscuit, but I'm sure it's good if you like bread/biscuits. The servers are top notch and very attentive. Overall a lovely experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry Shortcake

_hFrGLciMKMz5zoNYIAGGg.text: We saw pretty good reviews here and decided to check it out. We had no idea it was chain. Pretty good steak chain. I would give it more like 3.7 instead of 4 stars.   We had a reservation and we were seated right away with the friendly host. And our server was very nice and polite, with the usual upsale pitch on wine and specials.   My short rib was absolutely delicious and something I would order again. The mash potatoes were pretty good too. My friends hangar steak was also delicious.   We did have an issue with my buddy's steak in which it had to be remade. Seemed to be well done and dry when we asked for it medium. We usually end up eating stuff even if we don't like it too much, but since we're spending $50 or so on a steak, it had to be perfect. Even when it came out the second time, it still wasn't cooked properly and seemed sort of rushed. It really killed the dining experience. And even if the manager and the server brought out a third steak, it would have been too late.   I give 4 stars because the manager and server handled the situation pretty well. They tried their best and it seems to be a fault in the kitchen side.   Would I come back? Yes, great ambience and service. Food was good, aside from my friends steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Braised Short Ribs

RLQglKYaIfx8qNplx5_mMA.text: Great for a quick date night! We ordered the ahi tuna and butcher's board for appetizers and then the skirt steak and a filet mignon w/ bacon wrapped, crab stuffed shrimp (which is on their holiday menu - please try it before it gets removed!!) which was AMAZING! We loved the ahi tuna with chips as the appetizer and the steak was, of course, delicious!

O7mEzlQ9Nn3rL68PU8CGGg.text: I love happy hour.  And Iove happy hour that goes past 6 PM and happy hour that goes on over the weekend.   This place has both a late and weekend happy hour and great food to boot.  Lucky to be walking distance to this neighborhood gem.   Certainly a calmer and more mature crowd, but the bar fills up fast.   Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rosé reflections on the happy hr menu

rfiTZmnzX_dbiBXDm8Z5YA.text: A fantastic steakhouse in Scottsdale with very attentive service and a glamorous ambiance. Prices are reflective of this, however, well worth it. I had a seasonal special (perfectly prepared) Petit Filet Mignon with bacon-wrapped shrimp. The sides we ordered, brussel sprouts and Mac and cheese, were even better than expected. The cocktail menu also featured unique twists on well-known classics (raspberry mule and whiskey sours were well received at our table). I would be interested in trying a glass from their extensive wine list next time. Highly recommend for a special night out.

2bdPPp_NydCsA_c2fD0rKA.text: We just had a wonderful experience and amazing food.  We enjoyed the ribs. Mac and cheese. And Brussel sprouts. BBQ Corn on the cob.  Brick chicken.  Then to top it off we were served this dessert platter like I've never seen. Anthony the manager brought a bowl of fruit and a smile to our 1 year old just because.  Highly recommended.

tzajysVt1rAjxu9vGV43yA.text: Consistently good food, reasonably priced. Loved the creamed mushroom soup! Staff is prof & attentive. We waited longer than usual for the food, but it was packed. Snowbirds are definitely here.

QjpSnf8dPIXETkqQIX0Uxg.text: We wanted to try out this place since the ratings were good & it wasn't far from our hotel. Our server was friendly & efficient.  The manager stopped by to check to see how we were doing since there was a bit of a mix up with our reservation. Things were handled respectfully & promptly so not a big deal for us! We ate a lighter sort of meal since we'd over indulged the day before. We split a burger & a chicken asian salad & both were prepared to our liking. The salad was fresh & flavorful & the burger has a pinkness to the medium request & the bun was dressed with enough seasoning to hit the spot! I'd recommend giving it a try. It is a large room & noise level is a bit loud but didn't bother me like it did my husband.

bNruwC_-ELZXqUN6h5xmJA.text: Come to a great romantic place in Scottsdale for Lunch and dinner. It is romantic and the ambiance is amazing. The lunch & entrees, appetizers,salads, fish, steaks, and real ice cream including coffee ice cream, to die for Almond cake & chocolate cake. Remember Do Not Bring Your Babies or Kids, this place is Not for them at all!!Brett the mgr looks like actor James Marsden, come on in

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

97XcGWMJFNBlrKxXj-mGUA.text: Ask and you shall receive!  We didn't have to ask for GREAT customer service today-but it was handed to us on a silver platter.  Paul was our delightful server-and he intuitively responded to our needs, whether we overtly stated them or not.  If I said I like lemons-we received a bowl of lemons for our drinks, when I had difficulty choosing between an Almond Cake or Chocolate Cake for dessert, and ultimately chose the Almond selection-Paul brought an additional bowl of chocolate sauce for the optional drizzle.  When we were leaving-he promptly delivered our two iced teas to go-to quench us in the climbing heat.  It was nice to be taken care of-without asking.  My hubby enjoyed the Bleu Cheese Burger, oozing cheesy goodness, served on a perfect bun and accompanied by crispy fries. I opted for the Grilled Shrimp Butter Lettuce Salad-a lighter fare to justify dessert later.  Both were delicious and satisfying to our individual tastebuds.  We will be back-and we will ask for Paul-easy to remember-maybe his last name is Martin!  Wink!

rkAP3t5bTh7-QnXI0fmeYQ.text: Definitely a new favorite! Service and ambiance were impeccable and food and cocktails were just right. Halibut fish tacos were loaded with generous pieces of halibut with loads of fresh veggies and sauce, and grilled halibut was perfectly done with a really nice lemony flair. We tried adult sparkling lemonade at the server's suggestion and loved it.   Very nicely done, and we will be back.

YEiptKLFJQhWox3yzu_fYQ.text: Hands down, the best service I have ever had. I have been here 3 separate times and each time has been an absolute pleasure. First, I called in to see if there was a wait. Makayla answered the phone and was extremely accommodating. Although spring training was here and all the restaurants were full, she put us on the list. When we arrived, we said we wanted to do the happy hour and were seated in the bar area at the high top tables. I don't normally like community high tops, but their chairs are incredibly comfortable ( and I have arthritis of the spine). Our server, Courtney was fantastic. We had him as a server the last time as well and he is incredibly attentive and friendly. I tried to order a cocktail I had previously, but it was seasonal. Courtney suggested alternatives, but also asked the bartender if they could make my seasonal cocktail. The bartender (I don't know his name - sorry) was able to make the cocktail and it was delicious. The service was quick and fantastic. I have a very specialized order and everything came out correct and tasted delicious. 10/10 would recommend.

j4Q9WmHKe-SmCrvNFLP-LQ.text: Food overall was well liked. Very clean and neat atmosphere with a great out door patio when the temperature is right. Salt and pepper shrimp are tasty(not pictured because they were eaten to fast)
