IW_jVkH_laD82KrNIMLfjQ.text: This actually is the 3rd time we've been here. Don't know why I didn't review it before. If I had I'd have given it 4 srars. This time it gets a solid 5 stars. We understand there's been a recent change of chefs. This is a good thing. The food was always good but this time it was outstanding. First the service could not have been better. Our waitress, Annie (sp) was probably the best waitress we've ever had. Friendly and attentive but also gave us very interesting info on the kitchen and the food. She was just great.  The food was outstanding. We started with their Salt and Pepper shrimp. Fried with a great pesto aioli. I odered a special that was fried chicken. What came we six pieces of white breast meat with skin fried to perfection. While boneless, they are not chicken nuggests. The way the beast was butchered, it really is like traditional fried chicken. The coating was very tasty and the chicken moist. It was served with a killer dipping sauce, like a honey chili sauce. Also the accompanying potatoe salad was greast. Wife had a grilled skirt steak which was excellent served with these grilled sweet potatoes that were beyond great. We finished with a strawberry short cake on a southern cheese bisquit that made this desert the best version I've ever had.  Great service, good prices, nice sized dishes that are first rate. Wonderful place.

r_Duba35kt-D25578JFh4A.text: This was a great dining experience. The food, drink and service were awesome!

829jhGxzt5-BGaZboGb0ww.text: Sooooo after loving the Paul Martins in Irvine we thought this would be as good as the others. We went weekly. Unfortunately we were sooo disappointed. Unlike the Hillstone Group which are all great this particular restaurant was a huge let down. Yes, the ambiance is great & we had good service. BUT the food .... we went with another couple on a sat night & ordered filets. They were tasteless . Period. End of story. One person ordered the skirt steak which was chewy. Very. Even the hot fudge sundaes were bad. On par with Dairy Queen.  $200 later per couple I don't think we will return. Bandera here we come ...

uE9jZLFLShp0nHoz-IwSyw.text: I was really disappointed in the thin and poorly prepared New York Steak. Nothing like a real steak house by comparison! Tasted like pan fried, greasy and couldn't eat but a couple bites and at $45,  I expected so much more. The fish and chicken were received well by other group members. Service was great. We finished up with ice cream and a drizzle of home made fudge, really a drizzle! Next time I have $200 to spend I'll look elsewhere.

RuEO-yT4V982QhKLEki9Sw.text: My mother and I ate lunch here on a quiet Saturday afternoon.  Our waiter was very pleasant and attentive.  My mother really enjoyed the veggie burger, which is made in house, and the quinoa bowl, which I never order before was very good too.

dHAA-fzgNsoXIliL2dC3KQ.text: Ended up here kind of by accident. We were trying to go to the restaurant next door but we're facing a long wait time. So instead we tried Paul martins and the wait was far shorter. This turned out to be an excellent decision! I had the brick chicken and that was the most tender chicken I've had. It almost melted in your mouth. I would highly recommend it!

7yHfnRhezvj4gEzvXZuP0Q.text: We made reservations for 11 this week for dinner.  Everyone was so accommodating and patient.  The drinks never emptied and the service was awesome.  We had the all the appetizers but the yummy bread was the best!  Calamari was ever so salty and fresh!  I had the skirt steak and it was cooked to perfection.  Juicy and tasty.  The lemon creme brulee was out of this world  The group loved the banana creme pie.    No negatives to report.  All the things!

Yqky3fdFH0YipUP91W3V5Q.text: The Black Angus Steakhouse is way way way better than it. The New York strip steak which is the most expensive one is just about average, maybe even worse than the steak from Sizzler. The fish taco is OK, but I would prefer the one from Outback. Also the waiting time was unbearable long, we didn't made a reservation as the day we visited was Tuesday. I guess the only reason people would dine in there is that they can use the Amex spend 50+ get 25 back offer.

3bEoB7IwYlhWSklJn2VstA.text: Came here for happy hour and was not disappointed. Our server, Shannon, was extremely friendly and helpful. My husband and I shared the salmon lettuce cups, the cheese platter and macaroni and cheese. All were delicious and the portions were just enough to ride us over.   The mojito and cosmopolitans were perfectly made.   Cosy atmosphere. Overall, a really lovely place.

2QAsnogdAu0kKZDUbPFaFg.text: Set up reservation with manager Timm for  April 13th .  Our party had an excellant lunch , service was great , outdoor dining  was very enjoyable .Would love to come back for dinner  first class  all the way

c7jeN6vQjUcMdy4Bsn85vg.text: I stopped in for lunch and sat at the bar with a friend, the bartender was really friendly, we told him it was our first time and weren't sure what to order. He suggested the pastrami sandwich "which I had" omg best sandwich I've ever had, the fresh ground mustard had me, not to mention the grass Feed beef. I mostly Definitely recommend trying the sandwich, I will be back to explore more of the menu.

Sp3ZCpMmO77DbsROGDualw.text: The manager was very attentive and most of all welcomed us as we were visiting for the first time experiencing a special occasion.   The Monday $50 special is amazing and not only is it a great deal, but they understand that because of the deal, they will attract new guests and work hard to make them return guests.   Love this spot and can't wait to go back!

A0aVw43LMFE4GZ2_xWj20A.text: My boyfriend and I just had dinner here tonight and I have to say that it was great! To start off the restaurant is beautiful. The service was great! Their cocktails are amazing...if you like martini's you have to try their raspberry martini...it's delicious!!! And for all those chocolate lovers out there, like me, the Chocolate Devils Cake is phenomenal!!!  Highly recommend this place!

_9h4y0rTizSXRnbZhn_bOA.text: Time for me to update my previous review.  Yes we had a horrible experience last year at Paul Martin's, the general manager did contact me and comp'd a meal for me and a guest. That experience was great, but then again there were ready and on guard for us.   We returned last Saturday without prior notice. After arriving early, we sat at the bar for cocktails while waiting for our table to be ready. Drinks were great, the bartender engaging, servers were fantastic and stopping by to say hello as we waited. Once our table was ready we headed off to dinner. Our server, Heather English was amazing! We ordered appetizers and additional drinks. While waiting for those fresh bread was brought to the table and The manager stop by to say hello to see if our experience was going well. Yes dinner was spectacular!  But, the service was attentive without her hovering or ever making us feel like we were just 'another' table.  Wonderful experience.   In closing, I highly recommend Paul Martin's as it seems as though the bugs have all been worked out...!  In fact, I'm heading there next Tuesday for lunch with colleagues.

e4SdTNok2DUBM4xKJsaktA.text: The restaurant is beautiful. The service great. The food was not great. My fish tacos consisted of a nice piece of mahi mahi covered with and I mean covered with sauteed stringed red onion and long pieces of parsley. The short ribs serving was very small and ok glaze-wise. The pasta dish was nice. For the price, nothing to rave about. If plain food that looks fancy is your thing then this place is for you.

Yf0mI8Ggq5coDRt_FRJ5CQ.text: Our server was friendly/polite and the food was great. If you drink scotch here, don't add ice or water. They don't filter the water/ice, and it tastes like crap. I ordered a Macallan with 3 ice cubes. Completely ruined the drink. Yeah, some people think you shouldn't add ice/water to scotch. Let me drink my drink the way I want to. Anyway, the ice was so gross, it ruined the $20 drink. Completely offensive and a waste of money. That's why you only get 3 stars.

jUS6sCWkQyc8pSPJ6r6hOg.text: It is my personal opinion that for about $100 for two is was a "I won't be back". The appetizer was skmpy. My main course was oily and the salad was truly pitiful. AND please stop asking if we want more to drink.

VCLRIZSiWRy5PCJljOGScg.text: 6-7-2015 We had the most fabulous dinner! It was a last minute decision to drop in at Paul Martin's and it was the best meal of during our week in Scottsdale.  I had the skirt steak and husband had the brick chicken.  We ended with a shared piece of the banana cream pie.  The service was outstanding.  The food was so delicious.  AND the drinks were so fresh we ordered a second round.  Don't pass up this restaurant.  You will not be disappointed.

M0NdgTTNUveu3wfhZ2G1RA.text: My visit to Paul Martin was like going on a roller coaster ride. At the start, my expectations were high (good service and management) based on what I've heard from prior customers. At the peak of the "ride" (the prime rib), it was enjoyable. The prime rib was cooked perfectly at medium-rare and seasoned well. Near the end, I was disarmed by poor service (incompetent and rude waiter) and gross ice cream (specifically the gingerbread and chocolate flavors. I couldn't eat it.) -- to the point where I just wanted to get out of there or risk vomiting from disappointment and annoyance.   4 stars for prime rib/salad and management downgraded to 2 stars for service and non-lactose free dessert.

XMkYz6ULuoK1slToqrCIKw.text: This restaurant is in our neighborhood, and we were anxious to try it for the first time today. Sunday afternoon, around 1:00 pm. We were greeted nicely from the hostess who sat us outside, per our request. At least 10 minutes later, after no one had come to greet us, much less ask for our drink order or ask if we had any questions about the menu, so we left. We eat out every single Sunday, we probably won't be back to Paul's.

dd8sjM_Xr8PBzZ6Rl9UonQ.text: With my family, I went to Paul Martin's during Sunday night eating the Sunday all-day prime rib special for $25. It is not the worst, nor the best either. I have a list of pros and cons to show why I put 4 (and not 5) stars.  Pros: Overall, the food is pretty good. The prime rib special comes with an appetizer of green salad, an entree of prime rib with mashed potatoes, along with a desert with a shortbread cookie with three scoops of ice cream. Each of the courses were delicious: the green salad has fresh vegetables, along with the dressing blending all the vegetables together perfectly. The prime rib is very tender (with quite a bit of fat for most of our dishes) and the mashed potatoes were neither too mushy nor powdery. I was extremely satisfied by the size of the steak(most of us needed to box the steak) The ice cream is very creamy, and the shortbread cookies were a bit overwhelming, since there was too much sugar. The environment of the restaurant is relaxing, and it makes you feel as if you are in a movie theater. Fortunately, it was bright enough for us to read our menus, but I could use a bit more light.  Cons: The service was somehow disappointing. It was not as good as the last time I went there, since the waiter needed to be reminded multiple times in order to be told that one of our guests is lactose intolerant; he told us the ice cream is gluten-free. The waiters are not as knowledgeable as the managers themselves, since we asked if we could use a gift card that we bought the same day and he wasn't sure. We had to wait for quite a while in order for him to figure that out.  The food is not as good as what I hoped it to be, and I am somehow discouraged. I was not the slightest bit impressed or blown away by what happened today, mostly due to the lousy service. I truly hope that the next time I come back, I will not be dissatisfied again.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The ice cream
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huge steak. I could definitely not finish it.

qEfpK_B_RUwe3IvXCLHt-A.text: There's nothing not to love about Paul Martins. The food is unbelievable. You can Taste the quality of the fresh produce and high quality meat that they serve, they deff don't scrimp on any ingredients. The customers service is always consistent and outstanding. And their specials that they have are such a great deal, seriously can't beat PM. I have been here for both dinner and brunch and its exceptional, my favorite place to eat in the Valley.

7pf0VuKS_wtN88Co2G8SGg.text: I went here only because of the reviews.  In fact, I was expecting to go somewhere else, but changed my reservation because of the reviews.  WOW, was I disappointed.  I thought the menu choices were not so great.  The food was very average.  The service was below par.  The table next to me, was discussing among themselves how poor their experience was; I wanted to join in their conversation.  I did not like my appetizer, I did not like my main course and I did not like the dessert.

7SRj4FrQUEzBA8rHfClLhA.text: Great tasting coffee. Had Valentine's Day lunch before leaving town. Had a burger and split a mac and cheese with the wife. The fries are fresh cut and never frozen.  Good food, fast service and friendly staff! Will return next time in town!

G90ig5D9cjamgDoD66hR6g.text: We made reservations on opentable for this place for my 6 yr. Anniversary dinner for the main reason that their menu shows that they focus on healthy eating and the foods change with the seasons. When we arrived we were greeted and sat down right away. The ambience this location has is so warm and comfortable, within minutes we had water at our table and a welcoming waitress asking what she can get us to drink. I stuck with water but my wife and our friend got a beer and I ordered the salt and pepper shrimp as our appetizer. (Yes, we had a friend come along to our anniversary dinner since afterward we were heading to a concert.) The waitress was so friendly and was quick to answer all the questions we had after bringing our drinks back. As we were getting ready to order the shrimp arrived and they were so delicious, They were perfectly seasoned and fried. I ordered the Cajun ribeye and it did not disappoint!!! I absolutely loved it. It was cooked to perfection and so juicy. For dessert we got the Ice cream on top of this cake thing... HAHAHA, don't know what it was called but I pretty much ate the whole thing. I gave my wife a bit and luckily our friend didn't want to try it which I was ok with because it meant more for me. The restaurant has warm and comfortable vibe to it, you can be dressed up or casual and it feels right either way. The cost wasn't that bad either for the amazing food we had!! Usually for healthy option restaurants you have to accept youll have to pay for what you get, in my opinion we got a smoking deal!!! To top it off the staff is amazing, they were so kind and welcoming... We will definitely be making a trip back soon, maybe once the menu changes so we can try something new!

tdAVkArLE4gGMUxpVSOw5g.text: Plus being an exceptional experience it was ALSO how effortless they did all the right things. Great food, great service and exceptional attention by the Manager! From walking in to leaving, embracing all the best of hospitality. Happy to be residents of beautiful Az. & Co..

18cPc5UcR3vcXWMpH6VKdQ.text: Excellent Restaurant Week selection. Beautiful decor, tasty food and excellent service. Our server, Angelo was knowledgeable and friendly. It could not have been better.

B0XhWMNISjDyuVhpb1HaxA.text: Great place!  Went there on a Friday night.  Delicious food, fabulous staff.  Christian was incredibly kind and attentive.  Highly recommend!!!

3j3OmpHDsoQUhjcw7jMElA.text: We just tried Paul Martin's for the first time with the Arizona Restaurant Week menu. Holy cow was it good! All the food was amazing, particularly the mushroom soup and the braised short ribs. Service was excellent as well, very quick, friendly but not obnoxious. We will certainly be back.

Q0gJ7DNtIJFWEQhsLVt8lA.text: WOW!! Great food, great service,  it needs no more words. Go try it and save me a spot at the community table in the bar.

ZRxe9fn4N2uf8HEmeD_I7w.text: Overall impression: Over-rated and over-priced for the quality of food.   Atmosphere: Great remodel of the old J. Alexander's with a more upscale feel. Layout is open with a bar in the rear that includes a few tables and lots of bar seating. When we were there it was quiet and slow. Tables are set nicely. Atmosphere is upscale.   Service: Service was attentive and friendly. Policies don't seem as welcoming. We were served a tiny dish of olives (1" round dish that had 4 or 5 pea sized olives in it...maybe 1 tablespoon of olives). We asked if we could have more but were told that they would have to charge us $5 for another dish. If this had been a large dish of olives, such as the free plate of bread and olives that they serve at Houston's across the street, I could understand the charge, but this was a tablespoon of olives! We asked for bread, got 3 half-slices slices of bread which was good but almost certainly not baked in house.   Menu: Prices are very high but comparable to what you would find in steak houses in the area; however, the food is more casual (burgers, mac & cheese, spinach dip, french dip) so prices seem on the high end of what they should be. Starters such as cheese plate are $12 per person, spinach dip $14, and shrimp appetizer, $17. Entrees range from $13 for a veggie burger ($14 for regular meat burger), and an additional $6 for fries with that burger, and they go up to $39 for a NY steak.  I had the house made polenta and vegetables in tomato creme. The veggies were greasy overcooked. I was not able to cut them with my knife. The polenta was burnt (not just charred but black). It all sat in a lot of tomato creme which seemed to clash with the flavors of the grilled veggies. When the server asked how our food was, I said it was okay but I wondered if the polenta was supposed to be served that charred. The manager saw the polenta, apologized, and removed it. My dining companion had the chicken with mashed potatoes and liked it ($21). For dessert we had banana creme pie. Also disappointing. The crust had a thin ribbon of ganache on the bottom, topped by about 1/2" of vanilla cream with a few slices of banana, topped with almost an inch of unsweetened whipped creme.  I wanted to like this dessert but it was bland. We left half of it on the plate.   We probably won't return. I would instead head over to Houstons for casual dining or Eddie Vs for steaks and seafood. Even though the prices were similar to other restaurants in the area, the quality was not.

ttUGfM1fgINYo-tKyNUOjw.text: I visited Paul Martin's for the first time last night.  I loved the smoked salmon that I had.  It was outstanding, however they served a nice piece of healthy fish with 4 ginormous pieces of bread.  I would have rather had a vegetable or side salad.

ZZDH07HmfahHpmZMBsJcyg.text: In Scottsdale from Seattle on business.  Paul Martin's was near the hotel so my business colleague and I thought we would give the place a try.   Initial impression from the parking lot was that it may be out of our price range.   But we were pleasantly surprised by the food prices as well as the service.  I had the skirt stake which was outstanding.   And Mary, our server did an awesome job in taking care of us.   I would highly recommend!

N5jNcxU1UijL5IMJNignlQ.text: Very good experience, overall. Service was excellent, food was very good. I had the cedar plank salmon with mashed potatoes...excellent! There is a 42.00 steak that two others split but "it wasn't worth it". Deserts were overpriced but good. The only complaint was how cold it was in the dining room.

sLhTGNNBDyO2D68y8ofciA.text: We visited this very sexy and modern restaurant for dinner last Saturday evening.  We were seated on the patio which had heaters if necessary.  Our server was Caryn, and she was on her toes at all times.  She definitely knows her menu and made many recommendations on the wine and the food.  She did point out the 3 course special which consists of a $30 per person menu + $5 glass of wine.  We both ordered the short ribs with the kale salad and ice cream and short bread cookies for dessert.  This was my first experience with kale salad and it will not be the last - it was delicious!  The meat on the ribs melted in your mouth as did the fluffy mashed potatoes.  The manager brought me the wine and he checked in with us later during the meal.  Caryn was delightful as our server and was both pleasant and interesting.  She conveys the mood of the restaurant - efficient, young, hip and in touch with the surroundings.  We left the restaurant very satisfied with our experience!

Q6E7D2Qfdd8tgzy-d7TGGg.text: Wow! In my one month stay in Scottsdale,I haven't had food & service as great as I did at Paul Martins! First off the place is a very nice and modern place with a great ambiance, second the food was amazing from the appetizer to desert and third, our server (Joe) was the best! He was knowledgeable and attentive!  We started with the spinach dip which I liked but my husband loved! Then we let our server decide the entree for us and he recommended a great white wine as well as the kale pasta for me and a brick chicken for my husband and to my surprise they were not the most expensive items on the menu. Both the entrees were the best food we had in our entire stay! Then we went for the Apple crisp as our server recommend and it was amazing! It can definitely cure anyone's sweet tooth. I don't know who Paul Martin is but he is definitely doing a great job with his food and staff! I wish I would have found this place earlier in our stay, but now we know our spot when we visit again!

lP6L3bXpzoHynlW6lM3sYQ.text: Actually closer to 3.5 stars. The restaurant's menu is as generic as the name. If you don't like seafood or meat - you are certainly not going find much to eat here. The menu is not creative and the dishes are all standard. As far as the food goes...I had a burger and it was excellent - cooked to perfection, which is a plus. When I asked the waiter, he said the meat was organic, but I am suspicious because it wasn't mentioned that way on the menu. The salad that accompanied it was awesome too. My date had the polenta, which was supposed to be served with freshly grated Parmesan cheese,  but wasn't. She also mentioned there wasn't enough sauce served with her dish and had to ask for more. I had a beer, in which I was charged more then what the menu said it cost and she had a glass of wine. For dessert, we split the strawberry shortcake. Yes, it was delicious, but jeez for $10 could they be any more skimpy on the strawberries? There weren't even enough slices to taste one in every bite. It was more like powdered sugar, fresh biscuit and whipped cream with a strawberry garnish. Although they were thinly sliced, I can't imagine there were more than two and half small strawberries served in the dish. The service was very good. Perhaps, my only complaint is that our waiter did not give us enough time to try our meals before he asked how our food was. The manager did briefly stop by our table. I would not go back to this restaurant without another coupon and even then - it wasn't really a great deal. This place is way overpriced. I agree with a previous Yelper that Roaring Fork is much better. I'd also add so is Seasons 52.

SJxIYos1GDBi3ktkmiu3BA.text: went here for the second time tonight. our first experience (it's the food) not so great. so tonight we decided to give it a second shot. sadly, our second time was even worse. the service is okay. we always sit at the bar. it's the food that is extremely disappointing. our bill was $125. we had 4 glasses of wine, an app, a salad and the french dip. the french fries were the best thing we had. our app, the street steak tacos, just okay. loaded with giant bites of fat that i picked away before taking a bite. next our chicken salad and french dip. the chicken salad was BAD. the chicken disintegrated into a paste/powder. i ate about 1/4 of the salad. the french dip served on a focaccia roll. focaccia i've seen for breakfast and lunch sandwiches, not dinner. awful. i had a stomach ache by the time we left the restaurant. we are weekly patrons of houston's across the street and there is a reason. the food is ALWAYS good and the service is beyond amazing. we were looking forward to have a new haunt to enjoy, but houston's will be it, not paul martin's. very disappointing. food BAD.

Jn6qYTuCQuGdLXS-2i1jLA.text: GREAT PLACE- GREAT SERVICE- place has awesome atmosphere- happy hour specials are all very good!  bartenders fun and nice- will be back for sure!

YnDzGtbMV1TUP9A8qu_2rw.text: Probably the best happy hour in town. I had the smoked wings and tater tots (which are more like fried mashed potato balls) so who can go wrong with that?! My boyfriend had a burger/fries/beer combo for $13! The food was hot, fresh and delicious. The portions were very generous too and the ambiance is so inviting and romantic. Will definitely be back!!

KISVIPR8pNRjlpF4_Y0Nbg.text: We've gone to this restaurant twice before and decided to go back for my wife's birthday.  The salad had way too much dressing on it that no one ate it.  My wife and her father ordered the salmon that also came with sweet potatoes.  There was so much sauce on the potatoes that it ran into the salmon. It ruined it.  It's sad to say that the bread, and beverages were the best part of the meal.  We won't be going back there.

2JfDVea3IH2QDhuqSosz1g.text: We stumbled on this at the Borgata shopping mall and were glad we did.  Although they were crowded, we were able to be seated shortly.  They have indoor and outdoor seating but due to the wind we sat inside.   It had a nice vibe and the hostess was very friendly and helpful-even returned to the table to answer a question we had.  My friend had the mushroom soup and loved it.  I had the skirt steak which was very good.  It was tender and tasty and came with some arugula and sliced sweet potatoes..  The service was great and it was a good meal.  I'd definitely go back when in the area.

WvTbwUZ_r5_GYpdlY-ZVjg.text: We were visiting from  California. I love artichokes. The choke here was the best I ever had!  The beef in the French dip was so tender and tasty. The au juis was too salty. My wife had the fried chicken special.  Great deal. Fried chicken was good. The service was professional and courteous.

eg1NrxRPlTPp5kb6_4jLyQ.text: Have had the pleasure of dining here several times & felt it was time for a review. Food today was great. Their mushroom soup is rich & delicious. My friend ordered the mushroom burger (vegetarian & comprised of several varieties of mushrooms). She was kind enough to share & I must say it was the best vegetarian burger I've ever had. Another friend was celebrating a birthday & the restaurant was kind enough to bring a complimentary dessert. Wish I knew the name as it was extraordinary ~ chocolate bottom with peanut butter, ice cream & topped with a roasted marshmallow. I would return just for the dessert.   Our server, Trent, was excellent as was the manager who made sure we were enjoying our lunch. Great food, great service & a beautiful environment.

nTfI3wlVeg5Al_ZLjTWS7Q.text: Awesome food. Great haPpy hour prices, and the oysters were heavenly. We had chicken wings and ribs. Generous pour on the wine and delicious beer. Hannah was a friendly, attentive server. Dessert was a delicious chocolate cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate cake with whipped cream and vanilla ice cream

9IDD91bFvJ6EZ0VPkMCHTg.text: Came here for my birthday last year and I had such a wonderful time! It was a little hard to hear but the service was friendly. ZERO complaints about the food, all was delicious. Price point is definitely higher than what I would've liked. Overall, great experience and amazing menu!

GwCi_-_RxHfYF1BFBJqHLg.text: Amazing is al I have to say! My husband and I popped in for date night. Our server Steven was great! Food was out of this world. So much flavor!! Highly recommend the roasted cauliflower and grilled artichoke. Expensive...yes. But wonderfully prepared! Will totally come back!!!

XXxlE0nqQPUdZRKoNN1sxg.text: We had dinner here this evening.  We had an enjoyable time.  I like the restaurant decor, hip and modern but unpretentious.  They give you tasty bread and butter to start.  Entrees were good but pricey for the portion size.  My husband had the Marinated Skirt Steak which he said was delicious.  I had read the Brick Chicken was amazing so I ordered it (and I never order chicken when dining out).  Honestly it was just 'ok' and when it arrived I wished I'd have ordered something different.  I could very easily make this at home and the skin on the chicken didn't taste very good.  Kind of disappointing.  But I'm glad we tried the place out.  I'm hoping to return to try their prime rib special for a little better deal.

F3K3XzX0eyjqPjLirdkUGQ.text: The food and service was outstanding. We can wait to go back to try more of wonderful menu.

CiMvqGV6LdCqN45rRqKtMw.text: Thefreeters were very nice.  Our waiter, Courtney was friendly and very attentive.  He made some great drink recommendations.  The bread on the hamburger is very good.  This is a great place to eat!

8Y7QeNZCRaAKZ4ey4rN9wQ.text: I had a really weird, really busy day. When I have such a day (it happens at least twice a week) I want someone else to cook for me. And I want a drink. So, I pass Paul Martin's twice a day. Last night I was starving and so many places close at 9. Paul was open till 10. Side note - I went to Taphouse Kitchen which states online that they are open till 10, but upon walking in at 8:40, I was informed in an unfriendly way by the bartender that the kitchen was closed. I am a bartender / server on weekends so I get the sense of a shitty attitude right off the bat. Can I do two reviews at once? Anyway... I walk in to Paul Martin's, was greeted immediately, went to sit at the bar. I am a vegan and can usually find something to eat at restaurants. Robert was behind the bar this particular evening and he assured that my needs were met, and he was also very pleasant to talk to. I felt bad because he had a couple come in at 9:57 and order a bottle of wine. They close at 10. No idea how long he was there. Great service. Great food. Had the grilled artichoke and quinoa bowl. Thanks, Robert. Will be back.

mXckPPXUnSAv19clitZT5A.text: We had an amazing experience at Paul Martin's so I wanted to share it with the rest of the Scottsdale community. We arrive at 8:00PM without a reservation, not knowing if they were going to be able to seat us right away.. and they did no problem. Our waitress, Heather, was incredible right from the get-go. I have food allergies and she wasn't hesitant or put off by my inquisitions. She was willing to go above and beyond my requests and made me feel special like every other patron. When you have food allergies, most of the time, your options are limited to one or two "safe" things on the menu. Heather was able to offer me alternatives and meet my requests no problem.  FOR THOSE OF YOU WITH GLUTEN ALLERGIES/SENSITIVITIES - they have a SEPARATE fryer for their french fries, which means no cross contamination!! This is epic, considering most restaurants just pile them all in together. I was so excited to be able to get a bunless burger, with the toppings, and sweet potato fries that were super crispy and flavorful. It was one of the best experiences I've had eating out in ages and I can't say enough good things about their waitstaff, their food and their service. HIGHLY recommend!!!

0ynxFk8xlbu-uJgsEbsTzQ.text: MUCH Improved!!!  I had a pretty unpleasant experience dining at Paul Martin's some time ago. I believe it was not too long after they opened. The only thing that lured me back to try again was their 3 course Sunday Prime Rib Special.  It is a beautiful venue, and since it wasn't very busy, I decided to sit at the bar where service would be pretty much captive. From the moment that I sat down, the Bar Tender, Dustin, took excellent care of my dining experience. He was on top of everything. In addition, this time, my food was excellent.   The Prim Rib started with a salad course, then there was a main course of perfectly cooked prime rib and mashed potatoes, and finally three scoops of their house made ice cream, with a couple of out of this world sugar cookies.   The last time I was at Paul Martin's, the salad was so poorly executed and poorly dressed that, since no one came back to check on me after leaving it, I had to resort to making up for the missing dressing with salt. Not so this time! It was perfectly dressed and delicious! Also, because Dustin continuously checked back with me, if there had been anything amiss, I know it would have been tended to.   When I cautiously asked for my Prime Rib rare, he assured me that they would prepare it any way that I would like - and they did! The Prime Rib was delicious, even if I didn't quite get their take on creamy horseradish sauce. It was a little too adulterated with other ingredients, and I couldn't taste the horseradish. I'm not a purist, but when asked, Dustin brought me a little dish of plain horseradish. Perhaps it was house made in some off beat way. It didn't taste like horseradish either, and had absolutely no bite,. That was OK though, the Prime Rib was just fine on its own. The mashed potatoes with the Prime Rib were delicious!  Finally, full as I was, I gave in to the house made ice cream. It was the creamiest ice cream I have ever tasted. Along with it were served the most wonderful "melt in your mouth" sugar cookies, with coarse sugar around the edges. I wasn't even close to finishing the ice cream when I had to give up, but I wrapped my other cookie up in a cocktail napkin and took it home for later. No way was I going to leave that cookie behind.  So I had a delicious, well orchestrated meal, and Dustin completely made my experience far and away better than my previous visit. I will definitely be eating at the bar from now on.

KVfUrewAl8E5Kvt0ObMQ_w.text: Our server was the best, I mean over the top kind of service and I always appreciate over the top kind of service.  This might sound odd to you but we ordered a side of broccolini and I'm still dreaming about it.  It was so simple, yet sometimes the simplest of flavors seem to make my tastebuds scream the most.  So tip, get the broccolini all to yourself.  We also ordered a side of the macaroni and cheese, which was creamy, crunchy (from the prosciutto) and also a favorite.  My dish was the winner for the night.  The short ribs were tender and melt in your mouth good, that with the broccolini, what more do you need.  My husband enjoyed his skirt steak but was disappointed that the menu said potatoes as the side and he ended up with three huge tomatoes on his plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. skirt steak
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. sweet potato fries

qr1AFM1H06lXrJ1ItmK2Kw.text: MONDAY NIGHTS  $50 - Bottle of Wine, 2 Spring Salads and 2 Entrees of choice.    Are you kidding this is the best deal it town!!!  I have been here twice now for this deal.  First visit we ordered the Annabella Pinot Noir - Great Food wine - a little more bold than typical PN's. My friend ordered the linguine and shrimp and I the hanger Steak.  We split each dish and they were a great compliment. The pasta is great with the garlic and spinach (add a squeeze of lemon and you are golden) and the steak was cooked to perfection.  Who doesnt love steak and mashed potatoes though.  Second visit we ordered the Annabella again because its just so good!  This time I had the Seared Tuna and my dad had the Cedar Plank Steelhead. These are two of my all time favorite dishes! Tuna had the best sear and the crust flavoring pairs so well with the pickled onions and arugula salad with white beans.  I legit licked my plate... not one of my finer moments. My dads salmon was killer in the mushroom jus - they do an excellent job of pairing foods and flavors with one another.   Oh also came here for happy hour (3PM-7PM everyday!) and sat at the bar, great vibe cool bartenders.  Had some Rose with the prosciutto crostini, smoked salmon flat bread, and smoked chicken and wings.  Love it all!! Great spot for a meeting too!

uKLfNkk5OKptJ8WVO8_w4Q.text: Great Happy Hour! We will be back. Small bites and the setting was really nice. Located around many other restaurants this one is for sure one to stop by.

-MZjMKyTQRdSta7U0YmvDQ.text: Our 1st time here.  Monday night $50 special (2 entrees, 2 house salads and a bottle of wine).  I had the brick chicken and my husband had the marinated pork chops.  Both were incredible!  My brick chicken was so tender and came with roasted garlic and really nice mashed potatoes.  It was so good I'd probably order the same thing next time around.  He said his pork chops were very good too!  If you go on a Monday, make reservations and use the valet to park (the parking lot was totally full).  All in all, it was an enjoyable dinner with excellent service.

cQBmgx6LOGF-_LhuxWa3wg.text: Second time at this place. Really like the atmosphere here. Laid back. Contemporary design. Spread out. Beautiful outdoor patio and bar. You never feel rushed in this place. A good representation of AZ cool.   Food is equally excellent. Wonderful beef here for the price. Blackened rib eye steak was tender, juicy Med rare with nice blackened spice on it. A dab of steak butter on top was like frosting!.   Artichoke appetizer was overpriced kinda tough and not worth it. Generous pours on wine but a little on the overpriced side. I can't see spending $17 for a glass of wine. Just doesn't make sense to me. Lower your prices guys. Companion had skirt steak and it was equally very good.   Earlier visit I had brick chicken and was great too. Mashed potatoes are spot on.   A very good restaurant that delivers pretty well.   Bandera down the road is very much like this restaurant but it surpasses on all levels. Just smaller in size.

q0vghLnHwyeU9lzZ5-rMaw.text: The rib eye was off the charts good. Perfect seasoning.  Cooked perfectly. My sister enjoyed the fried chicken. Very moist and tender. The Brussels sprouts are a must.  The bread truly homemade best I have had at  a restuarant.  My wife had the butter cake dessert.  Wow! Remarkable night, our server Koya (sp) was always spot on. The hostess team was very accommodating (Mikayla was exceptional),  made us feel like we were right at home, we will be back.  Minor detail, many restaurants have music in the background,  so loud you have to talk so loud.... not here, is was pleasant and complemented the evening perfectly. An evening to remember.

3vDXcjzAST5E1dfUQ86LsQ.text: Always friendly, great service & awesome food delivered promptly & cooked as ordered.

3zlCKVpA2dyYayLRFjqTdA.text: Looking for someplace close to eat and we stumbled upon this restaurant. The food was amazing and so were the drinks. We keep seeing these amazing ribs pass by our table and we asked our waiter. He said they were a part of happy hour and even though we were not sitting in the bar he would get them for us. They were amazing along with their shrimp and butcher board.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Butcher board

UrWUUMSEroRe7p-86J1mzw.text: I have had great experiences here in the past so I brought my parents here for the second year in a row.  It was one of the worst dining experiences ever.  Starting out with, I'm sorry but we're out of bread this evening,this was told to us at 730pm on a Sunday.   Then after waiting 30 minutes with no food in site- we're told- sorry but the short ribs are tough tonite, hope that will be ok? If they are too tough we can bring out the menu again?  ( two of us ordered short ribs)   Next,my mother does not receive  the short ribs,she gets pork ribs????  I do get the short ribs and they are tough as nails. At it is far too late to start a new order, I instead eat off my families plates.   I have worked in the hospitality business for years. This service and food has made me lose all confidence in this establishment. We will never be back.

lhyrSFGEPP6V9Q3d63_Z-g.text: Nice decor. The wait staff were terrific and attentive. We had a party of 12 and they were able to accommodate us.  There are issues with the food and the pricing. What is delivered to the table does not equate to the prices on the menu. And, some of the food is just....no good. The mushroom soup and French onion lacked flavor and depth of cooking. Like canned with cheese on top. Terrible. I ordered a medium rare beef patty as a protein to my salad and it came out fully done, bone dry and looked like it was formed and frozen in Des Moines maybe last year some time. Two orders of short ribs at $30 were  way off. One was half the size of the other. The waiter should have noticed that glaring error. Halibut was passable but getting very near dry and over cooked. The salads were messy. The kitchen at this restaurant needs to be completely overhauled or keep it the same and cut the prices by 50%. We would not return. Just too mediocre and overpriced. The quality of the wait staff is wasted serving in this restaurant.  Two days later: You cannot ask for a better owner that recognizes that there was a problem and that will try to fix the problem.  He responded here and he responded with a phone call. Because of his response we will try this restaurant again.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nA31D-0zKI5vUNg6HjwLng.text: Enjoy a fabulous lemon drop martini at Paul Martin's American Grill Scottsdale! Great atmosphere with impeccable service!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon Drop Martini at Paul Martin&#39;s

QktC1FFtI78g7TUwRk2ydQ.text: Great place to go for date night. Our first time here and everything was good; service, atmosphere, menu selections, etc. The quality of the food was excellent. Highly recommend the Salmon fish tacos (never heard of that before). I left feeling like I had hit a home run for a first time visit. My only disappointment was, the deserts sounded good, but I was too full to try. haha

Iak6FDMCLMvK25UyC3d2uQ.text: We arrived early in the night for dinner, and just observing how the staff prepares the tables, to shining the silverware and polishing the wine & water glasses, to perfectly aligned chairs, was a  indications of what kind of service we received!  Our waiter, Jowonis, suggested the fried chicken and braised short ribs and both were great! A nice touch was the "First Class service " of a plate of warm wet towels with lemon to clean our fingers!! It was a special occasion so we splurged on dessert, the Buttercake with ice cream and berries! Yum!  Two different managers checked in on us to see if we were enjoying our experience! So, if you're looking for a top notch restaurant with excellent food and wait staff, this is the place to come!!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Q-95y58-8bFKIFNArGEeKA.text: Booked in to eat here with my family while we visited town. There was a long wait - at least 20 minutes - for our table to be ready despite the reservation.  A few of his headed to the bar, where we had friendly service, though there was some confusion as a manager asked for my order after we'd already spoken to another barman.   After being seated, we ordered another round of drinks and some appetizers. The appetizers the best part: the shrimp cocktail came with large prawns and the dipping sauce was spicy and delicious. The French onion soup was also good and cheesy.  The entrees were disappointing. My medium-rare filet came out medium and wasn't very flavorful at all. All the sides were over-egged: the spinach was so coated in garlic that it tasted like raw garlic (I love garlic but found it unpalatable). The Brussels sprouts were shaved rather than halved, which was an odd presentation, and so coated in bacon and bacon fat that the whole dish tasted like bacon - again, unpleasantly so.  Our server was pleasant but inefficient, he would visit the table and ask one or two people if they needed anything, then another two people would shout a request after him as he left the table, then it'd take him awhile to circle back. At one point, as the restaurant was thinning out, I waited 15 minutes for a glass of wine. He stopped by and said it was on its way when I was about to ask, so I can't tell if the order hadn't been placed when I asked or if the bar took a long time, but most of our drinks came much more quickly when the restaurant was busier.  The decor and atmosphere are nice, and they made a little extra effort with a dessert for my birthday. Not all bad, but the entrees and style of service really let this place down for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Birthday cake!

vIpIPECGtFx7W22eMZJtow.text: Very nice atmosphere, quick service for lunch, excellent wine selection. We had appetizers and wine, the salt and pepper shrimp was to die for!

qcJ6IyXkL3NH5z5j4vhRzQ.text: Bread was delicious with sweet honey butter and biscuits a level up from red lobster cheddar biscuits. The entrees we got were disappointing. I got the crab cake Benedict and at $17 I was disappointed they couldn't poach an egg properly. But the cake was tasty.  We also had the shrimp fettuccine and thought it was like a cheap TV dinner with shrimp tails attached and noodles like chinese take out noodles. Was not fettuccine, more like an egg based spaghetti?  Service was great and it was a quiet nice place to have lunch though and have a conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

f7TdNLf2V46f17ec_AygNQ.text: Our first time to Scottsdale and thank you yelpers for the reviews. This place is amazing!! I had the short ribs and my husband had the halibut.... the food was amazing and delicious!! Our server Dominique was so sweet and helpful... thank you for all of your suggestions. Don't pass this restaurant up it's so worth it!!

7HJ_GKVrKlS3TQxcYK9g9A.text: Visiting from San Diego we thought we would check out this place for lunch.  We really like the look and feel of the space.  The food are fresh ( too bad I did take any pictures)  farm to table.  They have full bar and they make great cocktails.  Love the atmosphere.  The service is excellent.  Definitely come back next time.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

br0Dxz2TV5MtV3BeZh1-zw.text: Paul Martin's USED to be a destination restaurant but not anymore! They have completely changed everything staff, chef, and food quality. It's horrid and sub-par and with the recent price increases not worth it anymore!   Listen up Paul Martin's you HAD an amazing product and you need to bring things back up to standards or you can kiss your local business goodbye!

SyNdOG7nLrE8vpz5YBHYYQ.text: Went here for happy hour the other day.   I had the makers mark manhattan and the tortoise creek cab.   The cab wasn't bad for the price -- $9.   The manhattan was good but I figured it should be when it is $13 during HH.   Ordered the HH chicken skewers.  A decent amount of chicken on the skewer, but the chicken was a bit dry.   Well, actually, quite dry and not all that tasty.    There was a bunch of us, say, 20.   Cortney was our server.   I'm sure he wasn't all that happy having separate checks.   He was professional and competent.     Would I return?  Hmmmm.

eMv7_gvcWg2LTsBtHVGbIQ.text: First time here and I cannot say enough good things. The service is spectacular! James is the man! He took care of us and provided fantastic service. He helped make this a 10/10 experience. The food is AMAZING and the portions are great! We got the Buttermilk Fried Chicken and the Trio Summer Sampler - both were excellent! Definitely will be coming back and will be recommending this spot to anyone! Also want to shout-out the General Manager, Anthony, who made sure we were well taken care of and made us feel right at home.

vyrvnSZ2Ow8CdFL_mXWdiA.text: I would love to come back for HH. Their seared ahi tuna salad was fantastic!! The s'mores sundae was ok and I only ate a few bites. I wish they had more graham crackers in the sundae. Overall, I enjoyed my lunch. Service was good too. Prices were on the higher side.

tLKvhoDkKCgeIbyw_dOGKQ.text: My husband and I drove to Scottsdale for the weekend to float on the Salt river...when we were done we were starving. As normal I Yelped on where we should go since it was our 1st time together in Scottsdale. I was craving Fish and he was craving fried chicken...and when I reviewed the menu I saw that they had both and they had great reviews...it was also only 4 mins from our hotel. I made reservations but we couldn't wait so we went in early. Thankfully the nice hostess was able to seat us early! We had an amazing waiter who took very good care of us! We started with the wood fired grilled artichoke (castorville) it was served with an amazing garlic aioli. They also brought us some fresh baked bread that was delicious and soft butter. My husband had the Summer special, ribs, fried chicken, corn, & a cheddar chive biscuit. The ribs were so tender and perfectly seasoned... I stole his biscuit...it was delicious. He said the corn was amazing and that the chicken was yummy and moist! I had the Halibut!!!! Wow!!!! It was delicious, served with a sauce that I could have drank in a cup it was so good, blistered cherry tomatoes that went perfectly with the Halibut and asparagus...I added a side of mac-n-cheese. The Mac was really good but it had huge chunks of bacon in it and I don't eat bacon...so the husband got all the bacon. I don't mind the flavor of bacon...just don't like the texture....I know I am the only American on the planet who doesn't eat bacon! ;) My husband's dinner came with peach cobbler and I shouldn't have, because I was STUFFED, but I ordered the butter cake....I don't have enough words to describe this cake....heaven in a cast iron skillet!!! Yep...thats it.... HEAVEN!!!! no other words can describe it. I would drive 4.5 hrs again just for that!!! Actually we would drive 4.5hrs for the entire meal again!!! It was a great meal, great service and so glad we found it!!!

u3aspOK1BDadOZmduDoOTA.text: I took my mom out for her bday dinner on NYE. Everything we got was delicious we started off sharing a crab cake. The waiter let us know it is not 2 cakes it is one to share (we were fine with that) it was delicious. My mother ordered steak which she loved (and I did too) and i ordered the chicken. I didnt LOVE the chicken but it was good. Our service was great (I think his name was Trent) and it was much appreciated that he comped a dessert for my mom. Another successful birthday treat for my mom to make her feel special

jGNbr4m8_gf2o2Nma8WXEw.text: My wife and I have found the perfect restaurant to enjoy a wonderful dinner and cocktails.  You know it is outstanding as they are busy every night.  We started going here last year and again had a wonderful meal and cocktails last night. The entire staff is friendly and welcomes you with warm caring hospitality.  The food is beyond any expectation set.   Every time we go we both try something different and it always exceeds expectations.   The restaurant is always clean and fresh.   The employees are wonderful and make you feel at home.  I would recommend making reservations as walk ins are welcome.  I would recommend Paul Martins for any occasion.   Great place to relax and enjoy an evening out.   It is without a doubt a five star restaurant.

G6Ee9xcr4psJZh2w2xYpVg.text: (4.50 stars)  For the final dinner of our Arizona vacation we only had to venture across the street from our motel, the Scottsdale Hilton Resort.  I had enjoyed dinner at a Paul Martin's location in the Los Angeles area two years ago, and was anxious to dine here.  The physical layout of the Scottsdale property was sleek and modern, with heavy emphasis upon dimmed lighting, chrome and glass-- not at all unlike the LA location.  Michelle P. was our server on Tuesday, and she was personable, pleasant, knowledgeable and reasonably prompt-- a very good job.  We skipped the appetizers, soups and salads and went right for our entrees.  Our sons and I each ordered a different steak (skirt, hanger and New York strip), while my wife chose the grilled salmon.  Each was cooked to the requested temperature, tender, nicely seasoned and attractively plated.  A sauteed "heirloom" spinach accompanied my steak, as it had my salmon two years ago.  Then, as now, the particular variety was properly seasoned, but otherwise flavorless.  Unlike my prior encounter, the tough lower stems had been trimmed; tender and tasty, but not memorable.  The boys each enjoyed their steaks, and my wife, the salmon.  The four of us broke from our normal practice and ordered desserts; three for the table.  Chosen were the homemade ice cream sampler, banana cream pie and the chocolate layer cake.  Each selection was superb; neither overly sweet, nor lacking in comfort food value.  An excellent meal!

_qcFSrUvpuPSS5wFw6D8kg.text: A truly excellent experience all-around.  This Scottsdale outpost of the upscale chain features soft lighting, a jazzy soundtrack, and phenomenal food and service.  A complimentary dish of local olives and almonds kicks off the meal, with a small, locally-sourced menu heavy on beef (with several chicken and fish options as well). No matter your choice, you will not be disappointed.  I ordered the skirt steak, the slices of marinated beef cooked to a perfect medium rare and accented by the bright flavor of fresh arugula and meaty heirloom tomatoes. A wine list contained some formidable selections, with a few craft beers added in. Just as a fine cabernet sauvignon can compliment a steak, so can a bottle of North Coast Old Rasputin imperial stout.  Dessert selections were just as well-prepared and ranged from an assortment of house-made ice creams, a banana cream pie, and a decadently rich devil's food cake.  While not flawless (the bread, much touted by the wait staff, arrived lukewarm and with just a dab of butter), it is as good a dining experience as you will find in Scottsdale.

now-7_WYqfQl-nte-HgSBQ.text: Paul Martins American Grill - Happy FriYAY  What a wonderful dinner  Smoked Chicken & Wings housemade pesto slaw   St. Louis Style Pork Ribs hoisin glaze, green onions   Petite Steak Frites marinated grass-fed angus top sirloin, herb butter, red wine jus  We highly recommend it

ui62RXFzjkdkNAeOTdNbSg.text: Lovely dinner. We often come here , we love the sustainability focus of this spot. Our server Trent was AMAZING!  He was super friendly & knew his stuff! He suggested the Ribeye with faro & It was oh so good with the sizzling butter and cooked to perfection! We also had salt & pepper shrimp, oysters and the pork ribs . Everything was delicious . We will definitely be back and are excited to check out their Sunday Brunch and HH which is 3-7pm .. DAILY!! Which is alright , alright alright in my book!

MK52fiWQ1UHDtGEA6RlCOg.text: Honestly I didn't think it lived up to the hype. It was just a step below what houston's is. It's not bad by any means, I'd just rather eat at houston's for a better meal.

yjMmDcNcqFn1tY2C7lXPlw.text: Summary - terrific restaurant  Ambience:  great balance between fancy and casual. You can come dressed up or in jeans.   Bar:  Eric was great, and made a mean old fashioned. It's the mark of a good bar to me., but they have a wide variety of items. In addition, they have some decent happy hour options.   Food:  I had the organic green salad (with peanut sauce) and the hangar steak. To me, any restaurant that had hangar steak on the menu is on its way to a good review. I special ordered it blackened (like their ribeye), and it did not disappoint. It was cooked to taste (med rare), and the flavor was great.  For under $25, it was a great value.   Dessert included the ice cream trio - their mocha is legit - and the others hold their own.   Service was very good - I ate at the bar, and their service was on par with great restaurants.    If you're in Scottsdale, it's worth a visit.  Not 5 stars only because I don't typically give those out (not that I know anything). But I would definitely come back.

2oTWBZYHo1HboefX1kJeZw.text: Happy hour is amazing. Selections for all budgets. Try the $6 lemon drop, it was my favorite. All the food we ordered multiple apps, entres, desserts, drink, etc were everything and beyond what we hoped for. All the staff were very helpful and checked on our table multiple times throughout the night. Will definitely return on every trip to Scottsdale.

29qs-mVX5rRy6aXOy-_lbg.text: The happy hour was disappointing.  The food was sub standard at best.  Too bad, great ambiance.

PPQSf_1JWkbjFHi1S0nSNA.text: Our first time here! Very relaxing and service was excellent! James and the manager took care of us! We enjoyed the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice patio! Heated

DZ4cAwn-OHhB2RCTcB8_kg.text: Valentine's Day is crazy in most restaurants.  And that could have been the case at Paul Martin's.  However, staff was ready.  The crowd was there.    Our party of 2 arrived a bit early.  We requested a booth.  They accommodated us with no problem.  We were seated shortly before our reservation time of 6:00 p.m., despite the special request.  Trent, our server, was charming, witty, and offered us excellent suggestions.  We had mushroom soup, chicken chimichurri, and salmon.  The food was delicious.  Especially the mushroom soup.  The staff worked like a professional dance company, each person playing off of and helping the others.  When one person noticed that a table needed something, they didn't wait for the 'right' person to do it.  They all lent a hand.  My friend and I observed this throughout our meal.  Our booth was right next to the kitchen.  We had a great time looking over the wall, witnessing first hand the ease and professionalism with which the kitchen executed each meal.  The servers lined up like soldiers, ready to get their plates to the tables.   The manager stopped by our table just before we left.  We offered our thanks and congratulations for such a great experience.    My friend and I will definitely recommend Paul Martin's to our friends.  We will be back!

AshZlal24UpclI_mSrFvMQ.text: Can't say enough great things about this restaurant.  Made reservations for Mother's Day. Arrived a few minutes early and was seated with minutes of our reservation time.   Nice booth   Our server Robert was top notch he explained the menu as well as brunch options.  We had prime rib and fish. Outstanding service. Great food and extremely well run establishment.  Had a wonderful experience.

q5j0IOt__bBougMx9iDknQ.text: Hmm the happy hour menu looks great but I  cannot understand why none of it is served during dinner hours. Basically ruining my entire decision to ever return here.

Z4XsmCmPRCD26-vVFI_mkA.text: If I was only rating based on the filet I ordered this would be a 4++; so tender, so perfectly cooked; so yummy.    Unfortunately my husband also ordered the cedar plank salmon which drew down the rating considerably; the presentation on the creamed spinach was a miss...the same very bitter creamed spinach that was served with my dish...it was inedible.  And the mashed potatoes were fine but just sort of uninspiring....the best you can do for a starch side dish is mashed potatoes with some butter?    I do like that they still serve bread with dinner.  The apple crumble was nice to finish with.  Re value....it's a mid range restaurant ambience wise, but price wise it's beyond the mid range experience.   It would be a good choice for happy hour however.

g8fSe3ICL85NlHdith0BCw.text: We had a fantastic late lunch here.  Go for happy hour, 3-6pm.  The chicken sandwich is one of the best I've had.  My daughter enjoyed her burger.  The cucumber refresher cocktail is a perfect cool down on a hot afternoon.

C1-N3beVRY3OohEz8nT2OA.text: Our server Hannah was terrific!  We came to celebrate a graduation, and they treated us great.  The food was delicious and the atmosphere nice.  We will be back for sure.

W0kJxHWRDNNnEJKS4iNMHA.text: Came here on Friday night with another couple to celebrate my boyfriends birthday & we had a great time. Had 730PM reservations & were seated right away. My girlfriend and I split a bottle of wine -- Argentina Malbec, really good. And our boyfriends got beer. I was interested in the Pacific Redfish on the menu but was bummed when they were out of it so I settled for Mesquite Salmon -- it was great! My boyfriend got short ribs which were delicious too. We also split a side of the mac & cheese -- very good. We all had a great time here & would definitely come back!

8d3vTXUK2iUYN-tOehltJg.text: Great service and great food. Really enjoyed the ribs, Mac and cheese, and burgers. Short ribs were fork tender and they even had grated horseradish available. And we got in without reservations!

227pyk5JaisWurtaa6ZSAg.text: I feel a few years ago Paul Martin's used to be a great night out. Lately seems to have gone downhill a bit. My red wine was served over chilled, and my steak brought out bloody rare when I asked for medium. The menus which used to be printed on nice cardstock are now flimsy paper inserted into a laminated sleeve - ours were a bit greasy and not clean. Felt more like a chain restaurant. I will say our server Joel was wonderful. But I don't think we'll be coming back

Jin2XDDNO2ndpt0phsAT0w.text: Their happy hour runs fro 3-8 and for $13 you can get a burger, craft beer and fries.  The beer I had last time was a Sonoran Victorian IPA from a local Phoenix brewery.  It was very good and paired well with the burger and fries.  The fries were crispy and some of the best I've had anywhere.

dVhDhAqsGBLdB8CGYW3cDg.text: I had previously visited the original Paul Martin's in Roseville, California so I was pleased to find that this location is just as good. Everything is prepared on site and the menu changes seasonally. Everything is excellent and prices are reasonable. Service was very attentive and if we had been there in the evening I could see that they had an excellent selection of wine and other beverages. Paul Martin's is an excellent place for a nice meal or to celebrate a special occasion. And although we sat inside, I noticed that they have a very nice patio that would be great to try.

T5S-WCqe4ctlSoNsTdZDDA.text: First time, best time! Ask for Jake. Selecting a place to entertain visitors is no big deal in Scottsdale. So many choices... Our first visit to this place was amazing. The bar was fully stocked including 1942, oh yeah! Our folks had both fancy drinks from the menu (super sweet, sugar sweet) and mixed drinks. Our pours were generous. :-) We tried every appetizer; potato tots (deep fried mashed coated with crumbs OMG, ordered it again!), short rib tacos (WOW), ribs (are you kidding me), ahi lettuce wraps (very nice) and smoked wings ( hello).   What a great experience!  This foodie will be back! Mostly for the tots of tater yumminess!

JJbs7Ry1F_EcxFBwde01Kw.text: Vibe:  very formal and classy! Went here for a work lunch since we were in the area.   Service: host seated us immediately. The place was not too busy on a Wednesday lunch time. The servers are very attentive and professional.  Food: For the appetizer; We split deviled eggs and the crab cake. The texture of deviled eggs were divine and it was screaming with flavor. Very delicious. I didn't get to try the crab cake but it looked really good and my coworkers liked it.  I had the ahi tuna salad and unfortunately it was very underwhelming. While the ahi was beautifully and perfectly cooked, I am not sure what this particular dish is trying to be. It seemed to be a fusion of Japanese American because it had some soba, then it had romaine lettuce, beets, oranges and bell peppers. The flavor combination does not work at all! Or either change the noodles to something else. I just ate it all because it was pretty pricy and I didn't want to waste food.  I had some espresso for dessert and some peach cobbler. Those were really good! You guys know how to make espresso we'll!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Deviled Eggs
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seared Ahi Salad

Zg0LNy28TK20meYRnudaAg.text: The food at Paul Martin's was absolutely delicious at Live & Local event for the boys and girls club of America. They served two samples- beef over mashed potatoes and and poke lettuce wrap. Both were tasty. A sample was too littleI will definitely need to go to Paul Martins for the real thing  Update- came into Paul Martins for dinner. It was one of the best dinners I have had in Scottsdale. Our server Courtney was incredible- friendly, funny, personable- made excellent recommendations. We ordered tuna and crab cake appetizers which were excellent. The homerun of the night was the filet Mingon, which was incredible. Everything about my time at Paul Martins was top notch. Will definitely be coming back soon

VSj_ysaKx97Vt9LMqvBSqA.text: Stopped in to get a summer trio with the shrimp, ribs, and chicken. Also the biscuit and corn on the side were almost the best part! Second picture was the spinach artichoke dip with pita. Third was their crispy shrimp appetizer and I honestly could have eaten several of these for my meal they were so good. Last was their cobbler which is always a good choice when finishing off a meal.

P-PJWi3ejTbuXfrYC2gGzQ.text: I've never been here for Happy Hour. My friend and I were in the area on a Friday at 4:45 p.m. Not in the mood to cook dinner, I thought about Paul Martin's Happy Hour everyone raves about. I checked Happy Hour times and it actually starts at 3:00!  "Sandwich Pairing Happy Hour" was a smoking deal. I got my favorite Raspberry Martini and a Classic Burger for $15 bucks and it was very good as usual... need I say more!

Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Raspberry Martini

rtIuyGQWlE5ULBRyGvnBEg.text: Love this place!  Not only is the food superb but the wait staff is wonderful. the manager is Eric and he couldn't be nicer! Tonight Nolen was our waiter and we loved him!  Ask for him if you want great service with a smile!!

rIQrTxrS_NioeOEmt73VYA.text: Well I have never been... but my friend.. AKA... birthday girl... has... and it was her choice. So off I go to meet her.  We started with Happy Hour. Lucky to score 2 seats at the bar. Also lucky to have Sally as our bartender. So enjoyed watching her talents and making incredible cocktails. Started with Deviled eggs and a sparking lemon cocktail.  Friend had lemon drop. Then on her recommendation we had the pork ribs with Hoisin sauce . Both delicious!  She knew it was my friends Birthday offered dessert. Told her we were headed to dinner in the dining room. She went ahead and offered to reserve a table for us. Lovely.  Now we are escorted to our table by the fabulous Andrew. Co owner. What a nice gentleman. Enjoyed some banter and were introduced to our server.. Courtney.  He was amazing. Funny.... knowledgeable and great memory to not write down anything!!  We started with wines and the artichoke. Delightful. Then friend had a steak and mashed potatoes. I had the Halibut and on Courtney's suggestion... the spinach as opposed to asparagus. So glad I did. I could have had a bowl of that spinach!  Then dessert... the Butter Cake. Omg it was amazing! And we had 2 espresso martini's!  I can not say it enough... why haven't I been here?  I'm going back again this week.  Happy Hour alone is amazing!  Thank you to all of you that took care of us. Birthday Girl loved it.. so did I!!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon vodka with basil topped with sparkling wine
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Halibut with spinach
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak with mashed potatoes

2a-l9g60OrygZoKYo70NMA.text: We stopped in for a Sunday night dinner to end the weekend. We ordered the following:  Butternut Squash Soup - warm and flavorful, a little too chunky for my liking, but they were so kind to split it for us   Seasonal salad - not your typical house salad! It had arugula, avocado, croutons, herbed cauliflower rice and tomatoes with a basil vinaigrette. So good!  Asian Chicken Salad - lacked in excitement a bit, but beautifully presented and great for a healthier option!  Pork chop - my favorite dish! It was topped with a delicious sticky, syrupy sauce and tasted so decadent. It was served with extra crispy Brussels sprouts, my fiance's favorite   And for dessert, the toasted almond cake. OMG, it was light, fluffy, and had a delicate almond taste without being overpowering. Great way to end our meal.   The service was fabulous. Our drinks were never empty long and we were often checked up on. I'll definitely be back, especially for their 3-7 happy hour.

inctI9X90sN3m0pZoditcg.text: No one in the restaurant,  had reservations but we were offered  outside  only for coming early.  The will try J&G.  I hope this establishment was not profiling.

mSX7S0c7hNGzdRAZVvRl6Q.text: Ended up here after attempting to stop at a few restaurants at an off time, around 3pm. The welcome staff was not helpful, we wanted to enjoy happy hour, and asked about it as the led us outside, apparently you can only have it if you sit in the area without tables. Weird. So we went inside to ask if they could show us where the inside happy hour was offered, and we could tell they were not eager to help us. After asking a few times, and our hostest leaving us to answer the phone, one of the male managers, slooooowly and painnnnfully walked us over to the bar area. It seemed so odd because we were one of like 5 small groups in the entire restaurant. It was clear they had other priorities??   Then... a while later.... comes our server. We ordered some drinks, which after 10 minutes we ended up retrieving from the bar ourselves, because our server was no where to be found, just kidding we could see him standing back near the kitchen, and we could not flag him down. Okay.. then we ask him about  a few things on the menu, and he starts listing off all of the seafood on the menu... not what we asked to hear and very long explanation when we were clearly not interested. We ended up with some food from the happy hour menu, a flatbread and some tuna lettuce wraps. Everything was okay, but the lack of service was just terrible. We really wanted to like this place, but I can't see myself wanting to return. I hope other people have had better experiences here.  Note: the female manager seemed concerned when we voiced our opinions when she came around to our table, and she must have talked to our server because for the last few minutes of our dining experience, he was prompt and attentive.. what?! A little late, but thanks for trying.

TGgieTNqAKtNITAGBorFWA.text: Paul Martin's is a pretender. We just finished a meal and we're really disappointed. The highlight of the evening we're the homemade tater tots. They are creamy mashed potato's deep fried with panko crumbs are are excellent.  The smoked chicken and wings were way over on the smoke flavor. They tasted as though they were marinated in liquid smoke. We saw no smoke ring yet they were over the top smoky and bitter.  The mushroom soup was ok but under seasoned.  The coffee ice cream was low quality ice milk and had big water crystals. Ir wasn't creamy at all.  The male bartender had a super crappy attitude. The lady was better but not fun..

e1Y3-cTdCHyRaX3CDj-C3w.text: Addison restaurant a little overpriced service was great food was it okay I don't think I'd come back just because the price I can get better elsewhere

QrGj0y2BPJME2j6KvDgRDA.text: Had a wonderful experience at PMAG last night with friends. Terrific atmosphere, comfortable seating and pleasant staff.   Our waiter  was knowledgeable, patient and kind. He accommodated our drink requests to make changes, apologized appropriately when they were out of a mixture and was responsive in a timely manner when fulfilling requests (more water,bread,another napkin etc..).  Cocktails were made correctly and tasted great!   The bathrooms were clean and smelled good. However, they did not have soap. The decorative soap bottle was empty. So I filled it with some water to get some soap out of it.   Now to the best part! The food was absolutely amazing!!!! The calamari was cooked just right! ( no marinara tho it came with an aioli) We had the trio special and not one complaint about the meat (fried chicken, Bbq ribs, and shrimp skewered). The elote corn on cob was scrumptious!  Oh and their bread is sooo good. Only one thing was not tasty, and that was the biscuit that came with the dish. It was greasy and flat. Didn't eat it, I went back to the bread!   Overall this place is a great place for American fare and to spend an evening with friends and family!

uhDvrzUrBwXQTiVPuRcsQA.text: Popped in for dinner while I was in town and was impressed. I was seated at a booth, and my waiter, Courtney, was very nice. The table bread was fresh, delicious and came with whipped butter (the great part about dining alone is not having to share the bread). For my main entree I ordered the braised short ribs with a side of crispy brussel sprouts. The short ribs were advertised as coming with a horseradish cream, but there was only a small drizzle across the middle, which is really my only complaint. The ribs themselves were cooked perfectly. The mashed potatoes that came with them were absolutely fantastic. The best part though, were the brussel sprouts. 10/10 would sprout again. They are a must order. Crispy and flavorful and the absolute best way to eat a vegetable.  For my dessert I ordered the toasted almond cake, which was quite good. It was moist and perfectly portioned, which I appreciated since I was already pretty full at that point.  The atmosphere is definitely reminiscent of your typical steakhouse, lots of wood everywhere you look and dramatic overhead lighting. I was seated near the bar area, however, the bar area was pretty quiet as far as noise level goes so I don't think I would have had a problem hearing my dining companion should I have had one.

unrKJUAj9wv2Tmn_CAfBgw.text: Outstanding food and customer service. The banana pie is to die for! All of the employees were wonderful and our food was fantastic. We had the pork ribs and halibut and both were perfect dishes. Would recommend as a great date night dinner spot!!

iDvurmcUH71fM6rc0a89fg.text: Enjoyed the ambiance and cuisine. Spinach dip and salmon sandwich in on the lunch menu were excellent!

QVxfKI4pK-peXFgHaQhl6w.text: Wonderful food and service.  We had the rib, buttermilk chicken and mesquite corn on the cob special yesterday.  All 4 of us though it was unbelievable and a great value.   Strongly recommend the restaurant.

8fUNIN7gmdBbvZ6HlHxv3w.text: The Atmosphere is quiet and clean however I would be more inclined to visit during their happy hour in the future. It seems what they offer on that menu would be more my personal taste, hostess was top notch. Tried their seasonal hard lemonade very tasty, would pass on the tortilla soup, the French dip would have been okay however I'm not a fan of garlic and was surprised by the bread. Was not offered bread and butter upon dining, received it at the end after asking....will try HH and update.

xXWKMjqBmSKFHJgCgeZa5A.text: For us, Paul Martin's has turn into a familiar, home away from home.   Over the last four months, we have been here four times. The food is delicious and creatively prepared. We haven't had a bad meal or dish yet.   If UR into Happy Hour, theirs lasts until seven, this is a must try. They have some incredibly tasty items for $6 (see photos), like Street Tacos, panko breaded Tater Tots and Deviled Eggs. For $9 (photos), you'll be in heaven over their Maple Glazed Chicken Skewers or St Louis Duroc Pork Ribs.   Their HH Cocktails are $6 to $9 and their wines by the glass ($6, $9 and $14) have some real depth. Gotta love their 7 oz. Williamette Valley Pinot for $14. Try it, you'll see I'm right. It's a great pour, nice bouquet, and has a sophisticate mix of berry tastes.   Their dinners are equally great, whether UR here on Sunday for their Three Course $34 Prime Rib Special, or a week night, or even a Sunday Brunch - you won't be disappointed.   I could write more about their food, but I'll let my nearly forty photos speak for themselves. Expect to pay around $40 to $50 for a great value, tasty meal that you won't soon forget and cannot wait to come back to Paul Martin's for more.  One last thing, if you can, ask to be seated in James' section.  All the servers here are really great, but he is exceptional. He remembers your likes and finds a way to make your visit memorable.   Enjoy!

v0Bi_ocSBqKqSE0vhgkA4Q.text: First time there was on a Sunday and everything was GREAT!  They accept reservations!
