73mXYqMVzaeWRGQpPI16KA.text: One word sums up Paul Martin's American Grill: EXCEPTIONAL. If there was every an indicator about the quality of what was to follow, the perfect fried calamari appetizer would be it...and it was perfect in every way, which surely isn't common in my experience. The fried shrimp, grilled artichokes, and antipasto appetizers all echoed the calamari: great quality and perfectly prepared.  As for the main courses, the blackened ribeye was magnificent: perfectly charred on the outside, tender and medium rare on the inside, and impeccably seasoned (I despise the salty bitterness that I've experienced with this dish in so many other restaurants).  Next up was a Chicken under a Brick. All I'm gonna say is this: make sure at least one person in your party orders this dish! I guarantee after all of the ooh's and ahh's you hear coming from that person's direction, you'll be ordering it on your next visit too. It was outstanding.   As for the space itself...contemporary and inviting. The small, semi-private dining area in the rear is where you wanna be if you have a large party.   I read some of the other Yelp reviews, and I recognize that even the best restaurants can screw up a dish on occasion - this one included - particularly when they're pushing things out of the kitchen on a busy night (the place was packed)! But that didn't happen to me. My overall dining experience was exemplary. My only criticism was there wasn't any room in my stomach for dessert. Great job!

R9CBuODf-IkN-QU_yoXkWw.text: I really like this place! I have eaten here at least five times, and the food and service is always very consistent. They have a great artichoke appetizer to start - almost as good as Hillstone's legendary artichoke. The drinks are always poured as if they are doubles, so be careful if you're going to drive after having a cocktail. If you are taking Uber, or have a designated driver, than this is the place to have dinner and drinks.  Tonight I had the roasted chicken with mashed potatoes. Roasted garlic cloves are used as a garnish on the chicken, and it is served in a generous broth. The potatoes are very finely whipped and contain lots of butter - just the way I like them! I highly recommend that you eat here the next time you are in the Scottsdale and Lincoln area.

esvFJwgDobEVwyqGbJ7gtw.text: Went there for lunch. A little too pricey. $88.00 FOR 2, no alcohol. Had the halibut $30.00 it was good, but not delicious. Shared the crab cake appetizer $16.00 FOR 1 crab cake. (That was good but over priced.)

OWj6gg4M_-rh1XtHdEDqag.text: Been to Paul's a couple of times now. The service is great, all smiles and helpful. The atmosphere is pleasant.  The food in general is mediocre. Last night had the fried chicken and it was boring and a bit dry. Nice salad, had the vegetable spring roll and unfortunately they had just came out of the refrigerator and they were way to cold. Once we let them "thaw" out they were very tasty. Like I said mediocre

RjWbqbm4WU9bemGaixN_PQ.text: Grabbed a seat at the bar and decided to check out the happy hour menu.  Bartender knew exactly how to help me when I was deciding on the salmon.  Ordered the house salmon which comes with baguettes and creme fresh.  Excellent piece of salmon and the baguette was toasted just right.  Great dish overall.  The fiancee ordered the shredded beef tacos and no complaints for the $5.00 price.  It didn't wow me, but for $5.00 to enjoy some tender beef with a good sauce, you can't complain at all.  Lastly they we're talking my language.  A burger, fries and beer combo.  Burger is fresh ground in house and you can tell.  Ordered medium rare, and came out perfect temperature.  Toasted ciabatta bun and black pepper aioli.  Fries were  good but the hand crafted beer selection is even better :)   So to top it all off, the famous and home made banana cream pie.  Won't say much except you have to order it.....okay I will say it was damn good!!!  Actually all their desserts are made in house, so I have a feeling no matter what you order you won't be disappointed   Service, quality and value 100%. Absolutely will be back

RYkq7iqUZeuBdzzc5eimNg.text: Very typical Scottsdale place, overpriced average food. The happy hour specials were really marginal except for the burger.

X-IgTBzvHGN0Wz4XNS6AIw.text: I went to Paul Martin's on Sunday evening to try out their Sunday prime rib special based on the recommendation of some family members who enjoyed the prime rib on a prior visit. The Sunday special is only $25 and includes an organic green salad, prime rib with mashed potatoes, and homemade ice cream for dessert.  Green salad - surprisingly, I really enjoyed the salad. I thought the vinaigrette was delicious (it was a sweet/sour dressing) and enjoyed the mixture of greens.   Prime rib - Very large portion. I ordered my prime rib medium rare and thought it was cooked well. Although the edges of the prime rib were more medium/well-done than medium rare, there was a lot of meat and I was pretty full by the end of the entree. In fact, I had them box some to go. I would have preferred a little more seasoning, especially since it started to get a little bland by the time I finished half the prime rib. However, I think it's well worth the price and definitely filling.  Ice cream - There were three scoops of ice cream: vanilla, chocolate, and their seasonal ginger bread. The ice cream was good (I enjoyed the vanilla the most), but again, there wasn't anything particularly "wow" factor about the dessert.  Service: This is where I had the biggest issue with my dinner at Paul Martin's. On multiple occasions we had to remind our waiter that one of our party had a food allergy and could not eat the dessert. Our waiter then misheard the type of food allergy we specified and we had to restate the allergy. Furthermore, we bought a gift card on that same day and were told by the waiter that he wasn't sure if we could use the gift card despite the fact that we had been told by the manager that we could. (I honestly have no idea why a restaurant would have problems with us using their gift card.) We then had to wait for the waiter to go check with the manager (who we had already talked to) and come back to inform us that, yes, of course we could use the gift card.   However, during the meal itself, the waiter did a good job checking in with us and asking about the food.  I'm giving this 3 stars because although I did not think the food was particularly mind-blowing, I thought it was a great deal for the price and very filling. As a side note, I have not had the opportunity to try other foods besides the prime rib special. I docked a star for the service.

gO2B0irl8XmNq_o7e4pu6g.text: After the Manager  called us concerned about our disappointment with our entrees the last time we were in, we decided to give them another try. The service was still top notch. They have great servers.  We shared the Grill Salad and it was great. They have wonderful crispy crust sour dough bread. We loved the smoked salmon appetizer with a nice sauce on the side  We had the Blackened Ribeye and the Brick Chicken with a side of their special Cauliflower. They were both wonderful. For dessert we split the Apple Crisp with vanilla Ice cream.  So glad we tried Paul Martins again! Thanks everyone for a great experience.

LbjcYn5WTD78WRWnO9PP5g.text: Superb food and terrific staff.  I ordered the ribeye steak and it was cooked perfectly on their mesquite grill. The steak was simply damn good and will make one ponder about replacing their own backyard charcoal grill for a mesquite burner.   I was impressed by the staff, specifically the manner in which they worked together. From busboys clearing dishes to drinks being brought out, more restaurants could follow the training model of Paul Martin's American Grill.  It was in the higher end of price ranges, but for the area the cost seems comparable. It's not somewhere that I would go regularly for drinks because of the price. But rather a place to enjoy on occasion

o6gDNrq72FgVmvDxif5-Qg.text: Our first Monday Wine Dinner at Paul Martin's was a superb dining experience from start to finish. Our server, Heather,  offered her expert opinion on food items and the wine list -- each suggestion exceeded our expectations.  Plus, her friendly and very attuned and attentive service was very much appreciated.  And, Clyde, the Customer Service Manager, took time out of his busy evening duties to make sure we were enjoying our dinner and that everything was at the highest level of food quality and service.   Ryan, another wait staff member at the restaurant -- his attention to detail and smiling face -- again, very much appreciated.  A wonderful team!  My husband and I  look forward to our next dining journey at Paul Martin's!  Thank you!

x3jW-O7_IkUJVQidv_oG9Q.text: Food was good, however it is another restraint trying to make simple dishes overdone. They do not  have any signature dishes which set them aside from most other restaurants. Service was fair I had to ask for water refills an three separate occasions. Their house bread at the table was nothing special. Do not go here with a group they are not set up to handle larger groups.

76P48qZxPikvzJW4AKcGkw.text: We decided to try this restaurant on a Sunday night. We were greeted promptly and seated right away in this most attractive restaurant. The decor is most inviting, casual, but, elegant. Our wait-person was friendly and extremely knowledgeable regarding the menu. They bring a small serving of almonds and olives to enjoy with your cocktails. We decided to split the Calamari appetizer. It arrive fresh and perfectly prepared. We ordered the  Chimichurri steak, and the house hamburger plate. Both came perfectly prepared, med-rare, as ordered. Both came with their house fries which were nice and fresh, but, a little too salty. The burger, with cheese was nice and juicy, made with flavorful beef. The bun, very important, was nice. The Chimichurri steak was excellent. Tender and flavorful, and, cooked perfectly. There was no room for desert, but, we did order de-caf coffee, which arrived barely warm. Most disappointing since this is the last thing served. I would definitely return, the entrees were excellent, the service friendly and professional, and, the decor beautiful. P.S.- they offer a daily special, until 7p.m. of a burger, fries and a beer, all for $13.00, a great deal.

uqfQJEv7PQLFqOoJ1n_4Iw.text: An excellent place for any occasion. Besides the great entrees, grilled artichoke was awesome. Angelo was on top of his game with excellent service and recommendations.

4KkysdoFeX1jFVemSHFfxQ.text: We had Easter dinner at Paul Martins this year for the first time. While the restaurant was clean and the service was fine, I thought the food was okay at best and grossly over-priced. Had to send back my wife's plate because it was under cooked, which is something I typically never do. I know that's not terrible but wanted better for Easter dinner.  I am not inclined to return.

c6Yb9fjSNpxSmhMVLdjsgA.text: We went there for New Years Eve. James was our server. He was great and the food was great. We had the salt and pepper prawns with the grilled salmon. The salmon was simple and one of the best I have tasted! We ended with the pear and huckleberry cobbler - great stuff!

7WZehkB2BVL_o6TLXOGiBg.text: The skirt steak had so much flavor! I wanted more of it!!  The roasted chicken was delicious with mashed potatoes as well. Great deal two entrees and a bottle of wine for $49:)

7E8CXuGgG94hh6JxBtnDnQ.text: The family visited Paul Fleming's owned Paul Martin's on Christmas Eve.  There was a little miscommunication with regards to the lady who calls those who have reservations as she told us they could make anything Gluten Free but when we arrived, both the waiter Trent who was great and the manager in the red shirt (who btw did not even know their was gluten in reg. pasta) said they were not able to make things GF.  So a little bummed I could only get a salad or soup and a app.  We started off with the artichoke app which is enough for two people which was real yummy much better than other places.  My friend had the pacific redfish and he said the spinach was amazing.  They did not offer anyone on our table bread or butter and I noticed everyone else had bread on their tables.  My other friend had the salmon salad.   I opted for the Butternut Squash Soup without the pesto on top as I can not have EVOO which their pesto was made with.  It was very thick and tasted like it had chili flakes in it.  Not a fan of the Butternut squash soup just average.  The best place to get the butternut squash soup is actually right across the street from Paul Martin's.  Overall my friends thought is was a bit expensive $15.00 for a glass of wine and $4.00 for a teabag /cup of hot tea.  The service was right on and Trent was amazing.  Three at the table - I only had an app and the soup, my friend had a salad and side of brussel soups which was sauteed in heavy EVOO with onions, then other entree was the redfish and a trio of ice cream bill before tip was $106.00.  Little expensive and I came in hungry and left hungry not much on the menu if you are vegan GF.  They should have more GF vegan options.  I would come back just for the artichoke which was very yummy!!!

69D6ZcjdQ2xT2FZFInp6gQ.text: The happy hour food was amazing! Great atmosphere and very nice service. Was really busy though....call ahead!

Y6AEv8kFbVXs20uXb9w2GQ.text: Bad service. I just went to HAPPY HOUR at Paul Martins with a friend. I am allergic to quite a few things so before we ordered, I gave the waitress a card that listed my allergies and she said she would take it back to the kitchen. I said ok as I pointed to the happy hour menu and mentioned that any thing on there would be good. They already have a few gluten free options, so I figured they could make some substitutions on one of the hh appetizers like they had in the past. When she came back she said they could do salmon and cauliflower to which I asked if that was an entree and then replied that I had a late lunch that was salmon and that I wasn't really that hungry and would prefer an appetizer. So she suggested seared ahi tuna. I asked if it was an entree and she said that that was a salad. So I said yes that sounds good- I figure a small appetizer salad with some ahi tuna. No. A $28 salad.  I clearly came in for happy hour and told her I wasn't that hungry and left with a bill over $40. I suppose I should have asked how much it was, but I never have had a problem like this in the past. Also, when I mentioned it to her, she argued with me about it. The salad was good, but not really a "salad" and she should not have only suggested very expensive meals. I have had happy hour appetizers that are free from all of my allergies before. The meal tasted great though, props to the chefs!

KCx7X5SY-O3YHzlOK6VS4A.text: This place knows how to train their staff!  Outstanding wait service!  It was comparable to a 5 star restaurant!  The food was excellent and we were informed about the menu including they make everything from scratch using the freshest local ingredients, depending on what is available seasonally.  Really enjoyed this experience!

ClGbTRUeFBcshKWsUyMytQ.text: A celebratory birthday dinner turned into an odd experience where we had to manage our meal throughout the evening.  While appetizers went well, and I highly recommend the fresh flavorful oysters, we were well through the course before the drinks we ordered upon seating finally arrived.  Our dinner orders were pretty straightforward: two rib eyes and two strips all medium, one salmon and one redfish.  Two servers arrived asking "Ribeyes?" and we directed them.  This was the first negative tipoff - a restaurant of this kind should know who has ordered which dish and deliver them correctly.  In the longer than usual few minutes before the remaining dishes arrived, we all looked at the ribeyes with curiosity as they most definitely were not ribeyes.  Then came the servers with the strips (again asking who should get them) and we took the opportunity to swap the strip steaks (cleverly disguised as ribeyes) with the ribeyes (cleverly disguised as strip steaks).  Finally, a server arrived asking "Salmon?" and deposited Redfish in front of me and the final dish of Salmon was deposited in front of the birthday girl, who had ordered Redfish.  It equated to a very frenetic and chaotic orchestration which made everyone uncomfortable.  After completing our main dish swap party we found the following:  Ribeyes - very thin (1/2" at best) and well done Strips - thick and cooked perfectly, mashed potatoes dry and crusty Salmon - cooked as requested but with a mustard glaze that sat too long and became dry and crusty Redfish - served cold  Our waiter handled the issues well, refiring ribeyes (now reordered as strips, as the thinness of the ribeye would make medium doneness difficult) and redfish appropriately and refilling drinks on the house, however, we celebrated this birthday eating dinner in 3 shifts as meals reappeared at varying times (can't coordinate the refires to arrive together?).  After the last entree was finished the manager stopped by to let us know he was buying the ribeye dinners.  Generous and appreciated but then dessert was served (all good, banana cream pie delicious) and cappuccinos arrived after dessert was finished.  We are of mixed opinions on whether to give Paul Martin's another chance.  What they did well was fantastic but many, many missteps made it difficult to enjoy the occasion.

YzmFLdSsnGayrWOW1nQy8A.text: Full disclosure: We don't go out to eat that often anymore due to the fact that I have been really disappointed at the over priced, poorly prepared food combined with service that is really just above fast food.  But the wife's birthday was in a few days and I scoured review sites to find something upscale but not hoity-toity.  Paul Martin's American Grill was known to me because a client of mine, RLF Painting had done all of the paint and stain work in the restaurant. I looked at the menu on line and it certainly checked all my boxes. So as the deadline approached I pulled the trigger and made reservations online through open table.  We arrived and were seated immediately and soon was greeted by our server Amy.  One of the first things Amy did was tell us about the Paul Martin "story".  Turns out it is a scratch restaurant with no freezer or microwave, well we learned later that they do have a small freezer but it's for their home made ice cream. It's a seasonal restaurant meaning that all of the courses are made from what is in season and available.  Everything is organic, free range and grass fed.  WOW! That was totally new to me.  NOTE TO PAUL MARTIN'S MANAGEMENT: You buried the headline here. There was no mention of organic, free range, grass fed in the menu, I had to look under the "About" tab. You need to really highlight this on every page.  With Amy's guidance we ordered a couple Meyer lemon infused vodka martinis and salt and pepper prawns to start.  The martini was awesome, the prawns were killer and we learned that the cocktail sauce was also home made and had chopped jalapenos as a kicker. A little heat but not overbearing.  The wife ordered the blackened rib eye and I went with the braised short ribs.  BTW they do all their own butchering in house too.  Main courses were sizeable and I have never been to a restaurant where I did not have to add salt and pepper to my meal. Not here, it was seasoned perfectly.  Our meals were accompanied with a couple glasses of a 2010 Napa Merlot.  Desert was a lemon brulee and a special custom made ice cream dish for the birthday girl.  The food was excellent, atmosphere pleasant but what really heightened the whole experience was our server Amy.  When we were discussing dessert she shared with us that this was her first week there.  It shocked both of us and thinking about it later we realized how much time and effort management had put into her training. She knew the story about the restaurant, really knew the menu, how the food was prepared and was a competent guide through the wine list.  How many restaurants have you been in where you have a question about a menu item and the server says "I don't know, but I will check for you."  Thank you Amy for your wonderful smile and extensive knowledge.  We will be going back to Paul Martin's and will request one of Amy's tables.

r3Z3QnC5ib1WZVu2TdmTnA.text: We had reservations for dinner, but decided to swing by the bar first to take advantage of the amazing happy hour.  I ordered a delicious raspberry martini and thoroughly enjoyed it.  We were seated and really enjoyed the classy, comfortable atmosphere.  I ordered the blackened redfish with spinach and lemon - so light and good!  Fantastic service too...coming in on Halloween night was a great idea as the restaurant was really slow.

QZNjL80NuT4SD7gb6uSTIQ.text: Tried it because of the Amex deal ($25 back on $50).  Solid 3.  Good service.  Nice decor. Overpriced drinks that I guess were not on happy hour.  Like that the menu changes.  Too much butter on the fish and spinach!  To many places to go back any time soon.

WHCRrjKE2Yi9ZgIBasGMYw.text: The food was pricey and the well drinks were ridiculously overpriced, thought for a minute I was in NYC! We had the prime rib medium rare. one came medium rare, one came medium. The waitstaff was the saving grace, they were very solititous.

d6JSw5ucod70P41R8_mriw.text: Amazing, gourmet-style food, with the additional distinction of being of the organic/natural variety.  And so much the better, right?  Probably more of a 4.5 star than 5, but Yelp doesn't offer half stars.

Lxrrs3gHMMFHv3KOfb6HVA.text: We live in Denver and come to visit Scottsdale once or twice a year. Dinner at Paul Martin's is always required, and we've never been disappointed. Contrary to what another review said, we've always found the service staff friendly and welcoming. Our latest dinner there was after a harrowing round of golf, and settling down in a booth felt like coming home. One of the features you have to notice is the quality of the butcher-block table tops. They practically glow, they're so clean. We started by sharing a grilled artichoke with aioli (sp?) sauce. I don't know how they make this dish so good, but it's better here than any others we've tried--and we've tried it often! My husband had the rib plate, with 8 big, meaty ribs and sides of coleslaw and french fries. He practically licked the plate! I had the Chesapeake Bay salmon, but put in a special request for spinach as a side, rather than couscous. I got the dish just as ordered, and it was delicious. The salmon was perfectly cooked, with a light onion sauce that was great. For dessert we shared 3 scoops of ice cream with shortbread cookies. The only shortcoming of the meal was the caramel ice cream, which was low on caramel taste or feel. The chocolate and vanilla flavors were great, and the shortbread cookies wonderful. Throughout our meal, our waitress and the rest of the waitstaff were cheerful and attentive. Yes, it was a pricey meal, but less than we had expected, and worth every cent of it! It remains our Phoenix favorite!

6974xpNXVhE8GJvHqU6lXg.text: This is the best food I've had in a long time!! I went here when visiting family in Arizona and the food, service, and atmosphere was amazing!! I will definitely come here again on my next visit to AZ! 10 stars

vnWytvBMlJFExgJSmT9Xpw.text: Reminds me of a Fleming's steakhouse...it is actually the same founder I believe...fantastic happy hour and great service at the bar. It was surprisingly busy at the restaurant for a Tuesday evening...Apparently they have a great deal going on Monday evenings for dinner for two for $ 53 that includes two salads, two entrees, and one bottle of wine (any bottle with a square next to it). Atmosphere is chill and luxurious at the same time, highly recommended...

05FpRnYOqf3kgsaVTGii7Q.text: Had dinner at Paul Martin's for the first time on Saturday night... the service, the ambience, the food and the cocktails were outstanding.  Our server was knowledgeable, helpful, friendly and efficient.  Definitely will go back, and highly recommend reservations as it was quite busy. Parking is a little shy, however, the valet service is free and the guys at the valet were extremely friendly and quick..

rchdp74iMlnwRqdwWNrJog.text: Took my family here for lunch on Valentine's Day. Was pleasantly surprised. Was told right up front that everything is made from scratch. We recently moved to Arizona from San Francisco where 'made from scratch' is the standard - so this made us happy. The food, service, cocktails, atmosphere was excellent. We had our boys (1 and 2 1/2 year olds) with us and felt welcomed. I really enjoyed our lunch and wouldn't hesitate to visit again.

dAlO6uOcEjUgf8Occ6IFeg.text: Went in for the first time with a friend a couple nights ago and Kathie was our server. She explained the menu and wine.  She gave us a couple of her favorite dishes and explained each of their preparations. My guest had the short ribs which were tender and full of flavor. I had the skirt steak and it was the best I've had. Kathie also recommended a wine to go with our dinner. We finished up with the pistachio ice cream. Everything was amazing and I can't wait to return!

7dTlYy2bR3i5lI7c5nY2CA.text: Happy hour is only in the bar but they do not make that clear when they are seating you. The experience was nice, very cute ambience but really just mediocre food. Probably would only go back for the homemade ice cream.

rgYgqoIUIMS-pKgdNnzrLQ.text: Here is a place that the food and service is always on point. Come for the Burger beer combo for happy hour, the burger was awesome. Not your traditional slider on most happy hour menus. Our server this last time was very attentive and even brought us hot towels after our meals. Great job!!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mushroom Soup!!!

9LhQgf0HlI3mIkR-15mxOQ.text: Stopped for lunch 1/26/16 after belatedly discovering that our intended nearby restaurant wasn't open for lunch. Great experience from start to finish--from the interior design and finishes of the restaurant space, friendly, professional service staff and our meal. Fond memories of the wild mushroom soup and lunch special enchiladas. My wife enjoyed the fish tacos. Well done Paul Martin's!

TAVhoEzwqS1vzuN6O4Y6BA.text: Went with a group last night and was surprised we were able to get in.  The service was very.....awkward.  It must have been our servers first serving job as well.  I chalked this up to being new so I'm not deducting anything.    Ordered the butchers board and appreciated the explanation about the different meats and cheeses. The "mine" bleu cheese was the best.  Ordered the prime strip and it was excellent.  Substituted the mashed potatoes and they were good but my friend said hers were cold.  She also just likes to complain.    Banana cream pie was good.  Had a kick to it.     Will be back again.

4tbzwHHTtTa7y5pO_A_Ofw.text: Went here for the first time last weekend and loved it!  The whole staff was very friendly and attentive, from the hostess, to the bartender, to our server, Hannah.  Everyone seemed to put hospitality at the forefront.  Their menu is full of enticing options, yet approachable; not too overwhelming.  My husband and I shared a grilled artichoke to start and I'm still thinking about it today.  It was that good.  Prepared perfectly and paired with a pesto aioli dipping sauce.  We both loved it.  Then we had the mushroom soup...I'm not huge on mushrooms, so I was hesitant to try it, but Hannah highly recommended it and I'm so glad she did.  It was so tasty!  Our entrees were awesome too; salmon and the ribeye.  I could honestly go on and on; we had such a positive experience and we'll definitely be back!

zJnR2KpKGNv2Y-EG_xyqOQ.text: Have to say, we hadn't been for about a year and always thought it was just OK and a good alternative to Houston's when faced with a 2 hour wait BUT, this is no longer just OK...it has turned into a great spot!  Good was exceptional as was the service (which I must say was always exceptional).  The short ribs, Salmon with quinoa and Meyer lemon, mushroom soup and Caesar Salad, all to die for!  I also appreciate the ability to order an exceptional wine by the glass and their options are that!  Atmosphere is stunning, warm and inviting.

IHs50FJIXabmgPbl5zGquQ.text: Was given a gift card so had a reason to check this place out. Don't think I would have known about it otherwise. Wanted to go for happy hour, made a reservation since it was Friday & wanted to guarantee a table.   Once we were seated in the empty dining room & I inquired about happy hour, I was informed it restricted to the bar area only. The bar area was packed & happy hour is restricted only to two picnic style tables & four high-tops on the right side of the restaurant. I really couldn't believe there were real estate restrictions! My boyfriend & I decided to sit next to each other instead of trying to awkwardly yelp across the large table (seriously, you feel like you're at kings of the knight table).   Our waiter from the dining side was amazing & super nice, but unfortunately we had to switch once we moved over to the bar. The service in the bar wasn't as great & it literally look about ten minutes to get drinks, but the margarita was really good!  As far as the food goes, I ordered the calamari because it caught my eye when they handed me the dinner menu. So that one was full price, but it was worth it because it was definitely ten times better than the salon street tacos I ordered. The sauce they use on them was so salty it was making me gag. To make it even worse, the lemon that comes with it was coated in salt. My boyfriend ordered the burger + beer + fries deal for $15 (which is pretty sweet since it's any craft beer). He said the burger was delicious.   I don't plan on going back to this place, solely based on the restricted happy hour. Their dinner menu otherwise is overpriced.

7abXFGURzHWq1FqkervAgg.text: Service was exceptional,  and everyone in the restaurant was very friendly.  I had the Cedar Plank Steelhead and grilled cauliflower,  which I highly recommend. The calamari was cooked perfect,  but the sauces were a bit spicy.

aR1R1D9BUE7_E6hweEZrpw.text: Absolutely top notch in my book,  While the regular menu surely is a little pricey, it delivers on the quality and taste.  A great cocktail & wine menu round it out.  As happy hours go, I really like the offerings. Not absolutely the cheapest HH prices, but really, you get what you pay for, and the HH offerings having me coming back for more.  Ambiance is casual elegant, and the service is always quite good.

jJ7duCng6ea8LIyRovBFdw.text: Some things happen by chance but even chance happenings are meant to be. Since another restaurant was still getting over brunch in the late afternoon and other area spots are steakhouses, Paul Martin's was the obvious choice for lunch.  So go ahead Paul, make my day. In fact...I think you've made my life. I can't dine out the same anymore, at least not for the next couple of weeks. Let me keep the memory of our rendezvous fresh in mind. Our time together was well spent.   It's nice to see an upscale restaurant serve customers quality food and filling quantities at comparable prices. Everything was easy to eat and I didn't get tired of any one dish. Needless to say I stuffed myself and almost considered sneaking a couple bites off the carnivores.   This is what they ordered:  SALT & PEPPER SHRIMP starter (19.00) - eight large shrimp, lightly fried and served with green onion shavings and pesto aioli. This looked so yummy. The fry was golden brown and not greasy at all.    BBQ PORK RIBS kitchen classic dish (26.00) - fall off the bone rack of meat with sauce and sides of french fries and slaw. The ribs looked large and plentiful. I didn't see any fat or chewiness on them.  STEAK & BACON TACOS kitchen classic (17.00) - two tacos of mesquite grilled angus in corn tortillas with avocado cucumber salad. I was told the meat was filled with quality and flavor.  COLUMBIA RIVER STEELHEAD sandwich (14.00) - a filet of grilled salmon topped with arugula and pesto aioli between a soft roll with a side of thinly cut fries. No morsel was wasted.  PM has a concise menu. Only one dish was labeled vegan: a warm quinoa bowl with mushrooms, avocado, and veggies, but few options can be ordered vegan without the aioli or cheese. Vegetarians have pickins from each section except the kitchen classics.  I ordered:  SEASONAL SOUP starter (8.00) - small bowl of creamy butternut squash with a drizzle of olive oil and a couple of croutons. Best bowl of butternut I've had. Mild sweetness which I enhanced with a dash of ground pepper.   THREE MUSHROOM burger (14.00) - mushroom and cheese patty topped with arugula on a brioche-type roll dressed with pesto aioli and served with a side of sweet potato fries.    FIELD GREENS side salad (6.00) - generous portion of fresh crispy greens and slivers of cabbage, tomato, red onion, and sunflower seeds in vinaigrette.  PAN ROASTED CAULIFLOWER side (6.00) - roasted cauliflower florets and whole garlic cloves in oil and lemon juice. The addition of the citrus gave a delicious tang and cut through the oil nicely. The menu lists parmesan cheese as another ingredient to the dish, but thankfully I didn't taste any cheese. It was good without it.  It's unusual for me to finish everything on my plate(s), but it helped that saltiness and seasoning were perfect. The fries didn't even leave a greasy residue on my fingers or face. That's good cooking!   5 stars for Paul Martin. Good service. Good food.

j0iMDYiCBR1XcQan12ULGg.text: A first class experience from the moment we walked in! We were immediately greeted and seated and the decor is very impressive. It was obvious that all the serving staff was very well trained by someone who cared. Valerie was our server and she was FIVE STAR awesome in the way she treated us before, during and after our meal!  We really enjoyed her professionalism! I had the fried chicken special and was SO happy I did! Great salad great chicken and great strawberry shortcake! We will DEFINITELY be going back!  Thanks for a great meal!

zDxU7XAHOnPb4P7Q5SLMaA.text: I went here New Years Eve 12/31/17  There was a lot of parking outside in the entry area  I thought that when I walked in with my party of 4 there was going to be a little bit of a wait but NO we walked right in to a nice table close to the bar!!   There was a good amount of waiters and waitresses!! It being New Years night there were less than I expected!  We ordered our drinks pretty quickly!! Once the waiter brought us our drinks he did not come back for a god 7-9 minutes!! We kind of wanted to hurry our dinner up because it was late and a long day!!   When he came to take our order the food came out pretty quickly!!   AMAZING RIBS AND MASHED POTATOES!!!    After all this a great family place to eat!!   We had to wait along time for the check and when we had it ready to pay it took awhile for him to get it!   9.5/10  - 0.25 for the long wait between drinks and ordering  - 0.25 for slow check return

dC2NYQRETeO7smiXuQbmBA.text: My husband and I visited this restaurant while on vacation. Needless to say, it was one of our FAVORITE places during our 6 day trip. Carl was our server for the evening...and, I have not stopped raving about our experience with him!! He went above and beyond our expectations. Didn't rush us, gave his personal opinion, when asked, and made sure that everything was to our standards. If you're ever in the area, DEFINITELY stop in and ask for"Carl!!" BTW, the food was DELICIOUS, too!!!

nQ5fn0o34PRsunlcngbsZg.text: Still 5 stars. They 86'd my smoke chicken and wings which was disappointing but had the salmon lettuce wraps instead. Again, another item that is deadly delicious.   For dinner had the brick chicken and it was perfectly cooked.   Overall, I will be back.

T6kaJGbBIJaFmZAjnHd2tQ.text: I love going to sit at the bar because they have an amazing bartender named Dustin Newcomb.  He is darling!  He is quick to deliver food and drinks.   Plus, is nice to look at and is great with conversation.

44Hc2c33ou29ZxXaJXEKJQ.text: Have gone here 3 times and the third visit will be my last. Went for steaks, and didnt mind paying the almost $50 cost for them. I ordered medium well, which is supposed to be mostly cooked with a slight amount of pink. It arrived medium rare for both of ua, and they were both sent back. Mine came back charred and over done, so it got sent back again. My date finished her entire meal and drink before we asked where mine was. Several minutes later, it comes back butterflied, and well done, and smaller in size(like they had cut my old piece down, flipped it into two connected pieces and replated it without the char). Disgusting! I was embarrassed for the waiter and flabbergasted that they would treat a customer that way. Restaurants come and go in Scottsdale, and the ones that take pride in their work are the ones I frequent.

Dp3Z8dem3bn02je7gZQgYw.text: Great menu ! Great service ! Not your average restaurant. Makes you feel special. Great waiter but I'm sure tired of super young snobby hostesses who can't get a real job & are pissed this is it at age 18 ! Lol

O56wFIns-K2p1WH7KUSEGA.text: Paul Martin's has a lot going for it - too bad the stuff on the periphery was bad.   Paul Martin's is a nice and rather classy steakhouse that definitely reminds me of D.C. steakhouses. The lighting is dark but pleasant, the music energetic but quiet, and the ambiance rather pleasant.   The food is also good. I had the Sunday special offering, which is salad, prime rib, and ice cream for $25. The salad was good and had a decent flavor palette without being overwhelming.  The prime rib was tender and had an amazing spice rub that took it to the next level, but the interior was something of a vast wasteland of okay meat. The desert didn't happen for me - they had no options for lactose intolerant patrons, which was rather disappointing (and perplexing, given the upper echelons this place places itself in).   The service was rather poor. The server was clearly overwhelmed at times - at one point, he responded to our lactose intolerance inquiry by telling us that the ice cream was gluten free. It actually became rather offensive when we were made to feel guilty about using one of their gift cards - I have no idea why a steakhouse would make paying customers feel so awkward about using a gift card they sold!  Long story short, the food here is four stars, the service two. Three seems appropriate.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A very generous and tasty helping of prime rib.

iRsOqzXPypycJ3yEdhq3jA.text: What a beautiful experience!!! Amy G. took great care of us. Impeccable service Amy! She will take great care of you. The atmosphere is classy, warm and welcoming. The food was outstanding! It's so hard to get a burger that is actually medium like I like it and not medium-well. This one was perfectly done. We plan to come back really soon and will bring friends! Thank you from The Freemans...

HLLGVHKFJwjpORK-pzZgMg.text: Great food, beer selection and happy hour.  Ask for   Steven at the bar.  He gave me excellent service.  The food and his knowledge along with a great personality made this a 10 out of 10 for me.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

NxM3RNuPXoeyPsj7wHmY-A.text: These were the Steak and Bacon Tacos with Avocado and Cucumber Salad absolutely mouth watering!  I apologize I didn't snap a picture of the Lemon Creme Burle with home made shortbread cookies before the plate was empty a must try.  Out waiter Cortney was on point and the patio was extremely comfortable

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. These were the Steak and Bacon Tacos with Avocado and Cucumber Salad absolutely mouth watering!

aMOnt871PUWHVuQTC8bUMw.text: There's something to be said about consistency. Paul Martin's will never stray so I'm a big fan immediately. I love that this is in my neighborhood so it's almost like me cooking at home. Reservations are suggested but I've always been able to slip in and enjoy the friendly staff and yummy food. If you can snag a seat on the patio, even better especially during this beautiful weather. It's cozy and perfect ambiance to canoodle.  As recommended and tipped by fellow foodies, I highly recommend the Raspberry Martini. I probably would have imbibed on the great selections of drinks but only more reason to return since happy hour lasts til 7p. I loved the calamari as a teaser to start. And the kale Ceasar is pretty filling especially when you add salmon or chicken. I have to say I swooned over the niman Pork Chop which is major kudos given I always choose steak. I think it takes finesse to cook pork to be juicy and tender; hence, I didn't share though the portion was so big I had leftovers. The brussel sprouts were perfect accompaniment to the entree. Who refuses mac'n'cheese should never sit at my table! The highlight for me is truly the staff. They have such an ease and joyful smiles that you want to stay til close. I thought it was kind they didn't rush us out despite past closing time. I have no problem ending my day here and so should you.

9RDYXGdap5aXtYLM1mVcig.text: STEPHEN IS THE BEST. I came from out of town for my birthday & Stephen was such a great server -- may I say the best I've ever had. You don't see many people like that. He made us laugh and we had such a great conversation! He was very attentive also.   I also was impressed when the manager came by and asked how everything was going and if there was anything he could do. My friend and I are both fairly young and we never get that sort of attention.   The wait for food was quick & the food was yummy!

6fhLWHJ1Bcf2CTGtALEdEA.text: Was here 2 separate times. On both occasions the servers were amazing (John and Paul) the food was amazing (American Burger and Grilled a chicken Skewers) and the drink (Bistro Cosmo) was amazing! Would definitely come back here again!

bZ-b7jKK5bWw-_SteXtclA.text: Fabulous! We're on a vacation in Scottsdale and tried this restaurant on a Sunday night.  They offer a prime rib special on Sunday's for $34 which includes sour dough bread, a wedge salad, prime rib and mashed potatoes (the REAL thing!) , and a dessert to end the meal.  I would recommend highly!  Next trip down to this area we will definitely book a reservation.  Also, outstanding service from our server, Carl, and the manager Anthony who greats guests at their tables.  Class act all the way around.  Definitely worth coming over to!

8slt7EjgfKo32yDLweG1Eg.text: I have been here a few times since my parents love the place and live close to it.  I can honestly say this is the best Happy Hour I have had in the Phoenix area and have been telling my friends to go check it out.  Where else can you get a small sirloin with a special sauce this delicious with shoestring fries (or garlic mashed potatoes if you ask) with a cocktail/wine/beer all for $13?  I have also had the dining room experience, and it was great, but the HH is just too good to pass up.  I tried the other things that my parents order on the HH menu and it's all very tasty and a great deal.  They insisted on giving me a free dessert for my birthday, that was three days away just because they are cool like that.  Go between 3 and 7pm any day in the bar and get blown away!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Devil&#39;s Food Cake, so worth it!
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sirloin with dipping sauce and garlic mashed potatoes, delicious

uRVin81hDNP28EaD-nQbqQ.text: The decor of this place is really nice.  They have black and white photos of food hanging on the walls everywhere that really make you hungry!  I also like their private "room" in the back for larger parties.  I put room in quotations bc the table is separated from the rest of the dining area by thick curtains.  Unfortunately, I was a bit disappointed with the entree I ordered: chimichurri steak with fries.  The steak was flavorless, or if it did have any flavor, it was overpowered by the STRONG charred flavor from the outside of the steak.  Basically, all I was tasting was something charred, with the texture of a steak on the inside.  And I ordered my steak medium rare so there was no reason for it to be so charred.  After a few bites I asked my friend if she liked the steak (she ordered the same thing as me) and she said it tasted fine, so maybe it was just me.  But she also likes her steaks well done with no pink inside at all.  Anyway, I didn't even finish half of it and just took the leftovers home to my dogs.  My dogs gave the food 5 stars!  But they also eat grass and sometimes their own poop, so that's not saying much.  On top of the overwhelming char flavor, the oil from the food (I'm assuming from the chimichurri sauce) was all over the plate.  It was too much oil!  and it was getting underneath the fries and making them soggy with oil.  Mergh, for $21 I expected more.  I did appreciate that they had regular parking, as well as a valet.  I hate places where you are forced to valet your car.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chimichurri steak with fries... not my favorite

fldBaFRnkM-VcPSHT-oWaQ.text: Had an enjoyable dinner last night.  The steaks were delicious and the side dishes were a great addition to the meal.  James was enjoyable as a server.  Would definitely go back.

bEjrNFyxZMErhtsNT1wgdQ.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!! Made a reservation for our 10yr Anniversary, a month prior. Arrived at the restaurant on Dec 31, 2018 for a 6pm reservation. The hostess staff seated everyone, including walk-ins before us. When we approached the hostess' she told me, we can take a table on the patio under the heat lamp. I refuse to be seated outside when others after us were seated inside. If you are a couple or family of COLOR...you certainly will be overlooked!! I've sent a email to the manager (Anthony) and guest relations manager (Whitney) awaiting a response to this unacceptable behavior!

M5Y8JXqh4-YmLvJjhQji1A.text: My girlfriend and I went there for our 6 year anniversary dinner. Maybe it was the late reservation, but our waiter was only friendly when the bill came and my girlfriends skirt steak was cold. We didn't send it back because 1) we just didn't want to wait and 2) not a friendly waiter. Based on the reviews we were really hoping to like this place, unfortunately we were not impressed.

T717OTG2ITPMZp_EwLKAQw.text: We were in Scottsdale for business/vacation and were looking for a restaurant with gluten free options.  Although it was a weeknight we luckily had made reservations as the place was packed.  Our server was great; tolerant and patient with our questions.  My husband was worried that the short rib would be dry (it wasn't) and I was worried that the filet would be over cooked (I said it needed to be "mooing ").  All of the food came exactly as we ordered and in a timely manner.  Even the side (spinach) was flavorful and not over-cooked.

Bt1NwkpgYxOhnLSvpnawFg.text: Thank you for a fabulous dinner & wine experience! Cortney was a perfect gentleman, polite and a wonderful conversationalist! He memorized our complicated orders and everything was perfect! We will be back soon, thank you!

a7ZQDRlGjlX1tWTs6sye_w.text: I personally think this is one of the better happy hours in the valley food wise. We tried the the steak frites with a drink for $13 bucks. Also the hamburger with tillamook cheese + drink also for $13 dollars. The quality and flavor is superb. The complimentary bread and butter is amazing! Their Mac and cheese side is pricey but well worth it. In this visit I also ordered the avocado tacos on the happy hour menu and we all enjoyed them. Will be back again! Shout out to our server Courtney. He was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wine and cocktails- HH
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cauliflower side dish
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado tacos-HH

B-I9ZkcEPvIvF9h-0QPOwQ.text: Great HAPPY HOUR! You have to sit at the bar or in the bar area for the happy hour. I've gone for their normal dinner, but it's a little pricey, so the happy hour serves as a great way to test out the food without breaking the bank. The food and cocktails are great!

fvuPTzDmPPeZ2WqtQGF4uA.text: Probably the best Cobb salad I've ever had. I ordered it with chicken instead of the steak. It was huge, which it should be for $18. That's the only reason I'm taking off a star. I feel like a salad should be at most $15. The dressing was so good! It was blue cheese with a lot of dill. Sounds kind of weird but it was amazing. I'm a salad lover and if you are too, you know how hard it can be to have the perfect dressing! This salad doesn't disappoint. We also ordered the banana cream pie and again it was one of the best I've ever had. You could tell it was hand made. It wasn't super sweet like you would expect, which made it that much better. Highly recommend it! $10 a slice and a good size for two people.   This restaurant has really great food! I just wish they weren't overpriced. The decor is nice and it's a great place for a date night or w friends but I still feel like they could take off $3-$5 from every meal and it would be more reasonable. I don't think there was much of anything under $20 on the menu. Most was priced much higher than that.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana cream pie. Amazing. Not too sweet!
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cobb salad with chicken instead of steak. It was amazing!
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish tacos. Really good but doesn&#39;t come with any sides. If you want veggies or fries it&#39;s extra.

GT-EX3uKpiCYDlnUAGNanA.text: My husband and I have been here many times and had wonderful experiences.  After our experience last Friday, we will not return.  Our waiter acted like we were inconvenient and even mentioned that he didn't want his area to be full of patrons.  He came by a total of 3 times during our entire dinner, we had to flag down other staff members to order drink refills, etc.  I ordered the salmon - it was flavorless.  I didn't know it was possible to have a meal so lacking any taste.  I did not finish it.  My husband ordered the ribeye, which was slightly better, but the mashed potatoes were cold upon arrival to our table.  Don't waste  your time or money.

J3lkhlX1FBH-DPWiTmvTOg.text: This is the first time we have visited this place, had friends here from Florida, the good news in we were seated right away without reservations,  the not so good ,  food took forever,  had a very rude waiter,  he would not listen, seem to have an attitude and looked down on us.  Bread was good,  fish good,  might try it again, but no time soon.  lots of folks like this restaurant,  maybe they see something we need, could take some lessons from Forking Fork and Uncle Sals, how to give good service.

e8qUPKnA4LoPsAvHFpS7Lg.text: Shared the Calamari, Blackened Ribeye, Short Ribs, Cedar Plank Salmon and Fish Tacos.  Can not start to tell you how much we loved everything about Paul Martins. Each dish was better than the previous one. The Blackened Rib Eye was prepared spot on and very juicy.  Loved the Calamari with the crisp batter but not dry and it being the real deal.  The Cedar Plank Salmon was also prepared well and very tasty.  Bread soft and fresh and the butter was soft and easy to apply to the bread  A small but detailed touch were the leftovers had written on each container what was in the box.  Absolutely loved this restaurant and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Apple Cinnabon Crisp
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cedar Plank Salmon
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish Tacos

00Ke14jtKGv33HxdFVySyQ.text: If you're looking for a great steak and great atmosphere then his is the place for you. I had the ribeye and it was easily one of the best steaks that I have ever had in my life. Will definitely be returning.

dKZ3OfRwbQ24gmm1LG_v4g.text: Lovely lunch on the patio. Nice place to visit with friends. A bit European - that is they allowed to visit and kept our coffee hot without any hint of "turn the tables". As usual the food was very good but not to die for. Just an enjoyable experience that was made better by our waiter John.

o-On98KHmWs99EfXu6Rc3w.text: I ordered the prime rib there and was disappointed. In their defense I'm not sure anybody can beat lawrys which is how I judge all of the restaurants by. The one thing they could've done is not serve me mashed potatoes cold. I don't think I'm going to give them a second chance there are too many great restaurants to choose from in Scottsdale

EQ762r8j7HrBWkZtBtzVNA.text: Great customer service and food! We did have an issue. We were visiting from out of town We called to make arrangements for dinner. We confirmed they accepted small dogs, gave our name, number a contact number. When we arrived our table was given to someone else. I asked to speak with a manager. Anthony greeted us and ask how he could assist. I explained what transpired and Anthony expressed that it should have been explained how the outside seating worked. He asked us to give him a few minutes. He made accommodations for us to be able to sit outside without almost no wait. Once we got seated our server Steven greeted us and took our order. The food was very good and the service satisfactory. I would come back here again.

v_DJQmXNbAtZg33oTSHCYA.text: Amazing food, great ambiance, and a reasonable price for the experience. We Will definitely be back for a date night or family dinner!

c5MisqOXAr9Ib6p9LIeK6Q.text: Just finished our, I don't know, maybe 15 or more meal at this great establishment. The crab cakes with chunks of crab legs on top was great. My steelhead (freshwater salmon) on cedar plank was excellent. My wife and son had the incredible shrimp with  linguini and cleaned their plates.  You have to have the, unfortunately now smaller, chocolate cake with the highlight brandy cherries for desert. The best part to us is the extremely friendly service.  Thanks gang!!  Kudos yet again

okZKOkkuRJNNqPZYwEGOkg.text: What and specifically where am I to eat in the Scottsdale area? Found it here - at the northwest corner of Rose and Scottsdale road! This is the new american cuisine to ease my curiosity of Paul Martin's style and techniques, and to ease my craving palate for different flavors. Oh the joys of summer has shineth upon us.   Our table was ready as expected with a reservation. Beginning beverage was the Raspberry Martini. House made infused raspberry vodka, lemon juice and sweet vermouth. Does indeed pass the sweet drink test! :)   Let's get straight to the food: Cedar Plank Salmon  - From the Classics. comes with shallots and bacon to give the powerful dominating flavors to best complement the cedar notes of the salmon, along with organic bloomsdale spinach, and crimini mushroom jus. This was a nice delicate dish to finish every last bite of.   Marinated Skirt Steak - thinly sliced with a pink center cut for the medium, with hearty mound of spinach on top.    Lemon Meyer Creme brulee - a seasonal dessert. Bits of lemon rinds in the creme brulee and 4 mini slices of lemon on top, and a couple biscuits. This is one of my many favorite desserts. I could just come back for this alone!   A phenomenal place for dinner, drinks and dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Calamari
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon Meyer creme brûlée
Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Marinated skirt steak

YOFA7AF7HtC-DjWbuweNow.text: Love this restaurant.  Great atmosphere.  Great service.  They have a great lunch menu and a really nice dinner menu.  This is definitely one of my go to places.

liOw0zmhAvSzJK6_Jnx_RQ.text: Fantastic dinner service. The customer service here is top notch and their food is some of the best I've had. My girlfriend and I were in Scottsdale for vacation and decided on Paul Martin's for dinner - so glad we did.  We sat at the bar for a few cocktails and some of the salt and pepper shrimp. They had live music and the musical guest was excellent.    Our Bar tender was very courteous and engaged in some friendly conversation with us while we enjoyed our drinks.  The manager stopped over after we got our appetizer and checked in with us to make sure we were enjoying everything.  I thought that was great.  Once we sat at our table our server was absolutely awesome and very knowledgeable of the items on the menu. My girlfriend ordered the steelhead and I must say after I had a bite I wanted to eat the whole thing. It was perfectly cooked and seasoned just perfectly.  I had the steak tenderloin (med rare) and it was done exactly how I wanted. We had such a great exreperience. Paul Martin's does everything right. Thank you for being such a classy, well-run, high quality restaurant. If I ran a restaurant I would want it to be run just like this place.   Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salt and Pepper Shrimp...I could eat these every day for the rest of my life.

l-4vEsa61YfGiZrCGYhQzg.text: I love coming here for HH whenever I am in Scottsdale for work.  The food is very well priced considering it's on the fancy side.  I love the burger here.  Drink prices are also great and the bartenders here know what they are doing.  Highly recommend for HH.

wSNjcLzbFUe8625x1mRW3Q.text: One word...service!  I'm extremely impressed with their service here. Our server was attentive and my water was always filled. Only thing was he didn't refill our bread.  We ordered the cheese board, mussels, chicken parm., and the clam linguine. The mussels are tasty and spicy (be warn). The chicken parm. was decent but I would recommend ordering something else. My clam linguine was delicious. Perfect amount of clam to linguine ratio!! Now that's hard to find.   Overall, I would go back again. Just have to pick the right dish!

XvUh7E1ePb5uDhhVpujKtw.text: I had a much better experience the 2nd time so am upping the rating! Most everything was spot on from the service to the food. Don't miss the Grilled Artichoke and Salt and Pepper Shrimp appetizers. Both were great! The Mesquite grilled salmon was far better than the wood plank salmon entree I had the 1st time. Pan-seared cauliflower side dish was also very tasty.

TMV1Zx4_Bc-PMaUbukKLmA.text: Saturday afternoon is a great time to sit down for an amazing meal. The fish & chips were good, and the NY Strip was perfectly cooked, medium rare. But, the desserts were to die for! We will definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Paul Martin's American Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The oysters and calamari are &#34;holy cow!&#34; delicious! Our family is unwinding and feeling quite content as we await the main course.

3U2SkBj5VY0otjedg6Zwfw.text: Talk about a great place... The atmosphere is really nice.. They have a splendid outdoor patio for happy hour...  The happy hour menu is solid for food and drinks.. 5 buck mojitos...  We enjoyed dinner as well.

MuWGY9P97cGaIgIB-K8NZQ.text: This restaurant is exceptional! Food and service are top notch. The Moscow Mules were  refreshing, entrees were delicious and perfectly prepared. Dessert was the Lemon Creme Brulee. We will definitely be back...again and again!

FDPY24D6pY4fUWZt1fXH3Q.text: Love this place! The food is great and the drinks are always on point! I've been here for the Father's day brunch and now we are here for the Mother's day brunch. It's a little on the pricey side but it's well worth it!

XLkpBYb73uxW_L4ya6zrkA.text: REALLY loved our evening at Paul Martins!  Thank you for a great time ~ best food & best service!  Seriously, as good as it gets.

sGiF1dNFK72Kny5Su1hjFg.text: Atmosphere: casual dress code with a nice ambiance.   Service: Awesome, water glass was always full and our food came out timely. Our server was knowledgable. Every employee we talked to was very polite and courteous.   Bread & Apps: Home made freshly baked bread. Fluffy and delicious. We got the calamari and some oysters. Everything was awesome.  Dinner: I had the ribeye she had the chicken. Steak was cooked perfectly and seasoned deliciously. She loved the chicken. Both were served with mashed potatoes which were damn good.   Too full for sweets. Although they do have some home made ice cream which was tempting.   Everything here is cooked fresh daily. None of the sauces are pre made. You really can taste the difference. The price was also very fair. I've paid more for similar meals. With everything above including a glass of 12 yr scotch and a glass of wine our total was $120 + tip.   I definitely recommend checking them out.

00sPi3gl5yijAPw6PaIysg.text: Had lunch today with a friend. This could be a great date place.  It has a lovely interior and the outside patio looks like a great place for a date.  We both had the Grilled Salmon. I like mine cooked well and often that means dry and overcooked. It's tough not to over do. But Paul Martin got it just right. It was cooked all the way through and still moist. I thought the portion was large - especially for lunch. The bread didn't win any points. It was kind of a slab of bread and easily skipped (helps the diet plan!). We ended with their Banana Cream PIe and coffee. The Banana Cream pie had a thin layer of chocolate. It didn't overwhelm the bananas. Banana Cream pie can be a heavy dessert. This was light and didn't overwhelm the senses. The coffee was great. Everyone who worked there, were pleasant, polite and had great smiles. They certainly gave the feeling that we were welcomed.   The only things that slightly f took away from the experience. We were at a booth right next to the kitchen. There's a whole row of booths that are parallel to the kitchen. There was a lot of noise before the restaurant was half full. We sat at the outside edge of the booth to hear over the noise. Odd for a place like this.  And the service was great once they discovered us. I sat for over 10 minutes without being acknowledged by a waiter or asking if I wanted a drink while I waited for my friend. My friend arrived and it was almost another 10 minutes before we were noticed. The waiter made up for it - service was amazing after that. Just odd because the restaurant wasn't that busy and many waiters went by but no one seemed to take notice. Very minor point and certainly the waiter gave fantastic service after that.

Zqf0aSaYEDvJynKuvtpBNA.text: The Brussel sprouts were so horrible I returned them after one bite. It was still on my bill when I got the bill. Trying to order was an ordeal. I explained to the waitress that I was vegan and would like the pasta. I asked them to make the pesto for me without the cheese which is very easy to do. She said they could not because they make it in big batches. This really means they do not make it at all. It is ordered pre-made. I asked what other sauce is available. She said they could add a butter sauce. I asked if they use a vegan butter. She said no. I asked about the Brussel sprouts. She explained everything on them including bacon as though that was a vegan product. I told I do not eat bacon. She said it could be made without bacon. I had to eat sweet potato fries for dinner because I did not want a salad and the Brussel sprouts were horrendous.

pOTXgz6oIpxI3Eh17UOmvg.text: Passing through from Houston to L.A., we chose this place and had no regrets. From start to finish and considering every aspect of a dining experience, this place ranks in the top 5 meals we've ever had.  Touche Paul Martin (Fleming), you've done it again.

3EyF5Wxiu2oZeyqNHutbPA.text: First time here at Paul Martin's and we found the experience very delightful. Steven, the waiter was prompt courteous and very attentive. The food was exquisite as well as the atmosphere. Will definitely be back.

Rtx-xDRgIqMmlQUiRJ0EMQ.text: Best happy hour ever! I was in town on business and found this place while looking for something else. Happy hour steak frites at $13....WITH A BEER! Yes, truly wonderful. The prosciutto crostini was delicious and had so much meat, I can't believe it's only $9. I will definitely be back!

ybTMiEp9E9U4XuPI_2ZUdg.text: The quinoa salad rocked- added steak, which really added texture. Loved the flank skirt, tender, cooked perfectly. Great evening!!

e6gb_WwD6yp_RCzqG3Pqlw.text: Four and a half but for a corporate chain very impressed! Great grilled artichoke and organic greens followed by excellent salmon and king crab legs. Nice wine list, not super original but good and good kids meals with much appreciated fruit as well as fries. As a plus, the music was straight from my IPod, Vampire Weekend, Spoon, Bright Eyes etc. Manager checked on us and server was efficient and pleasant.

d2UaXbCyDxrTxqH2g0r5Zg.text: Went to Paul Martin's for dinner and drinks with some work colleagues tonight and one of my co-workers asked about possibly ordering off the happy hour menu with our group who was all ordering dinner. Our waitress Amy who extremely accommodating said she would ask her manager for permission. The manager came over and told our group no there is no ordering of happy hour allowed in the dining room and he would not even allow the member of our group to walk to the bar and get a happy hour drink and bring it back to our table where the entire rest of the group was ordering food. I have been in restaurant management for 8 years and know how to handle customers and this situation was handled horribly. I'm from California and have worked in high end restaurants for years. The manager came over and basically whispered so other guests wouldn't hear. The name of the manager at the establishment was Clyde. The only reason I am giving this establishment a 3 star review is our amazing waitress Amy who did an outstanding job of handling the situation and keeping us in the restaurant after the extremely abhorrent handling by the manager.

TSOgkPovhLHfMB5dQHnmUA.text: I think they are still finding their footing, but the staff was all incredibly nice and accommodating, in sure if you alert them to any issues they will take care of you. I enjoyed my brief time here, for sure.

TNK_9Orck_yQDPrFqSZgEg.text: This place only got 2 stars from me because they treat people badly based on there clothes. I was there with friends for a causal dinner and felt unwelcome and definitely got treated that way as well. I ordered a hamburger and after it was still not cooked correctly after the 3rd time. I was definitely ready to leave. Management never came over to speak with us or even apologize. But I did see them at other tables laughing and chatting with other customers. People still have yet to learn NOT to judge a book by its cover. I Will never be going back here again.

oiOsnLrvW_BzuYrZMGnOAA.text: AmEx sent me a promotion for this place so I decided to check it out.  I got the skirt steak, the meat was very very good, cooked to perfection and very well seasoned.  Everything on the plate was great except for the portion.  I know its an upscale restaurant, but for almost 30 dollars you get 3-4 little pieces of steak, a bit disappointing. I also ordered the banana cream pie like someone recommended here, but I was not a fan, the cream tasted like it had been stored uncovered in the fridge with onions and garlic, not very pleasant.  The service was very good.  I will probably wont go again for food, maybe for a drink during happy hour since the place is really nice and has a trendy atmosphere.

-yiSZAAOs_zM8UFANCIdKg.text: "Meh- I've experience better" totally sums it up.  With each course, there was something from at lease one member of my group of four that was returned to the kitchen.  Our artichoke appetizer was not cooked through.  My wife's fish, though ordered medium well was served medium rare.  The apply crisp was just a sugar coma on the plate.  The server was nice and that was the best part of the meal.  They did take care of the dessert to make up for the issues with our other items, but since that wasn't great either, we probably won't be back.

vIsww61tKYHniuKrWYXLig.text: Paul Martin's used to be J Alexanders and I liked the old restaurant. Food was very good at typical higher end Scottsdale prices. $14 cheeseburgers. $28 entrees. $8 Carrot cake was awesome. I was disappointed to see it go out of business.  Now we have a California restaurant in it's place. I knew that the second I sat down at the bar. The place mat gave me the entire lowdown on the chickens. You know, the fact that they are not kept in cages. Is this important to you? Me neither. I just want a good meal with friendly service, nice atmosphere and a decent price. In this case, 3 out of four ain't bad.   It's California cuisine because it's food with a social conscience that beats you over the head. Free range chickens, ethical farming, fair trade espressos... you get the idea. if you love that sort of stuff (and in reality, I know it's probably your girlfriend who does) than bon appetit. Have a not very large and average tasting $15.50 cheeseburger (cheese is extra) and sleep better because the chickens aren't in cages.  The place does have a nice atmosphere, but so does Houston's across the street and so did J Alexanders.  Very friendly wait staff. Food delivery was quick. Beer selection is limited. Maybe the wine list was better. Don't know. Not a wine guy.  I left wishing I had been able to find a seat at "Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers" in old town Scottsdale. Good food at a decent price. Do they have ethically farmed local ingredients? They don't say and in all honesty I couldn't care less.

F3UIFFZUnAujpSyzoZr-1A.text: In from Payson for the night. Heather was our server and she was awesome! She gave great recommendations on our wine and food. Very nice atmosphere. Enjoyed our time away from home. Food was very good and reasonably priced. Will visit again!

YopHppbm6-1Rctgs1LexsQ.text: I have never had a poor experience at Paul Martin's, the service is impeccable.  The manager both seated us and brought our wine.  The food is incredible, I haven't had a meal that was less than exceptional.  It functions as a well oiled machine.  Everything about Paul Martin's is superb, I ALWAYS look forward to my next visit.

V34o6YxKfB_d2YrGEBiMZw.text: I have been here several times and I absolutely love it. The food is amazing, the atmosphere is nice, and the service is consistently on point. I also LOVE that the majority of the food is local and organic. I had a girls night there this past weekend and we had a blast, the manager Mike came by and was super nice. My favorites here: mushroom burger, mushroom soup, kale Ceaser, the steak w/ chimichurri, short ribs, banana cream pie, chocolate cake and there is a lemon champagne cocktail that is delish!!

q2SpesqiNFBSwfglcB_XRA.text: I wish I could give 3.5 stars, because I am torn.  Paul Martin's is just "okay."  The atmosphere and servers/service are great.  However, the food is nothing to write home about.  The selection is rather small, and the price was a little high for what we ate.  They also made some odd choices, like the fish tacos are salmon instead of the usual white fish.  The portions are a good size, and the French fries and mushroom soup were good.  I might try this place again one day, just to see if I can get a truly "4-star" experience.

BEqByKtj68Zk_85zz2ci7A.text: Great place . Monday special with salads entree choices and choice of several bottles of wine a great deal at $50 . Tuesday night fried chicken dinner at $20 also. Friendly efficient service. We will be back next time in Arizona for sure!

Z4p7R2rFaYGWq-TRxK0KzA.text: I'm really shocked and suprised at the reviews.  Yes, great atmosphere and great service, but the food is ok considering the price.  I would rate this an overpriced resteraunt wuth good food, but on the bland side.  Not worth the money.

23ej-G3szRS4QYH1vbQQ4A.text: Came into the restaurant without a reservation on a Saturday with my wife and 7 year old son.  Was seated promptly despite not having reservations.  The service was efficient and friendly and very accommodating towards my child.  Although there was no children's menu, waiter helped us figure out a good option.  Ordered the salmon and steak and must say to our surprise it was beyond delicious.  Plus my son's mac & cheese was outstanding.  For those like us visiting the area for vacation, this is a great place to spend a meal.  With all of the options in Scottsdale and navigating local culture and attitude this was a no brainer.

O96auu9Bc5JVy7FB63-RVQ.text: We thoroughly enjoyed this new restaurant.  The place has a good vibe and while we came with my mom for dinner, my husband and I would absolutely come back to just enjoy drinks at the bar.   We were seated right away and had great service from a well trained waitress who knew seemingly everything about both the drink and food menus.  Our meals were delicious and we all agreed we would be back.

X3mvsmkYuLkzlkdCY8k2Sg.text: Divine! Excellent service, attitude and food! Reminds me of houston's service and attention to detail wise. The kale caesar is yummy! Calamari is piping hot, artichoke is delish. Short rib is ammmmmazing. The grilled polenta sooo gooood, added prawns to it, they were perfectly cooked and went well with the dish. Will be back! Again excellent, very cordial service.

yUcQeQKqzKxNBWYuJDkr4g.text: This place has unexpectedly become one of my favorite if not favorite restaurant in Scottsdale.   I originally came here because it's close to my house and offers 1000 point tables on opentable.   I have since been back several times.  They have great specials Sunday through Wednesday.  Monday's they have a 3 course dinner for two and a bottle of wine for $49.  Tuesday's they offer a 3 course fried chicken dinner for $22.   Besides the fried chicken,  my favorite dish here is the brick chicken.   It's perfectly marinated with the perfect amount of herbs and spices.   Their menu is simple and delicious.

0hAa_v54fxniueJUrtE-Bg.text: Honestly surprised this place has received a bunch of 5ers...  They've redone the old J. Alexanders - the patio is spacious and airy and today at least [it's still spring...] had blooming orange trees so the atmosphere was really pleasant. We sat at one of the sofa/table combos and it was comfy and not at all awkward to eat. Decent crowd, nice hum and could have our own conversation unimpeded by surroundings. Boom. We were firing on all cylinders. Until the food.   Service was prompt and attentive but not hovering. BP [biz partner] had the Asian Chopped and our server Dustin suggested the Greek Salad with Lemon Prawns [I was wavering between that and the Grilled Salmon Sandwich.] We both had iced tea - crisp, unsweetened, fine. Our salads came out and I was jealous. The Asian looked more appetizing than mine - better presentation and overall just looked more appetizing. Mine had whole butter lettuce [I mean, okay, but really? It's a salad. Why do I need to cut my lettuce, peeps?] Two different kinds of olives - which, if I really was an olive fan would have been great because there was very little else of substance. There was a nice amount of feta, way way waaaay too many tomatoes and I'm sorry, THREE prawns. Three. They tasted good but for $16, I would've had more protein if I'd ordered the sandwich. It just isn't a good value nor that great.  [$40 before tip for two salads and iced tea.]   It's just a 'meh' from me - even the outstanding patio space doesn't save it.

Ch9OtzTE60D3p5VsFwH42A.text: Great food and cocktails!  We went for the Monday night special and had the pork with hoisen sauce. A very good dinner and enjoyable time was had by all!  I've been here for apps and cocktails on previous trips to town and always enjoy it here!

BF6uhfmn4Ix01832J-d8pA.text: Came here last night with a bunch of friends after reading the yelp reviews. Thought it would be a good place to try. The food is really good! I had the Blackened Ribeye Steak and it was delicious! I highly recommend that steak. The reason why I gave this place only 4 stars is because the water glasses are too small and the service was just okay. I had to ask multiple times for water. In a restaurant like this, you shouldn't have to ask for water.

hcD5bfWgd2D52NeP1_Hd0Q.text: Hi, I go to Paul Martin's with my assistant every Monday night! Not only do they have a fabulous happy hour, our bartender Derek is always sweet, and attentive, giving us great service. He always remembers exactly what we like to order!   I would recommend Paul Martin's for anyone looking for some casual, upscale dining. Go no further than Paul Martin's.

qgFy9docNJL_qyu88WKTJg.text: We went a few weeks ago.  Everything was good.  Calamari was flavorful and cooked perfect.  I had the chicken under a brick and it was pretty stellar.  I'd go again for that.  Perfectly cooked.  The mahi my wife had was a great dish too.  Drinks were well poured and everything was reasonable in cost.  We'll go again

qO_4oS0QWRLBB4wfCjvd5g.text: Ordered the eggs Benedict, which arrived cold after over a 30 minute wait. The potatoes that came with it were mediocre. Fruit plate and bread that came before the meal were very good, overall I was not impressed

GttCatZVwor8_mOpaDo74w.text: Fabulous service, delicious food. I can't rave enough about their chocolate cake with cherries. YUM

K8IcJu7YZnL2GRs6GmbgmA.text: Very disappointing.  My kale Caesar had way too many anchovies for my taste.  Changed the whole make up of the salad.  My wife had the bbq pork ribs.  So fat.  And she subbed the French fries for a sweet potato.  It was actually a potato with sugar and the server argued it was an  organic sweet potato.  What a joke.  I would never come back

cRDz7SVjn9MosK0U8CUI9A.text: We went to Paul Martins last night for dinner and were very pleased with our experience.  This is a brand new restaurant created by the owner of PF Changs. Our waiter, JASON, was terrific and super knowledgable providing us descriptive details of the food and suggestions such as a Pinot Noir imported from California.  This restaurant has a woodsy/steakhouse decor mixed with a zen ambiance of candles and stones. It is a casual atmosphere where you can dress up for a three course meal or come in and watch March Madness at the bar.  I highly suggest the salt and pepper prawns appetizer.  Again, most of my credit goes to our waiter who was extremely knowledgable, attentive, and accommodating.  I will be returning back for sure!
